Eventually, you will find a robot named Pipo, who can get through vents and other small spaces that will help you solve the many puzzles that stand between you and freedom. Naturally, you will encounter resistance but you can get rid of the enemy with some well-timed punches and kicks. Will you be able to recover your memory and escape? The only way to find is with OVERBLOOD.

title: Wild ARMs
description: Wild Arms, a role-playing game with classic anime style graphics, takes place in a mystical world known as Fargaia. The story begins in Adlehyde Castle, where three strangers meet for the first time and team up in order to save the world. With the help of two legendary alien races, the three will set out to conquer the Metal Demons. As the story unfolds, players are introduced to different towns and mazes of Fargaia, conquering the terrain by foot, by boat, and even by the shoulders of giant Golems. Styled like a classic sprite-based RPG, Wild Arms also has full 3D polygonal fighting sequences filled with multiple weapons and spells and uniquely designed monsters and bosses.

title: Rage Racer
description: Fast arcade-style racing returns to the PlayStation in RAGE RACER, the sequel to the popular RIDGE RACER. Players choose a car then head out to the track. After notching a few wins and earning some credits, the car can be upgraded to improve its performance or another car can be purchased. There are a total of five upgrades for each car, meaning any slow-moving vehicle can be upgraded to a speed monster. A new class system has been implemented to divide the races: each class has a certain number of cars that qualify for the three or four races within the class. Each car can also be customized, from body color to the logo on the hood, using preset graphics or a custom graphic that the player designs using the built-in editor.

title: Star Fox 64
description: The update to the 16-bit Super NES title continues the original's on-rails 3D shooting action on the Nintendo 64. Starring Fox McCloud, Peppy Hare, Falco Lombardi, and Slippy Toad, this new 64-bit version contains 15 plus levels, easy, medium, and difficult paths, forward-scrolling levels as well as full 3D realms, and a three-part multiplayer mode using a four-player split screen. In addition to plenty of Arwing action, the game introduces a new hover tank and even features a submarine level. The 8-megabyte cartridge also boasts voice samples from 23 different characters instead of the original's animal noises.was the first game to feature Rumble Pak support. A Rumble Pak bundle and standalone version of the game were sold. Released in Europe under the name.

title: Swagman
description: Swagman has a plan to take over the world and he's started by capturing the Dreamflight fairies. Without them, people are unable to awake from their dreams. This gives Swagman the opportunity to trap everyone in their own nightmares. Fortunately, a pair of eight-year-old twins who refuse to go to sleep, have a chance to stop Swagman and his plan. They must travel through the waking world to find keys and other items to gain access to the Territories, or dream world. Once in the Territories, the twins will transform into Dreambeasts that are capable of great feats of strength and agility. When facing enemies, the twins must use the most deadly weapon available to them, a flashlight, which will destroy the many nightmare creatures the twins will face. It's up to you to wake the world in SWAGMAN.

title: Grand Slam
description: Baseball makes another appearance on the PlayStation with GRAND SLAM. Use the Practice mode to brush up on your baseball skills, and then hit the field for a friendly game in the Exhibition mode, or experience the unique challenges of a Season or Tournament. If you don't have time for a full game, you can use the Home Run Derby to get in some quick action. No matter what mode you play, all of your favorite baseball players are here thanks to an MLBPA license. An innovative power meter-based batting and pitching system puts you right in the middle of the action. Since the animation is motion captured, the players have smooth, fluid movements. GRAND SLAM has all of the modes and action baseball fans love, only with this game you don't have fight traffic to get out of the stadium parking lot.

title: Triple Play '98
description: Grab your mitt and dive into the action with TRIPLE PLAY '98 from EA Sports. Take command of your favorite professional Major League Baseball teams in stunning stadiums modeled after their real-life counterparts. Revel in the sound of ball against bat as you whack another homer into the stands and take your place at the plate as famous MLB batters and face down world-renowned pitchers. You can also play in historic ballparks you've only ever dreamed of visiting in one of the series' critically acclaimed highlights. Access to all pertinent stats is readily available, and your mind will boggle at the array of information on offer. Round the diamond in a variety of modes like Batting Practice and Home Run Derby as you perfect your hitting stroke. Dolby Surround sound effects and color commentary from announcers Jim Houston and Buck Martinez will make you feel like you're truly in the game. Watch motion-captured player animations, trade players, and much more. With TRIPLE PLAY '98, it's your swing that takes you to the top of the field.

title: Norse By Norse West: The Return of the Lost Vikings
description: In NORSE BY NORTHWEST, you take control of three Vikings that you must lead through a series of increasingly difficult mazes. Each Viking has his own area of expertise: Erik is very fast and has the ability to jump, Baleog is a warrior with a sword and mace, and Olaf has a shield he can use to block attacks. There is a total of 31 levels, each filled with all kinds of obstacles that will require the player to figure out how to use each of the Vikings' unusual talents. There are also two additional playable characters Scorch the dragon and Fang the werewolf who add a whole new set of skills and challenges to the game. At its heart this is an addictive puzzle game with an offbeat sense of humor and a formidable challenge.

title: Tail of the Sun
description: Life as a Neanderthal would be tough; your only goal in life would be to survive. However, you strength, agility, and intelligence are very low, not to mention that hunting for food is a dangerous endeavor. Saber-toothed tigers will eat you and mammoths will trample you. What is a caveman to do? Since life is tough, you realize the sun god does not like you. So you and your tribe decide to build a tower to the sky. To build the tower you need mammoth tusks, but in order to kill the mighty mammoth you must search the world for the magic food that will increase your innate abilities and intelligence. Once your tribe has gotten big enough and smart enough, it will be able to take down mammoths with the greatest of ease. Keep your eye on the prize and survive to build the tower in TAIL OF THE SUN.

title: Goal Storm '97
description: A teammate passes you the ball. You break free from the defenders and start a run towards the goal. Just after you enter the penalty box, the defense catches up and slide-tackles you from behind; you are awarded a penalty kick. Soccer action of this type can only be found in GOAL STORM '97. Pick a team, and play a friendly exhibition match or go for the glory of winning a tournament. If you just want some quick action, practice penalty kicks with the Penalty Kick mode. No matter how you play, the action is fast and furious. Should your friends want to challenge your dominance, make them pick up a controller and put their money where their mouth is with the Two-Player mode. Thanks to a radically improved graphics engine, GOAL STORM has never looked better. So, strap on your soccer cleats and prepare to strike the penalty kick in GOAL STORM '97.

title: Sentient [1997]
description: There has been a breakout of radiation sickness on Space Station Icarus, and you have been sent to investigate. After arriving at the station, you realize that radiation is only one of many problems: the Captain is dead, and a power struggle has ensued. To make matters worse, Icarus is on a collision course with the Sun and nobody is able to correct the situation. SENTIENT takes place in real-time, and your actions in the early part of the game will determine what path you will travel through later on. Who you talk to and what you tell them plays a strong part in the plot's development. Furthermore, how well you play the game determines which of the nine endings you are treated to. Try to save the space station and yourself in SENTIENT.

title: Psychic Force
description: In PSYCHIC FORCE, you pick from eight psychic fighters and take to the air in a menacing cube, the arena. You can move in any direction and the arena is quite large, meaning you can get away from your opponent relatively easily if needed. There are normal and strong projectiles at your disposal, giving you the ability of long-range attacks. If you're in close, your energy will be channeled to fists and feet, as punches and kicks replace psychic energy. When you perform a move, your Psy meter will slowly drain, so during the downtime of a fight you must charge it back up. Failing to do so will render you unable to perform any moves besides the basic projectile or punch. There are eight difficulty levels, offering enough of a challenge for rookies as well as seasoned veterans. The game modes include Arcade, Story, Versus, Group Versus, and Survival, as well as Psychiccer's Network and Psy-Expand.

title: NHL Powerplay '98
description: NHL POWERPLAY '98 offers all the NHL teams. Not only are real NHL teams with real NHL players available, but several Olympic teams also make an appearance. The graphics are also one of the many strong points here polygonal player models move exceptionally well and possess some realistic animations, including high-sticking swipes and some hard-hitting body checks. Basically, if you've seen it in a real NHL game, chances are you'll see it in NHL POWERPLAY '98. You can also take on a friend in the Versus mode to see who's the king of the ice.

title: Madden NFL '98
description: Madden NFL 98 captures everything you love about football. Huge hits. A burst up the middle. Tough play calls. A diving catch in the corner of the endzone. Roster decisions. You'll have to do it all to ger to the Super Bowl because this is the biggest baddest most realistic Madden ever.
platforms: PS Saturn Gen SNES PC N64

title: The Lost World: Jurassic Park
description: The dinosaurs are back in this monstrous sequel to JURASSIC PARK. Take a dinosaur-stomping adventure through Site B as you try to reach a radiophone so you can call a helicopter to get you out of there. But your journey won't be easy, because along the way you'll run into fierce, menacing dinosaurs that'll try to catch and eat you. Play as characters from the movie and use weapons such as the tranquilizer, rocket launcher, and the shotgun.  Featuring 3D graphics, music straight out of the movie, many levels and fast gameplay, JURASSIC PARK is back ... with bite!
platforms: PS G.com GB Pinball DC Gen Arcade RZone PS Saturn Saturn GG

title: NFL GameDay 98
description: NFL GAMEDAY '98 is loaded with features like Preseason, Season, and Training Camp modes. You can also choose to play as a skill player, like wide receiver or fullback. And when you consider that you also get a play editor, a create-a-player feature, over 100 touchdown dances, and accurate player attributes, you'll realize why the GAMEDAY series is one of the best around. You can also take on your friends (up to eight with the multitap) in the Versus mode.

title: GoldenEye 007
description: You are Bond, James Bond. Your mission is to recover the key to a devastating Soviet orbital weapon, GoldenEye. Fight your way through 18 action-packed missions, using a host of Bond-esque weaponry and gadgets. Along the way you'll have to escape from a bunker that's about to be vaporized by the GoldenEye satellite as well as crash through the streets in a tank. GoldenEye 007 also supports four-player multiplayer with a host of options and game modes.

title: Ace Combat 2
description: Ace Combat 2 is an action packed flight action/simulator game that allows a player to take control of some of the most powerful military jets in the world. One of them is the F-14, but Stealth Bombers are sure to please as well. When it comes to graphics, Namco has gone for a complete overhaul over the predecessor. Ace Combat 2 possesses some of the cleanest polygons ever to grace the PlayStation. This game possesses fully rendered levels ranging from submarine infested oceans, to anti-aircraft plastered canyon trenches. Namco promises that flight physics are true to the sky and the enemy AI has been tuned to a new a level.

title: Warcraft II: The Dark Saga
description: Blizzard quickly became one of the most famous software developers ever after releasing War Craft II on the PC. Now, the adventure comes home with WAR CRAFT II: The Dark Saga, for the PlayStation. The game is a real-time strategy that takes the genre to new heights by introducing new concepts that help to make the game easy to learn, yet difficult to master. The story is about a group of orcs and humans who are battling for control of the world. Each mission brings one side one step closer to complete victory, and the game lets players choose who they wish to take sides with. The PSX version even features some enhancements over its computer counterpart, making the gameplay more fluid while lessening any frustration over completing tasks that take too much time.  WAR CRAFT II: The Dark Saga contains an involving story, along with some of the most addictive play for a strategy game.

title: Machine Hunter
description: It is the year 2084 and humanity needs another gun-toting hero to fend off a horde of killer robots that are attacking Mars. In this overhead Shooter, you'll have to blast your way through a variety of mechanical and organic enemies in order to succeed. When you come across a robot, you can take him over and use his powers against his brethren, adding an interesting wrinkle to the gameplay. An innovative feature in this game is its use of the four-button firing system, which allows you to blast in any direction. There is also a two-player mode that lets gamers battle it out head-to-head in a split-screen mode. MACHINE HUNTER is a classic Shooter that fans of the genre should check out.
rating_content: Animated Blood and Gore, Animated Violence

title: Tetrisphere
description: If you think all puzzle games are the same, or that you've seen everything that TETRIS games have to offer   think again. A grand addition to the family, TETRISPHERE eclipses its predecessors, challenging you to explode your way to the center of an enormous sphere. Choose from a long list of robot characters each with different personality traits that includes Wheels, Jak, Rocket, Gear, Turbine, and Stomp. The 3D gameplay takes place over 300 different levels, each more challenging than the last. The main objective is to pull the right combination of pieces out of a giant, rotating ball forcing an explosion that will further open the gap to the ball's core. Each time you reach the center of the ball, you advance to the next level. If you get mixed up or take too much time figuring out how to make the combo, a block gets added to the outer part of the ball, making your job that much more difficult. Not only that, but three such mistakes will end your game entirely! With excellent audio-visual presentation and gameplay that's doubly worthy of the TETRIS name, this game is already a classic.

title: Ogre Battle
description: The Holy Zeteginean Empire came about as a result of the great war against King Zenobia. But the Empire was holy in name only, as the oppressive emperor rules through ruthless military force and fear. But on the shores along the eastern frontiers, the remnants of the Knights of Zenobia begin to stir. You must lead this rebellion against the Holy Zeteginean Empire, which is the last gasp of hope in this bleak world. OGRE BATTLE is a remake of the cult RPG or strategy game for the SNES, with a 32-bit upgrade. The game takes place through 30 strategic battles, each with a fair amount of role-playing customizability. You can equip groups with magic items, promote characters to new skill classes, and form new teams.

title: Porsche Challenge
description: If you've always wanted to sit behind the wheel of a luxury automobile say, a Porsche Boxster and feel the power of racing across highways and through towns, you're in luck. All-out realism is the order of the day, as PORSCHE CHALLENGE nails the details of each Porsche model down to the minutiae. You can choose from several different models (all Porsches, of course) and drivers. Each driver has different characteristics that make him great, so make sure to test them all out in your strides to find the one that most closely mirrors your driving personality. The turning radius for each vehicle is closer to that of a real Porsche than a videogame, and the courses are tough enough to keep you busy for a while. As the game progresses, you'll find that you earn the rights to some awesome shortcuts every time you win a race. If you're in Two-Player mode, you'll need all of the advantages you can get, as the head-to-head racing is very competitive. In addition to the regular One-Player modes, there is a Ghost setting that allows you to race against your own best time. Whether you're looking for realistic German motoring, or just a really good racing game, this is it.

title: NCAA Football '98
description: NCAA FOOTBALL '98 gives those of us who never attended Florida State or Michigan the complete college football experience. Play modes include Exhibition, Tournament, Great Games, Season, Practice, and Dynasty. You get 112 Division I-A teams and their stadiums, so you'll likely find your favorite major college team on the roster. The most exciting feature is a Dynasty mode that allows you to take a college team through multiple seasons. While the game does your recruiting for you, you can specify what types of players you need to bolster your team. If you're having a hard time finding a specific type of player, play, or team, you can take advantage of the Create-A-Player, Create-A-Play, or Create-A-School features. Now you can know the feeling of being in a bowl game playing in front of 10,000 fans, thanks to NCAA FOOTBALL '98.

title: Lethal Enforcers I & II
description: Plug in a light gun and dispense justice in LETHAL ENFORCERS I & II. In LETHAL ENFORCERS I, you must put a stop to an evil plot involving organized crime. You'll blast mafia hit men and explore a modern urban landscape, which includes docks and a Chinatown district. In LETHAL ENFORCERS II, you're thrust into the Old West and must take on stagecoach thieves and cattle rustlers. Both games feature digitized graphics that make all of the bad guys look as real as possible. If you don't happen to own a light gun, the standard controller is also supported. If you are looking for old-school shooting action, you should try LETHAL ENFORCERS I & II.

title: VMX Racing
description: Get ready for some intense motocross action in VMX RACING. Compete in either the 125cc (more agility) or 250cc (more power) class as you tear up the track. Jostle for position against other riders, but be careful of collisions or you're sure to go flying over your handlebars. Take your choice from eight motorcycles based on what you want in a dirt bike: from acceleration capabilities, to braking, to maximum speed. Adding to the realism, the controller actually lets you oversteer for the ultimate cornering ability. Race on six different tracks and try to qualify for three bonus tracks including a race on the moon. You earn points by either your finishing position or by performing radical stunts as you catch serious air on your bike. Compete in Single-Player mode or take on a friend in Two-Player mode using either vertical or horizontal split screen. Either way, you'll get down and dirty with VMX RACING.

title: Duke Nukem 64
description: "Come get some!" says bad boy Duke Nukem as you romp through the alien infested city of Los Angeles. Duke returns from a little vacation to save the City of Angels and destroy those scum bag aliens in this lead-packing sequel! You'll get more Duke one-liners and secret levels, such as multiplayer, which gives you the chance to blow all your friends away!  With all new weapons, more of the trademark Duke humor, and a soundtrack with bands such as Megadeath, this is one pistol packin' adventure that's high in testosterone and short on charm.
platforms: N64 Saturn Mac iPhone G.com GBA LCD GP32 Android Xbox 360 PC iPad Cell

title: NBA Live '98
description: NBA LIVE '98 is an improvement over the previous year's version, as it features a host of new options. One of the most notable features that fans of the series will notice is that you can still create your own players, but now you can also create entire teams.  Icon Passing is a popular staple of the series, which allows you to pass the ball to a specific teammate. You can also choose from a complete playbook of offensive and defensive plays that can be called on the fly, which keeps the flow of the game intact. With regard to game modes, you'll find Exhibition games, Season mode, Playoffs, and a new 3-Point Shootout mode. TNT's own Verne Lundquist provides the play-by-play commentary, which helps put you right in the game. You can also take on a friend in the Versus mode to prove your hardwood supremacy.

title: Jet Moto 2
description: Prepare for more futuristic racing action with JET MOTO 2. Jump onto a vehicle that is a cross between and hovercraft and a motorcycle, then get out on the track and practice using the grappling hook to make efficient, tight turns. Analog controllers are now supported for players who really want to get serious about racing, as well as 10 brand new tracks. The tracks allow you to speed river rapids, roller coasters, canyons, and a post-earthquake Los Angeles. If the tracks seem less crowded, it is because only 10 competitors are allowed on the track at once instead of 20. This keeps the emphasis on driving the track, not avoiding pile-ups. The racing of the future is available today with JET MOTO 2.

title: Cool Boarders 2
description: Imagine riding down the slopes, avoiding the trees and trying to hit the jumps. When you catch enough air, you grab your board, twist, and land a perfect 360 mute. All of the action and excitement of snowboarding comes to the PlayStation in Cool Boarders 2. Choose from seven different riders and 18 boards, then hit one of more than 10 courses to compete in freestyle mode, where the score is based on speed and tricks; or just concentrate on pulling off tricks in the big air and halfpipe modes. For those who want to test all of their skills, try the Competition mode and compete in all three events. When competition gets to be too much, try the unscored Board Park mode to practice all of your moves. If your friends think they get down the mountain better than you do, make them put their money where their mouth is with the Two-Player mode. All of the action in Cool Boarders 2 will keep boarding bums busy for days.

title: Time Crisis
description: The president's daughter has been kidnapped, and it's up to you to bring her back to safety in Namco's TIME CRISIS for the PlayStation. Armed with the highly accurate GunCon lightgun, you blast your way through tons of aggressive but clever enemies in a non-stop battle against the clock so you'd better brush up on your sharp-shooting skills. If you're too quick on the draw your shots will miss their intended targets; too slow and the clock will run out, ending your mission in disgrace. The unique "duck and reload" button is a welcome lifesaver just don't delay. The evil Kantaris is sending wave after wave of weapon-wielding baddies intent on taking you down. You can play in Arcade or Special mode, fight through a castle stronghold and an exclusive ritzy hotel, master one-shot kills, and (hopefully) rescue the girl. An exciting, action-packed blastfest awaits you in TIME CRISIS. Think you've got the skills to survive?

title: Maximum Force
description: Grab your gun peripheral and get ready to use some terrorists as target practice in MAXIMUM FORCE. This title is the follow-up to the AREA 51 This time around, after the aliens have been dispatched, you find yourself part of an antiterrorist group. You (and a partner) must go through three levels loaded with bad guys just waiting to play catch with your bullets. The bad guys also fire back so you have to have a quick trigger finger, or else risk eating a bullet yourself. Gamers who spent their good money on a gun peripheral should note that this game supports most light guns, including the excellent Guncon. Throughout the levels you will be find power-ups that give you much-needed health or increase your weapon's power. This game supports dual play, and is also filled with mini-games, so Shooter fans will be in gun-fighting heaven with MAXIMUM FORCE.

title: Treasures of the Deep
description: Prepare for underwater adventure with TREASURES OF THE DEEP from Black Ops. You are underwater explorer and ex-Navy Seal Jack Runyan, who is approached by the Underwater Mercenary Agency to carry out highly dangerous missions. The risks are great but the rewards are even greater. Choose from 12 missions in all parts of the globe, from the Great Barrier Reef to the Bermuda Triangle. Eight ships await your command start with an USN RV-1 mini-sub and trade up to the deadly Viper attack submarine.  An arsenal of underwater technology and weaponry aid you in your quest: steel-mesh wetsuits, night-vision goggles, homing torpedoes, and remote underwater robot vehicles are just some of the resources at your disposal. And you'll need each of them, as you must be prepared for the unknown dangers lurking in the deep. With breathtakingly realistic graphics showing an incredible diorama of undersea life and views of forgotten wrecks and Aztec ruins, TREASURES OF THE DEEP takes adventure to a new level deep sea level.

title: Discworld II: Mortality Bytes!
description: Rincewind and the citizens of Discworld are back for another adventure in DISCWORLD II: Mortality Bytes! The Grim Reaper has suddenly taken a vacation; with Death out of the way, the inhabitants of Discworld cannot die in peace. In fact they can't die at all. Since he saved the world from a dragon, everyone looks to Rincewind to save Discworld again. This time he must find the Reaper and return everything to normal. Take control of Rincewind, who is now a librarian, and use a point-and-click interface to search for death. The 25,000 cells of hand-drawn animation will help bring the adventure to life. When dealing with the Reaper, you never know what's going to happen. Play DISCWORLD II: Mortality Bytes! and discover why Death takes a holiday.

title: Nuclear Strike
description: In Nuclear Strike, you are an agent of Strike Team, an international special operations unit. The goal is to stop Colonel LeMonde, a former CIA Intelligence Officer, and his followers before they wage a nuclear war that would mean the end of the world. After stealing a nuclear weapon, the terrorists have fled deep into the lush jungles of Southeast Asia.You have more than 10 vehicles at your disposal, including jets, helicopters, tanks, and hovercraft. The different levels demand your skills as a tactician in order to accomplish each mission successfully. Optimal weapon selection, ammunition and fuel conservation, and POWs all play a part in your victory. The assault technique requires strategic use of the automatic target feature, the manual override, and left and right strafing buttons, among others. Destroy the evil terrorists and fight the good fight as you strive to save the world from total annihilation.

title: NHL FaceOff '98
description: NHL FACEOFF '98 contains all the basic features you've come to expect from a hockey game. All of 1998's 26 NHL teams are represented, and you'll find all the players as well. The season mode lets you take a team through a full schedule while you keep an eye on how the rest of the league is doing. Players can be traded from one team to another and created as well. This is Sony's first PlayStation hockey series, and graphically it's considered one of the best-looking hockey games ever to appear on the PlayStation. Up to eight human players can duke it out via a multitap.

title: NASCAR 98
description: NASCAR ¿98 offers 16 tracks 10 of which are tracks on the real NASCAR circuit and 24 drivers, helping put you right in the middle of the action. On top of the healthy selection of tracks and drivers, you also get all the real sponsors, so you'll feel like you're watching a race on television rather than playing on your PlayStation. Even further enhancing the TV-style presentation are the multiple camera angles that perfectly mimic those you see on ESPN. The soundtrack of the game features pounding beats that will get your blood flowing and your adrenaline pumping as you race around the track at speeds in excess of 200 mph. With impressive graphics, pulse pumping music, and real tracks and drivers to choose from, NASCAR '98 is the ultimate game for racing fans.

title: MLB '98
description: MLB '98 has the complete MLB license and features all the usual standards that belong in the dug-out: stat tracking, trade options, and our personal favorite, editing players. There is nothing better than putting yourself up to the plate against Randy Johnson - and hitting a homer. Many of the star players have signature stances and pitching wind-ups. In addition to that, while at the plate, the in-fielders will kick dirt away and hit their gloves. As opposed to pad-represented base throwing, MLB '98 uses a button-to-base throwing method. Pressing the triangle button to throw to second base, the X button to home, and so on.

title: Herc's Adventures
description: Hades has kidnapped Persephone, the goddess of spring. Fearing that Greece will be stuck in a perpetual winter, Zeus calls upon the three heroes of ancient Greece Hercules, Atlanta, and Jason to save Persephone. After choosing a hero, the player must fight through 40 different environments on a quest to rescue Persephone. However, the characters have different strengths and weaknesses, and understanding the advantages that each character offers is essential to successfully completing the game. Should you get stuck in a particular area or on a particular puzzle, a friend can join the action with the two-player cooperative mode. As you progress through the game, hand-drawn animated sequences reveal more of the plot. Help the Greek heroes save the world from perpetual winter in HERC'S ADVENTURES.

title: Syndicate Wars
description: In the future, two business syndicates are vying for control of the world: Eurocorp and Church of the New Epoch. To gain control, you will have to assassinate rivals, persuade neutral groups to join you, and destroy buildings and bases with a squad of cyborgs. In all of the tasks, you will take control of a team of four cyborgs that must be armed with a wide variety of weapons. Depending on the objective, there are a number of tactics to use. Since all of the missions are expensive, you must steal resources to keep your squad going. See if you can take over the world in Syndicate Wars.

title: Dark Rift
description: In DARK RIFT the action is never predictable as you jump into battle as one of a wide variety of characters, including Aaron Maverick, a human military expert armed with an MFG-16 blaster; Demonica Gkroux, an alien with flaming breath; Eve, an android trained in fencing; and Zenmuron, a mysterious warrior carrying a samurai blade. DARK RIFT is an all-out fighting game over pieces of the ancient Master Key, which grants ultimate control over an alternate dimension of unimaginable power. If the pieces of the Master Key are combined, it will open the Vortex a place where the secrets of the universe can finally be revealed. With three play modes Tournament, Two-Player, and Practice you can start at your skill level to defeat the 10 challenging characters. You can utilize either the analog control or the pad to execute moves like blocks, grab attacks, body slams, and special attacks.

title: Hercules
description: The action and excitement of Disney's film version of HERCULES comes to the PlayStation. Take control of the mortal son of Zeus as he tries to go from zero to hero and rescue the woman he loves. Have Hercules run, jump, and fight his way through level after level of bad guys. Whether it is by picking up boulders to dispatch enemies or knocking obstacles out of the way, Herc must interact with the environments. While the game looks 2D, Hercules can move along the z-axis, giving the game 3D play mechanics. With graphics that look like the movie and voice work by James Woods and Danny DeVito, you will think that you are watching the movie. Only you can help the future Olympian gain fame, save the world, and save the girl in HERCULES.

title: Battlesport
description: Your objective is to capture the ball with your tank and shoot it in the enemy goal. Sounds pretty easy, right? Think again. BATTLE SPORT offers 50 huge arenas, each very different from the next. You can shoot your opponents and drain their tank's energy in order to slow them down and steal the ball. Watch out though, because they can do it to you, as well. All the arenas and tanks are mapped with stunning textures, giving them a very nice effect. Each of the five available tanks has its own ratings for each of the following categories: top speed, acceleration, firepower, armor, cornering, ball handling, and more. With the money you gain from beating your opponents, you can buy special weapons and add-on items to upgrade your tank into the ultimate scoring machine. BATTLE SPORT is the extreme sport of the future are you ready?

title: Darklight Conflict
description: DARKLIGHT CONFLICT casts you in the role of the best fighter pilot on Earth, who is suddenly abducted by aliens. They want you to fly a space fighter and help them defeat their enemies; however, there is more to this than meets the eye. Take control of a fighter, bomber, and gunship as you use guns, missiles, and bombs to blast the bad guys into the vacuum of space in over 50 action-packed missions. If dealing with a plot is not your style of gaming, play the Arcade mode where you will face wave after wave of enemy ships. See how long you can survive while enjoying the brilliant graphics. Are the aliens that abducted you just peaceful space citizens or are they something more sinister? Play DARKLIGHT CONFLICT and the truth will be revealed.

title: Dynasty Warriors
description: KOEI enters the realm of fighters with DYNASTY WARRIORS, where every element of the game is realistic. Choose from over 10 warriors with unique weapons and moves from the three dynasties of third-century China. Rather than having 20-hit combinations, players can only get in three hits in a row. Adding even more realism, players can either block attacks or parry them for a quick counter. To make all of the playable characters look real, each one is constructed from 600 texture-mapped and shaded polygons. Every model uses motion capture technology running at 60 frames per second to make the movements as fluid as possible. Along with the realism, there is a large number of play modes: story, practice, time trial, endurance, team battles, and tournaments that can have up to eight human-controlled fighters. DYNASTY WARRIORS brings realistic weapons-based fighting to the PlayStation.
rating_content: Animated Blood and Gore, Animated Violence

title: F1 Pole Position 64
description: Based on the Japanese racing game Human Grand Prix, this FIA licensed variation adds real drivers and tracks to the mix.

title: Madden Football 64
description: EA Sports continues the bone-crunching NFL action with MADDEN FOOTBALL 64, part of its option-laden football series. You'll find offensive and defensive maneuvers at your fingertips, along with a user-friendly playbook. Put yourself in control of a franchise by signing and trading players, placing salary caps, and setting the playoff ladders of up to 16 teams. Thanks to a license from the NFL Players Association, you'll recognize all the current stars of the gridiron. You can also match today's stars against classic great teams of the past! Your team will face a variety of game situations: day or night, rain or shine. Along with expert commentary by Pat Summerall and John Madden, MADDEN FOOTBALL 64 gives you the highly-detailed graphics and playability you demand.  View the game from eight camera angles, substitute players, and select from three skill levels. MADDEN FOOTBALL 64 will challenge you with the realities of pro football, but with the easy control you expect from Nintendo.
platforms: N64 Saturn Gen SNES PS PC

title: 1080° Snowboarding
description: Hit the slopes for some serious shredding in one of the first truly realistic snowboarding games ever created! Start in the lodge and select from five characters, each with his/her own particular attributes and special tricks. Then take a look at the wide assortment of available boards and choose one that best suits your rider and style. Once you've got the gear, six different modes of play, including Match Race, Trick Attack, and Two-Player Versus awaits. Pick a course and get ready to experience a sensation of speed that'll make you forget all about the cold -- but it might just send a shiver down your spine. Throw in hidden characters and boards, varying weather and snow conditions, multiple paths through each course, and a variety of tricks to master -- topped off with rock-solid play control -- and you've got a recipe for winter fun that you can enjoy any time of the year. It's all the fun and excitement of the sport, without the bruises and frostbite!

title: San Francisco Rush: Extreme Racing
description: Careen through the "City by the Bay" at breakneck speeds as you find shortcuts, brave makeshift ramps, and uncover a myriad of secrets. Based on the groundbreaking coin-operated favorite, HARD DRIVIN', this update lives up to the reputation of the original. Experience eight unique racecars as you take to six different tracks, searching for alternate routes in order to get the best of your foes. Virtually everything is customizable here: you can select the total number of laps in each race, the number of opponents you'll face, and whether the course should be standard, reversed, or mirrored. Not only that, you choose weather conditions, difficulty level, and which gauges you'll be able to see you might rather have an uncluttered screen than access to your RPMs. All of these options certainly give the game as high a replay value as possible, and the obstacles are always different adding even more to the enjoyment factor. The game also has a dual-player mode in which you square off head-to-head with a friend (or enemy). If fast cars and cutthroat strategizing are your idea of a good time, get ready for the ride of your life.

title: Judge Dredd
description: In the 22nd century, the Earth's population has concentrated into vast urban areas where crime runs rampant. The police, juries, and trials do not exist there are only judges. Their only duty is to bring justice, and their only weapon is the Lawgiver, a gun that can fire armor piercing, heat-seeking, and high explosive rounds. In this bleak future, Tech Judge Bean has escaped from prison and is out for revenge. The only person who can stop him is the man who put him away, Judge Dredd. Plug in a light gun and travel through 16 city levels battling Bean's army of androids as Dredd prepares the deliver the ultimate punishment, a death sentence. To make the task a little easier, power ups like Rapid Fire are scattered throughout the levels. Play Judge Dredd and help him execute the law.

title: Tennis Arena
description: Fast-paced, arcade-style tennis comes to the PlayStation with TENNIS ARENA. You can choose from eight different players, each with has unique strengths and weaknesses. When you are ready for some action, play some Smash Tennis and try to beat an opponent in a single match on any of the five available arenas. When you want some extended competition, try to become the top-ranked player in the word with the World Cup mode. If you have friends who like to play tennis, hook up a Multi-tap and play some doubles. Now matter how you play, power-ups appear after you return the ball six times in a row, and special shots that are unique to each character are available after a nine-shot rally. Play tennis like never before with TENNIS ARENA.

title: Rampage: World Tour
description: If kicking the crud out of police forces, armies, pesky civilians, and giant skyscrapers is your cup of tea, RAMPAGE: World Tour might just be your salvation. In a raucous update of the coin-operated original, you choose from three monsters Lizzy, George, and Ralph and try to out-stomp your opponents. Featuring an eye-popping 130 regular levels and 14 bonus levels, you've got plenty of destruction in your future providing for a refreshingly long shelf life. It's not an overly complex game, but that's really its charm: pure, unabashed rage, and no messy story to get in the way. Midway has gone back to a time-tested favorite, and brought a perfect balance of faithfulness and ingenuity to the mix. The gameplay is similar to the original, but now you can kick, jump on top of airplanes, and bounce off buildings. You can also configure the controls just about any way you'd like, and the Nintendo 64 version supports up to three players.
platforms: N64 PS GBC PC PS3 Arcade Saturn

title: Pitfall 3D
description: In PITFALL 3D you're going to be taking Pitfall Harry (voiced by ARMY OF DARKNESS star Bruce Campbell) across levels built using the classic PITFALL formula. In other words, you'll see signature items like the swinging vines, nasty scorpions, gold bars, and plenty of jumping action. Everything is well placed in new environments, but some conventions, like the swinging action, are still pretty fresh among the new platformers. The story sees Harry entering another dimension that's being enslaved by an evil being called The Scourge, who's changing all the world's magical energy from good to bad.  PITFALL 3D is considered by many to be an excellent update of a classic game. Can you save the world from The Scourge? The only way to find out is to play PITFALL 3D: Beyond the Jungle.

title: San Francisco Rush: Extreme Racing
description: Careen through the "City by the Bay" at breakneck speeds as you find shortcuts, brave makeshift ramps, and uncover a myriad of secrets. Based on the groundbreaking coin-operated favorite, HARD DRIVIN', this update lives up to the reputation of the original. Experience eight unique racecars as you take to six different tracks, searching for alternate routes in order to get the best of your foes. Virtually everything is customizable here: you can select the total number of laps in each race, the number of opponents you'll face, and whether the course should be standard, reversed, or mirrored. Not only that, you choose weather conditions, difficulty level, and which gauges you'll be able to see you might rather have an uncluttered screen than access to your RPMs. All of these options certainly give the game as high a replay value as possible, and the obstacles are always different adding even more to the enjoyment factor. The game also has a Dual-Player mode in which you square off head-to-head with a friend (or enemy). If fast cars and cutthroat strategizing are your idea of a good time, get ready for the ride of your life.

title: Dragon Ball GT Final Bout
description: First released in limited quantities in 1997, Dragon Ball Z GT: Final Bout is back to honor the enormous popularity of the Dragon Ball animated series. Faithfully reproduced in its entirety, this much sought-after title offers a one-two punch of DBGT and DBZcharacters, as well as a powerful variety of ruthless fighting modes. Brilliantly packaged with exclusive cover art from Toei Animation, Final Bout is the perfect addition to every fan's collection.

title: Mass Destruction
description: Mass Destruction is a mission-based tank shooting game. Jump into one of three tanks each with its own strengths and weaknesses and take on 24 different missions, each with its own set of objectives. You must complete all the primary and secondary objectives and make your way to the extraction area for a mission to end successfully. During the course of the game, you can pick up tons of different weapons and destroy anything in your path. You'll encounter a seemingly endless array of tanks, helicopters, infantry, flamethrowers, buildings, bunkers, and gun turrets. Gamers can also expect big bosses and frantic, arcade-based shooting fun. Nearly every object on the screen can be blown up, so shooter fans will be in destruction heaven.
platforms: PS PC PC PS3 PSP Saturn

title: Need for Speed: V-Rally
description: NEED FOR SPEED: V-Rally is loaded with 42 tracks and 11 cars. Particularly impressive is the total number of tracks available, which is about three times as many as the standard racing game offers. Each track has a unique look, and there are plenty of conditions dirt, asphalt, snow, and rain to race in, resulting in extended gameplay. You also get an impressive selection of rally cars, including the Subaru Impreza, Mitsubishi Lancer, and various other big names. There is the usual lineup of options, with Arcade, Championship, and Time Trial modes to test your mettle. You can also take on a friend in split-screen Multiplayer mode to find out who can claim the prize as the rally champion.

title: Caesars Palace
description: CAESARS PALACE brings casino gambling at its finest to the PlayStation. Start out with $1,000 and try to turn it into a million playing Baccarat, Roulette, Craps, Blackjack, and slot machines. Just in case you don't know how to play a game, watch the official Caesars Palace Casino Tutorial. After watching the video, you'll want to hit the tables with lower bet limits; as your winnings increase, new tables with higher limits and minimums open up. Statistician and gambling guru, Dr. William Bertram, has verified the payoffs and odds, so the chances of winning big are the same as in the real world. CAESARS PALACE has all of the excitement of real world gambling without all of the losses.
platforms: PS NES SNES GG Mac Gen N64 GB

title: Crash Bandicoot 2: Cortex Strikes Back
description: The evil Dr. Neo Cortex is back with a vengeance .. this time ... to save the world? And he's asking for helo from his arch-nemesis, Crash Bandicoot? Or is it just some conniving plan to lure Crash into a deadly trap for his own evil bidding? Find out as Crash takes on a whole new adventure that's out of this world!

title: Colony Wars
description: Scientists have been able to increase the life expectancy of humans. The unintended consequence of this is the rapid overpopulation of the Earth. Luckily, space flight has become commonplace, and Earth is able to establish colonies on distant planets, thus creating the Earth Empire. The Czar, a man so ruthless that he would destroy a planet rather than deal with an uprising, rules the Empire. In this environment, the outer colonies have banded together to form the League of Free Worlds; their goal is to free the outer colonies from the oppression of Earth. Take the role of a League fighter pilot as he flies six ships in 70 different missions. How well the missions are executed determines how the plot evolves, which of the 25 stunning full-motion video sequences are seen, and which of the five endings is the result of the war. Only you can help the League win its independence in COLONY WARS.

title: Frogger
description: You are a frog who desperately wants to get to his lily pad. Unfortunately, you must cross a busy street and an alligator-infested swamp to get there. This was the premise behind the ¿80s arcade hit FROGGER. Now, Hasbro Interactive has brought this concept into the new millennium. As with most of the recent arcade remakes, FROGGER has now entered the third dimension. The fearless amphibian must travel through 10 worlds based on themes from the original game. However, some special moves make getting through the worlds a little easier: your tongue can be used to collect power-ups, a super hop allows access to new areas, and the super croak will keep the enemies at bay. Should your friends want to join the action, there are several different multiplayer modes available. Anyone who liked the original FROGGER will love the update.

title: Moto Racer
description: MOTO RACER brings the excitement of motorcycle racing to the PlayStation, and is essentially two racing games in one. showcases both dirt and street bikes, with tracks that fit each bike's acing style. Dirt bikes can race in a typical motocross stadium, which offers plenty of moguls and dirt ramps. In street racing, you'll go to more exotic locales, peeling out and burning rubber in a jungle setting and trying to figure out the best way to negotiate the curves of the Great Wall of China. Also included is a Multiplayer mode, which lets you go full throttle against a friend in head-to-head competition. So strap on your helmet and get ready for some intense dirt bike and street racing action with MOTO RACER.

title: Jeopardy! [1998]
description: The classic game of answers and questions, JEOPARDY! has arrived for N64. Every aspect of the show has been recreated, and you'll see it as the camera pans and zooms across a perfect rendering of the television studio. Just like on TV, Alex Trebek provides encouragement and support for all of the players in full-motion video sequences. With over 3,500 different answers all of them are read by JEOPARDY! announcer Johnny Gilbert there are plenty of challenges to keep the player engaged. But don't think the categories are dumbed down because this is a videogame every single answer could be on the show. When a category appears, it is recorded on a memory card to help prevent questions from repeating. See if you can survive the Daily Doubles and become a champion in JEOPARDY!

title: NCAA March Madness '98
description: Get ready to take your favorite school all the way to the national title in NCAA MARCH MADNESS ¿98. This game has all the pomp and circumstance of college basketball, complete with all the schools' fight songs. Run plays designed by Duke coach Mike Krzyzewski and manage your team over the long haul in Dynasty mode, or just jump straight to the Tournament and see if you can lead your team to the title. In the Dynasty mode you can try to recruit blue chip prospects or entice junior college transfers to come to your school. Of course, there is also a Versus mode so you can take on your friend and see who is the master of the hardwood. You can also team up with a friend and take on one of the legendary teams in a match-up for the ages.

title: Shadow Master
description: The Shadow Master must consume organic material to sustain itself. Having devoured everything in its path, the beast is heading for Earth. You must get behind the controls of a space vehicle and battle through 16 levels that span seven different worlds in order to stop this parasite. Along the way, you will have to destroy legions of enemies with a wide assortment of weapons. Thanks to a great new graphics engine, loads of enemies can be on-screen and there is not the slightest hint of slowdown. The entire design of the game was heavily influenced by British artist and futurist Rodney Matthews, so you can expect some impressive visuals and a completely immersive experience. Do you have what it takes to defend the Earth? Play SHADOW MASTER and find out.

title: Oddworld: Abe's Oddysee
description: In ODDWORLD: Abe's Oddysee, players take control of Abe an incredibly ugly, yet strangely compelling Mudokon slave. He and his fellow Mudokons have been forced to work in the meat packing plant Rupture Farms, which specializes in driving species to extinction. Abe discovers Rupture's next meat specialty his own race of Mudokons and it's up to him to escape from the farm, rescuing as many of his fellow Mudokons as possible. Abe's Oddysee uses many platform elements, along with puzzles and communication. Abe can speak to the other Mudokons and must if you want to finish the game; his friends must follow him to portals, where they are rescued.

title: NHL '98
description: NHL '98 has an array of features that you would expect from an EA Sports title. All 26 NHL teams from 1998 are in NHL '98, along with 18 international teams and two division All-Star rosters. EA uses the real NHL players and stadiums as well, resulting in the ultimate NHL experience. Each game starts off realistically enough, with the last few notes of the National Anthem being played (either American or Canadian, depending on which side of the border your team is from), and the game contains an amazing amount of play-by-play commentary. NHL coach Marc Crawford developed the plays, so you can expect a ton of realistic plays you can execute. You can also change your offensive and defensive strategies during the game with the press of a button. The players have received a bit of a graphical overhaul, so expect even more up-close-and-personal looks at some of the NHL's pretty boys and ugly thugs. You can also take on up to eight friends in the Multiplayer mode.

title: Poy Poy
description: Set in six unique 3D environments littered with throwable objects, POY POY challenges you to a match against three other opponents armed with logs, rocks, ice blocks, and atomic bombs. The game is made up of two main modes, Exhibition and Poy Poy Cup. The exhibition is a simple three-round match. As in professional wrestling, if you run out of things to throw, you can toss your opponents around. Each hit drops your own life meter though, so you need to be careful of that when picking a fight. The characters differ in size, strength, and speed, so picking the character that matches your fighting style is paramount. You can also choose from a variety of Power Gloves some gloves give the item you are tossing a higher arc, others make stuff explode in the air causing damage to multiple targets, and one glove in particular turns ordinary objects into heat-seeking projectiles. Up to four players can go at it one time, making POY POY one of the best multiplayer games on the PlayStation.

title: Bottom of the 9th '97
description: BOTTOM OF THE 9TH ‘97 brings all of the action of professional baseball to the PlayStation. With an MLBPA license, over 700 major league players are included with their career stats, and motion capture technology recreates all of their nuances. Put those players on the field in any of 15 stadiums in the Exhibition or Training modes for a quick baseball fix. Or, discover the pressure of being down by three runs and coming to the plate with bases loaded and two outs in the Scenario mode. For a more complete experience, tackle the Season, Playoff, or Championship modes. With the innovative cursor system for batting and pitching, the challenges of hitting a 100 mph fastball are faithfully recreated. All of the action of BOTTOM OF THE 9TH '97 brings professional baseball to your living room, without the need to pay an arm and a leg for beer.

title: Magic: The Gathering -- Battlemage
description: Yes, there was a card game sensation before Pok¿mon, and it was called MAGIC: The Gathering. Now gamers can bring the MAGIC experience off the card table and onto their PlayStations. For those unfamiliar with the series, you play as a magician who summons monsters, spells, and effects to combat other players or magicians. If you are victorious, you are awarded you opponent's cards, which you can then use to summon more monsters, spells, and effects. The gameplay is real-time strategy, so gamers will have to have quick hands and quicker wits to defeat the computer. All of the cards from the original game are represented, so longtime fans of the series should look forward to meeting some old friends in real time with MAGIC: The Gathering.

title: Steel Reign
description: General Storm and his militia are out to take over the world, and it's up to you to stop them. Luckily, you are armed with a battalion of tank prototypes. While there are only three different types to choose from at the beginning, the number of choices will grow to 12 as more tanks are discovered throughout the game. Play takes place in either the Arcade or Quest modes. Arcade has the player fighting through 10 levels of driving and shooting action, where players can pick up new weapons like laser beams, plasma cannons, and missiles. Between each mission, there is the opportunity to change tanks. Quest mode plays the same way, except the player is not given the opportunity to switch vehicles and must drive the same tank through all of the levels. Do you have what it takes to defeat General Storm? Play STEEL REIGN and find out.

title: Tecmo Stackers
description: Against the computer or a friend, you'll go head-to-head in some fast-paced puzzle games that will blow you away. The object is to fill your opponent's side of the board while keeping your own side clear of any blocks. If you connect four quads (blocks) of the same color, you'll create a chain reaction that will really give you an advantage. If you find yourself in a pinch, utilize a bomb to temporarily clear your board. There are four gameplay modes to choose from Arcade Competition, Time Trials, Chain Reaction, and Insane and more than 20 levels to master, making Tecmo Stackers one of the most complete action or puzzle games available.

title: Multi Racing Championship
description: Featuring up to 10 chooseable cars (many which open up later in the game), and three courses (plus mirror courses), Multi Racing Championship's biggest draw is the splendidly realistic feel of the cars themselves and the well designed courses on which they drive. The cars range from 4X4s, trucks, and off-road racers to slick street cars, Lamborghinis and the like. While initially it may seem like there is a deficit of courses, in fact, the multi-terrain courses contain mini-courses within each one. For instance, at least three times in each course, you will have the choice to take two different road directions -- either rough dirt track or snow-laden road, ot a slick but usually longer street course. Each car handles terrains differently, and some, like the trucks, obviously handle the off-roads better than others, but you can also modify your street car to handle dirst roads well, too.

title: RayStorm
description: Grab your oxygen mask and jump into the future of interplanetary defense. The year is 2219 AD, and Earth's Star Federation has unleashed the R-GRAY advanced tactical combat fighter to save the planet from certain destruction at the hands of the bloodthirsty Secilia Federation. Despite impossible odds, you must now command a specially outfitted R-GRAY fighter to defend Earth from certain destruction. Each fighter is equipped with lock-on lasers, pulse lasers, and a single devastating assault laser array that can destroy all sighted targets at once. Even with this technology at your disposal, the battle will not be easy. Earth's forces are depleted, and the merciless hordes of Secilia will settle for nothing less than complete annhilation of Earth.  Fortunately, Star command has created two R-GRAY prototypes, so if you need extra firepower, a skilled friend can fly at your side.
platforms: PS PS3 PSP PC PC PC PS3 Xbox 360

title: Hexen
description: HEXEN 64 is a shooter that mixes natural conventions with brand new ideas. Taking place during the Middle Ages, the story contains mystical elements, with the plot based on an evil sorcerer named Korax, who is causing destruction on the planet Hexen. Three heroes come to combat this evil, and during the course of the game, the player may take control of all three. The basic gameplay is like most shooters, though there are variations, including the ability to cast spells. There is also a Deathmatch mode that allows up to four players to fight against each other at one time in split-screen action. In addition, there is a Two-Player Cooperative mode that lets two people team up and play through the game. Overall, HEXEN 64 contains numerous unique and inventive elements that help to invigorate this genre.
platforms: N64 PC PS PC Mac Saturn

title: Battle Arena Toshinden 3
description: BATTLE ARENA TOSHINDEN 3 continues the action of the Toshinden, a tournament in which the best fighters in the world gather to pummel each other. Pick one of the 32 playable characters, each with unique combinations and weapons that include swords, scythes, spears, pistols, and strangler arms. When weapons aren't enough, slam your opponent into the walls and the ceiling of the arena for extra damage. BATTLE ARENA TOSHINDEN 3 also allows for a choice of graphic styles: choose the 30 fps option for high graphic detail, or choose the 60 fps to experience faster gameplay. Either way, the excitement of the Toshinden will be right in your living room.

title: WCW vs. NWO: World Tour
description: Whether or not you're a pro wrestling fan, you're sure to appreciate the tough-as-nails action of WCW VS. NWO: World Tour. Featuring more than 40 wrestlers entering the squared circle, the game lets you choose between such favorites as Hulk Hogan, Lex Luger, Kevin Nash, The Giant, Diamond Dallas Page, Macho Man, and many more. With a huge arsenal of moves like body slams, pile drivers, super kicks, and reversals each wrestler also has special moves that only he can pull off. Try out all the devastating maneuvers as you compete in One-on-One, Tag Team, Two-on-One, or Battle Royal matches. With four different leagues the WCW, NWO (New World Order), DOA (Dead or Alive), and IU (Independent Union) a wide variety of pro wrestling action is on display. Add to all of this the fact that you can play in Tournament, League, and League Challenge modes, and you've got the most comprehensive wrestling game imaginable. With awesome graphics, sound effects, and animations, WCW VS. NWO: World Tour is the next best thing to being at the arena.

title: Spawn: The Eternal
description: Every comic book junkie knows the origins of Spawn (AKA Al Simmons). A successful government agent, Simmons ended up in the bowels of Hell after his own men killed him. After striking a deal with the big bad devil, Malebolgia, Simmons returned to Earth as Spawn, only to find his wife married off to his best pal. Now Spawn has little to do but work for the redemption of his own beleaguered soul. Todd McFarlane's ultra-successful empire has "spawned" several lines of action figures, a live-action movie, and animated features. Now, in SPAWN: The Eternal, you must rage through time and the fire with a familiar cast of characters Violator, the Phlebiac Brothers, Mr. C, Soul Trapper, the Glass Spiders, Medieval Spawn, and Angel while separating limbs from your enemies, vanquishing them to the ring of Hell from which the came.

title: Mortal Kombat Mythologies: Sub-Zero
description: A new hero emerges from the shadows of the past, when warriors were kings and gods walked among men. Sub-Zero hails from north Asia, where he trained in the dark arts of combat with his father. Summoned by his masters, the Lin Kuei clan, Sub-Zero sets on a quest for the Map of Elements, a sacred document protected in the forbidding Shaolin Temples in central China. Sub-Zero is unaware that the Shirai Ryu ninjas sworn enemies of the Lin Kuei have dispatched their own emissary, Scorpion, with the same directive. The action is graphically realistic and thrilling as in all MK titles, and it includes the MK fighting system, complete with a combo meter and the ability to develop new skills and moves as you gain experience by demolishing opponents. There are also many hazards and traps for Sub-Zero in the Shaolin Temple, and you'll have to make good use of the many power-ups, restorative herbal medicine, and ancient scripts to if you want to succeed in your quest.
rating_content: Animated Blood and Gore, Animated Violence

title: Wheel of Fortune [1997]
description: Up to three players can get in on the puzzle-solving action, as America's favorite game show makes its way to N64. The setup will make you'll feel like you're on the set of the show, as the theme song plays and the camera flies in from the audience. Vanna is along for the ride, too, and she'll stop to tell you where the game stands from time to time.  Whether you're a big fan of the TV show, an appreciator of puzzles, or you're just looking for a good game for your Nintendo 64, you're sure to appreciate more than 4,000 word puzzles, and the feeling of solving them in front of a live studio audience. A comprehensive manual will get you started playing quickly and easily, and the game's controls are extremely simple to master. With top-notch sound (the sound effects are perfect), the personality of Vanna White, and some of the best puzzles the WHEEL OF FORTUNE folks have ever drummed up, this game's sure to hook you.

title: Bug Riders
description: The King of Entymion, Leptus, is about to die. Rather than hold elections or keep the tradition of primogeniture, the next king will be chosen with a race. Not just any race, but a race in which the participants ride on giant bugs. Choose from 22 different contestants, each with unique racing styles and weapon, and try to be the first to the finish line on six tracks. If finishing first is a little too tough, make your bug go faster by using your riding crop. But be careful, or your bug will quit running for you. For those looking for a less-than-honest way to win, collect power-ups and weapons scattered throughout the track to blow past your opponents or blast them out of the sky. And don't forget to keep your eyes open for the shortcuts in each track. Do you have the nerve and the skill to win the Great Race? Play BUG RIDERS: The Race of Kings and find out.

title: Automobili Lamborghini
description: Titus Software delivers a serious racer for serious race fans. AUTOMOBILI LAMBORGHINI is custom-designed for gamers with a need for speed, and it flies past the competition with its gorgeously rendered speed demons and selection of cars. As a driver, you'll have to handle your ride as though it were your own. In other words, you need to keep it fueled and get the tires changed regularly, or else you're going to have major problems as the race goes on. Aside from the breathtaking graphics and extreme realism, AUTOMOBILI LAMBORGHINI offers four distinct modes of play: Single Race mode, Time Trial mode, Championship mode, and Arcade mode. And with multiplayer options, you can go head-to-head with any friends courageous enough to get behind the wheel. In addition, pit stop mini-games diversify the action when you need to pull over the side of the road and cool down your mean machine. So start your engine and get ready for the ride of your life with AUTOMOBILI LAMBORGHINI.

title: Excalibur 2555 AD
description: Knights from the future have stolen King Arthur's sword, Excalibur. Merlin concocts a one-way trip to the future for one person to reclaim the sword. You take the role of Beth, Merlin's niece, as she travels through a world decimated by a meteor impact in EXCALIBUR 2555 A.D. Travel through 13 exotic levels collecting items, solving puzzles, and getting clues from the local inhabitants. Unfortunately, not everyone is willing to help you, but thanks to your trusty sword, those folks will not remain a problem for long. To further aid you, Beth can learn a small number of magic spells. First, she must find the page from her magic book then all of the ingredients for the spell before it becomes usable. Help Beth recover the fabled sword and figure out a way to return to her own time period in EXCALIBUR 2555 A.D.

title: Armored Core
description: In Armored Core, you are a member of the elite Raven Squadron, a group of mercenaries whose main weapons are gigantic humanoid mechs called Cores. As the Raven Squadron is the best of the best, corporations are willing to pay a high price for your services. Earn enough cash in the 45 missions to customize your Core; customization is easy with enough parts and combos to create 300,000 different mechs. You can also create a custom emblem to distinguish your core from all of the others. When being a gun-for-hire gets old, challenge your friends to combat in the Two-Player mode.

title: ClayFighter 63 1/3
description: It's Clay Combat in 3D worlds with this N64 edition of the clay-busting fighter game. 3D Breakthrough Attacks allow players to get tossed out of a window and carry on fighting outside. This game features 12 brawling clay fighters, including the super-suited Earthworm Jim!
platforms: N64 PS Wii M2 N64 DSi

title: Persona
description: PERSONA is a philosophical game that takes place in a world close to our own. It is a departure from the typical swords and sorcery, and it delivers a tale of dreams, the purpose of life, and who we are as individuals. In PERSONA you have modern weapons like an Uzi and an AK-47. And instead of always fighting monsters, you are given the opportunity to talk your way through a confrontation. By talking things out, you can earn components of spells the more components you have, the more powerful your spells become. The gameplay in PERSONA holds true to the old RPG standard, as the fighting is turn based, some encounters are random, and the dungeons are large and easy to get lost in. If you are looking for a truly original RPG experience, you should check out PERSONA.

title: Golden Nugget
description: Casino gambling comes to your home with GOLDEN NUGGET. Play in the Casino mode and start with $10,000, where your goal is to win as much as possible in 16 different casino games: slots, craps, poker, blackjack, Pai Gow, and Keno just to name a few. After you have sufficient winnings, you can join the high rollers in the VIP lounge or enter a tournament to win even more cash. The most original mode is the Chaos Mystery. In this mode, you gamble your way through the Golden Nugget Hotel in Vegas while trying to find a stolen microchip. The story is told through full-motion video sequences filmed at the actual Golden Nugget and feature Adam West (star of the BATMAN television series). Anyone who loves to gamble, or someone looking for a different gambling experience, should pick up a copy of GOLDEN NUGGET.

title: Bushido Blade
description: BUSHIDO BLADE is a revolutionary 3D fighter from Squaresoft, which lets you play from either the first or third-person perspective. This game is also serial linkable, so you can connect two PlayStation game consoles together via a link cable and fight against your friends. Choose from six different modes of play: Story, Versus, Slash, Training, POV, and Link. Select any of the six skilled warriors: Red Shadow, Tatsumi, Mikado, Black Lotus, Utsusemi, and Kannuki. Equip them with one of the eight ancient swords and weapons: Katana, Rapier, Naginata, Sledgehammer, Nodachi, Long Sword, Saber, or Broadsword. Combat takes place throughout an old Japanese castle, where you can move around at will and make your stand wherever you wish. The game's Story mode encourages fighting with honor; certain endings are unavailable if you have dishonored yourself throughout the course of the game. If you strike an opponent while they are climbing or on the ground is considered dishonorable. BUSHIDO BLADE's fighting system is a little different from most fighting games as well, as a single, well-placed blow can bring instant death to an adversary.

title: Diablo
description: The PC hit and classic dungeon crawler Diablo comes to the PlayStation. Play as a strong warrior, magical sorcerer, or the balanced rogue as you travel through 16 randomly generated levels of action in an effort to defeat the Lord of Hell, Diablo. Battle skeletons, zombies, and demons with magic, swords, clubs, and arrows. Occasionally, villagers will ask you to perform additional quests to help make the town a safer place. If all of the enemies overwhelm you, get a friend to help you out with the multiplayer mode. Several new special effects have been added to the PlayStation version to give the game an added graphical punch. Also included is a new double-speed mode that will allow you to get out sticky situations twice as fast. Diablo brings old-fashioned dungeon exploration home.
rating_content: Animated Blood and Gore, Animated Violence

title: Dead or Alive
description: Tecmo's arcade hit Dead or Alive comes to the PlayStation. Choose from 11 different characters each with smooth, realistic character models, unique moves, and combinations that are easy to execute with the punch, kick, and hold control scheme. The hold button adds a new level of strategy to the game, as it allows the player to stop the opponent's attack and pull off a counterattack. Danger zones add another piece of strategy; when a player is knocked down in a danger zone, he or she suffers massive damage. After winning the martial arts tournament in the Arcade mode, players are awarded one of 84 costumes for their characters. If the Arcade mode is not to your liking, try the Kumite, Survival, or Team Battle modes. Should your friends question your supremacy, take them out with the versus mode. Dead or Alive brings new levels of strategy to the PlayStation.
platforms: PS Xbox PS3 Saturn PSP Arcade

title: Speed Racer
description: The cult cartoon hit SPEED RACER makes its way to the PlayStation. Now you can get behind the wheel of three different variations of the Mach 5, each one equipped with several gadgets that are unique to the car like grip tires, rotary saws, a periscope, a deflector, and auto jacks. All of the gadgets have a specific purpose: the rotary saws are used to cut down any trees that get in the way; by activating the auto jacks, the Mach 5 can jump over obstacles to discover shortcuts. Discovering the shortcuts is the key to getting the fastest times on all three tracks and mastering the Normal and Endurance modes. If you play the game well enough, you will be able to unlock new vehicles, including Racer X. Get behind the wheel and go, SPEED RACER, go!

title: Lode Runner: The Legend Returns
description: LODE RUNNER is one of the oldest games in videogame history. It was originally released on the Apple II, back when computers were just a little bit more than glorified calculators. Now, LODE RUNNER has made its way to the PlayStation, and the game remains the same. Players take control of a lone runner who must navigate a series of platforms and ladders trying to collect all of the gold and move on to the next level. However, there are red runners who are out to stop you. Your only defense is a flame-thrower that will create holes in the platforms for the bad guys to fall into. As an added bonus, the game has a Construction mode, which allows you to create your own screen layouts and place gold and enemies where you see fit. If you loved LODE RUNNER, run out and get LODE RUNNER: The Legend Returns.

title: Saga Frontier
description: Saga Frontier breaks the mold of traditional role-playing games. Thanks to the Free Scenario System, the player has the opportunity to complete seven different quests, each with a unique lead character and story. However, all of the stories take place in the same world, and most of the stories intersect at various points. This particular arrangement allows the player unprecedented freedom. In addition, the battle system also takes a different approach: rather than conserving hit points (they regenerate between fights), players must conserve weapon points, which are used to unleash powerful attacks. Multiple attacks can be combined to create even more devastating combinations. Try to discover the links between all of the characters and the greater evil guiding all of the events in Saga Frontier.

title: Rascal
description: The master of time, Chronos, has kidnapped Rascal's father. Now, the loveable scamp must travel through six worlds filled with running, jumping, and shooting action. On each world, Rascal will have to make his way through two levels and a fight with a boss enemy. In each of the levels, he must collect six pieces of an hourglass which, when assembled, will teleport Rascal home. However, there a number of puzzles and enemies that stand in Rascal's way. Luckily, he can eliminate these obstacles with quick thinking and a bubble gun. If you like the way Rascal looks, thank the folks at Jim Henson's Creature Shop, who created all of the character designs. Try to save Rascal's father from Chronos in RASCAL.

title: ReBoot
description: Based on the television series of the same name, REBOOT takes place in a completely digital world. Megabyte wants to destroy Mainframe. He sends glitches, which are tears in the fabric of cyberspace, to open over Mainframe and let in viruses from the net. The only person who can stop this is Bob, guardian of Mainframe City. He must collect the tears before they open. Naturally, Megabyte wants Bob to fail and sends robots, flying tanks, and assorted other bad guys to get in his way. In order to succeed, Bob will have to travel through 19 levels. Luckily, Bob can race around some of the levels on a zipboard which is basically a flying skateboard. Help Bob save Mainframe from Megabyte's evil plan in REBOOT.

title: Snowboard Kids
description: The sun is shining, the powder is fresh, and you've got nothing to do but strap on your board and hit the slopes. Like a cool combination of 1080 SNOWBOARDING and MARIO KART 64, SNOWBOARD KIDS combines intense snowboarding action with cartoon-style competition. You can play as Slash, Linda, Nancy, Jam, or Tommy (all 10-year old kids), and choose from nine different customizable boards. Each board has a distinctly different style and skill set, and you can even choose designs for and repaint the deck you select. It's also possible to earn more prestigious boards as you advance in the competition. Take to the snow in five different modes of play, including Battle Race, Multiplayer Battle, Time Attack, and Skill Games. There's also a half-pipe competition and nine various tracks set over all sorts of terrain (you didn't think this would be limited to snow, did you?). As variety is, indeed, the spice of life, the designers of the game have included a whopping 36 different tricks for you to master and show off, and SNOWBOARD KIDS also features good use of Rumble Pak capability. Up to four players can compete in this wintry adventure.

title: Test Drive 4
description: Imagine zipping along a winding country road in a high-performance sports car. Now you can do just that without having to spend a small fortune on a new car with TEST DRIVE 4 for the PlayStation. You can drive 10 cars from the past and present: Jaguar XJ 220, Dodge Viper GTS, TVR Cerbera, Chevrolet Corvette, Nissan 300ZX, Shelby Cobra 427, ?69 Chevrolet Corvette 427, ?70 Chevrolet Chevelle SS 454, ?69 Chevrolet Camaro ZL1 and the ?71 Plymouth Hemi Cuda.
