Race against five other cars and avoid the cops in exotic locations like Washington D.C., San Francisco, Kyoto, and Bern. You can take on the competition in a single race or try to win one of four multi-race Cups. If your friends want to race, they can challenge you via a link-cable. Now you can live out your vehicular fantasies with TEST DRIVE 4.

title: Fighting Force
description: After his predictions of the world's demise fall flat, Dr. Dex Zeng tries to destroy the world himself. Fortunately, the Fighting Force is here to save the day! You take of the role of Hawk Manson, Ben "Smasher" Jackson, Mace Daniels, or Alana McKendrick, and battle through seven expansive levels (some with branching paths) with each character's unique moves and combinations. You will need every move too, since up to five enemies may attack at once. To keep the destruction moving at a furious pace, pick up pipes, guns, knives, soda machines, and anything else that might be lying around and get creative. For maximum carnage, tell a friend to use the other controller and double-team Zeng's minions. Can the Fighting Force stop Zeng's evil plot in time?
platforms: PS PC PSP PS3 Saturn N64

title: Jimmy Johnson's VR Football 98
description: JIMMY JOHNSON'S VR FOOTBALL '98 brings all of the action of professional football to the PlayStation. Choose from all 30 NFL teams or 20 of the greatest teams in NFL history. Once you have picked your favorite team, hit the practice field to work on playing offense and defense. When you are ready for competition, play a pre-season game or jump into the action of the regular season. During the season, you can make trades and sign free agents to improve your team and fill gaps, and after getting the appropriate personnel, you can tweak the offensive playbook with the play editor. When all else fails, you can get playing tips and advice from NFL coaching great Jimmy Johnson. All of the excitement that is the NFL comes to the PlayStation with JIMMY JOHNSON'S VR FOOTBALL '98.

title: Reel Fishing
description: Reel Fishing gives you all the action of a real fishing outing, with rods and reels to choose from. The real challenge, the excitement, and even the occasional frustration of Reel Fishing to the virtual waters are the real discipline for your mind in playing this game with your friends. Your skill, experience and strategy will test your patience in hooking the right big catch and reel them in with pride and success. Underwater shots will fascinate you, not only with the beauty but also with the wild life of fishery.

title: Shipwreckers!
description: The evil pirate Blowfleet has captured the world's waterways. Now, you must defeat Blowfleet and free the seven seas. Initially, your ship is armed with two cannon shots: a single-shot forward or a volley of cannonballs from the port or starboard sides. Eventually, you will be able to pick up new weapons, including flamethrowers and lightning guns. In addition to the weapons, several power-ups give your ship temporary abilities like the opportunity to transform into a blimp and float over obstacles and enemies. This isn't going to be easy, so you will have to use all of the weapons at your disposal to destroy enemy ships and capture ports. The translucent water effects allow you to see the ships you've destroyed and give the illusion that you really are on the water. Rescue the seven seas from Blowfleet in SHIPWRECKERS!

title: Command & Conquer: Red Alert
description: Westwood's alternate history RTS presented unparalleled strategy that perfectly married currently-applicable RTS interface conventions with diverse units to create some utterly compelling gameplay. When taken online or played over LAN, Red Alert simply excelled. Broken alliances and heedless harvester rushes still bring tears to our eyes. It didn't start the genre, but it probably started the craze.Although still set in the future, the game is set on an Earth where time travel has eliminated Hitler from history and the Second World War never happened. As a result the Western Allies are left facing a powerful USSR with both sides equipped with futuristic technology. The game consists of a series of timed missions. Scenarios and objectives are varied. Objectives range from overrunning the enemy force to more subtle missions such infiltrating
platforms: PS iPad iPhone PC G.com PSP PS3

title: Rampage: World Tour
description: A radioactive goop turns three humans into giant monsters with attitude problems. They've decided to get revenge on the company that is responsible for their current condition. They do this by traveling around the world smashing everything in sight, in hopes of destroying the plants that are responsible for manufacturing the mutating chemical. You control one of three monsters that include an ape, a wolf, and a lizard. All three monsters must punch, kick, and smash all of the buildings in each location to move on. However, they must avoid being shot by the human defenses that include tanks and planes. Up to three human players can play at one time via a multitap. Help the monsters get revenge in RAMPAGE WORLD TOUR.
platforms: PS GBC PC PS3 Arcade N64 Saturn

title: Street Fighter EX Plus Alpha
description: The STREET FIGHTER series make its first foray into the third dimension with STREET FIGHTER EX PLUS ALPHA. There are a total of 23 characters to choose from. Classic characters like Ryu, Guile, and Chun Li make appearances along with a number of new characters including Skull-o-Rama, Crackerjack, and Kairi. As with all of the STREET FIGHTER games, each of the characters has unique moves and combinations. Much of the timing has remained the same, so STREET FIGHTER veterans will be able to get into the game quickly. With seven different modes of play that include Arcade, Team Battle, Survival, Watch, Versus, Time Attack, and Practice, you can play in virtually every way imaginable. See if you can master fighting in the third dimension with STREET FIGHTER EX PLUS ALPHA.

title: Nightmare Creatures
description: Free your homeland in 19th-century Prague from a horde of gothic horror monsters that have been released by an evil wizard in this action-adventure.
rating_content: Animated Blood and Gore, Animated Violence

title: NBA In the Zone '98
description: High-flying basketball realism comes to center court with NBA IN THE ZONE '98. It's purebred, detailed five-on-five strategic ball, as you choose your team, lineup, and turn off any rules you don't like. Over 300 moves were motion-captured in the creation of this game, and it shows. The gameplay is silky smooth, as you make your way through an Exhibition game, a Season, the NBA Playoffs, or an All-Star game. The official schedules for all 29 teams are included, but you can choose to play a 28- or 56-game season of you'd prefer. If you're feeling industrious, build your own NBA superstar with whatever physical attributes and abilities you want. For an extra dose of reality, check out the actual offensive and defensive schemes for each team. And if you're sick of your underachieving, no-good players driving the fans away, play GM and trade away anyone you don't want. With no salary cap regulations, you can pull off any swap you can dream up. Great crowd noise and complete play calling both add to the charm of this complete package.

title: Nagano Winter Olympics '98
description: Tension is in the air   a chill moves in as the crowd anxiously awaits the beginning of the year's biggest event the Winter Olympics. From the makers of the popular TRACK & FIELD series comes this exciting, realistic trip to Nagano's Winter events of 1998. The game features two different modes of play: Olympic and Championship. Olympic mode lets you choose which of the 12 events you want to take part in, while Championship mode challenges you to tackle each event in succession. NAGANO WINTER OLYMPICS '98 includes giant slalom snowboarding, halfpipe snowboarding, 500-meter speed skating, 1500-meter speed skating, 90-meter ski jump, 120-meter ski jump, giant slalom alpine skiing, downhill alpine skiing, freestyle skiing, curling, luge, and bobsled.

title: Skullmonkeys
description: From the twisted mind of Doug TenNapel, one of the creators of, this sequel to the PC adventurefeatures the same Claymation designs in a platformer action game developed for the PlayStation. Here, you once again take on the role of the hero Klaymen as you attempt to "foil evil and stuff".

title: Nagano Winter Olympics '98
description: Get ready to experience the thrill of victory and possibly the agony of defeat with NAGANO WINTER OLYMPICS '98. The game features 13 events covering the spectrum of Winter Olympic Games. On the slopes you'll find giant slalom, super g, downhill, freestyle aerials, and large hill ski jumping. There's also the snowboarding giant slalom and four speed skating events: the 500 and 1500 on the standard track and the 500 and 100 on the short track. If you prefer vehicular action, there's bobsledding and luge; and if you want something unique, take a look at curling. You can also pick from athletes from all the Olympic countries and compete against a friend in the Versus mode for intense head-to-head action. So slip into your longjohns, slap on some Chapstick, and get ready for NAGANO WINTER OLYMPICS '98.

title: Quake
description: Lurking shadows, eerie sound effects, and a general dark atmosphere create an overall bone-chilling ambience for QUAKE 64. A rip in the dimensional fabric has resulted in "Slipgates," through which monsters from different worlds enter ours. Your job is to exterminate these invaders using the variety of weapons at your disposal. Begin the mission with an ax and a single-barrel shotgun, and later graduate to using rail guns and rocket launchers to make mincemeat out of the unworldly creatures. There's also the Thunderbolt, an immensely power weapon with self-generating energy capability. Even better are power-ups that dramatically increase your strength four-fold, but these are few and far between. On the defensive side, armor, Biosuits, and Megahealth boxes provide your line of protection. Four levels of difficulty, a Two-Play mode, and customizable Controller settings give you the chance to test your skills and endurance level. The precise and responsive play control adds to your chances of survival as you fight to save our world from doom and mayhem.
platforms: N64 Cell PC Cell PC Mac Saturn

title: NBA in the Zone '98
description: NBA IN THE ZONE ¿98 is a traditional five-on-five basketball game that follows the lead of its predecessors, NBA IN THE ZONE and NBA IN THE ZONE 2. In the original game, the emphasis was on an arcade look and feel. NBA IN THE ZONE '98 advances the series' evolution by leaning towards more of a basketball simulation. New options include an on-the-fly play-calling system as well as statistical tracking, which not only keeps season stats but also charts league leaders in various categories. You can also take on a friend in Versus mode and see who is really in the zone; with two multitaps, up to eight people can play at one time.

title: Fighters Destiny
description: Hardcore fighting action comes to the Nintendo 64 with FIGHTERS DESTINY. You can choose from more than 10 characters and enter the ring in the ultimate hand-to-hand competition. Rather than using a two-out-of-three format, you must score seven points in order to win a match. Knocking down your opponent, forcing him out of the ring, or throwing him to the ground score anywhere from one to four points. Try to beat all of the other fighters in the Master Challenge, where a victory results in you learning their fighting skills. If you face the Joker, you must beat him or you will lose the skills you have gained. See how many opponents you can beat before giving up seven points in the Survival mode, or try to see how long you can stay in the ring with a fighting cow in the Rodeo mode. Keep your butt off the ground to win at FIGHTERS DESTINY.

title: NHL Breakaway '98
description: NHL BREAKAWAY '98 offers one of the most original features ever to appear in a hockey game: the Momentum-Based Checking System. Players can actually out-skate and out-muscle each other, depending on a player's size and speed. For example, some players may be smaller but are fast, while others may be slow but possess the strength and size to do all the dirty work. For instance, if a large, fast player such as Eric Lindros gets moving at a high rate of speed, the power behind his check is greater than what someone like Pierre Turgeon could produce. The game sports most of the usual play modes, and you can always take on a friend in the Versus mode. If you edit a player, the name and number will appear on the player's back, which is a great feature that lets you put yourself in the game.

title: Felony 11-79
description: A mystical statue has been broken into several pieces. Sadly, the pieces have been scattered across the city. Choose from four different vehicles a jeep, coupe, compact, and Vespsa and drive through three areas of Downtown, Seaside, and Metro City to retrieve the pieces for your client. Coincidentally, you can also earn rewards for causing havoc while driving around. Cash rewards are given for every bicycle, car, telephone booth, and fence you destroy, but pedestrians are off limits. Be careful when dealing out the damage though, as your car receives damage as well and may become inoperable. Ultimately, how well you perform your task will determine which, if any, of the 18 hidden vehicles are unlocked. Property destruction has never been as much fun as it is in Felony 11-79.

title: Arcade's Greatest Hits: The Atari Collection 1
description: Atari is widely held as the company that made the early arcade days (read: late '70s) great, what with such stellar games as Missile Command, Battlezone, and Tempest commanding attention. After its acquisition of Atari Games in 1996, Williams/Midway decided to re-release some of the best arcade titles on one PlayStation disc. The compilation includes six different, emulated titles: Asteroids, Battlezone, Centipede, Missile Command, Super Breakout, and Tempest. History material, complete with interviews, is also included.

title: Tiger Shark
description: Set in the not-too-distant future of 2060 A.D., TIGERSHARK lets you pilot "the ultimate war machine" a TIGERSHARK subfoil prototype. You wage war across 10 huge levels against the vast Russian army, above the remains of a mostly decimated Japan. A series of massive earthquakes have flooded 60% of the once-thriving island nation, and Russia plans on taking control of the area and it's valuable resources and it's up to you to halt their aggression. By destroying the Russian magma taps, you'll effectively cut the Red army's power. In an attempt to bring you down, the Red Menace sends out their sleekest subs, finest battle cruisers, and a phalanx of small combat-ready ships. Fight over the water and under it in intense seafaring skirmishes. After completing your objectives, you'll have to rendezvous with a waiting sub carrier and travel to the next trouble spot   where the battle rages anew in an all-out struggle for control of the sea.

title: Final Fantasy VII
description: The RPG genre was never really considered a mainstream or popular genre -- that is, until the release of Final Fantasy VII on PlayStation. With Final Fantasy VII's historic release on PlayStation in June of 1997, role-playing games were finally given the respect that they deserved and the RPG genre is now one of the most significant and defining on the system. Following the story of Cloud Strife, gamers were taking on a fantastical journey that encompassed three CDs and over 40 hours worth of gameplay. The game continued the trend of using the series' staple turn-based battle system, complete with melee and elaborate magic attacks.
platforms: PS PS3 iPhone PS4 PC Android PSP
rating_content: Comic Mischief, Mild Animated Violence, Mild Language

title: International Superstar Soccer 64
description: Konami shoots and scores with INTERNATIONAL SUPERSTAR SOCCER 64 for the Nintendo 64. This title delivers a realistic 3D gaming experience that features fully licensed teams and stadiums, as well as an authentic and excited announcer. The game is open for up to four people to play simultaneously, in anything from a normal game to the championships. There is even a Practice mode that gives the player a chance to get prepared for these big games. The graphics are impressive, featuring stadiums that range in location from Africa to Europe. In addition, each player is motion-captured, resulting in fluid and precise animations and a play experience that truly mimics a real soccer game. From the calls of the announcer to the jeers of the crowd, INTERNATIONAL SUPERSTAR SOCCER 64 for the N64 is a complete sporting adventure, with all of the modes and options that fans expect, with the great gameplay to support it.

title: K-1 The Arena Fighters
description: All of the punches, kicks, knockouts, and general brutality of kickboxing have come to the PlayStation with K-1 THE ARENA FIGHTERS. You can choose from eight fighters based on real-world kickboxers, and then experience the brutal nature of the sport in a Single-Player match, or try to become champion in a Tournament. If you're looking for a different kind of challenge, pick a team of boxers, and beat up the opposition in the Team Challenge mode. If your friends challenge your dominance of the ring, put them in their place with a match in the Versus mode. No matter what mode you play, motion-captured animation makes all the characters move realistically. If you are good enough, you can unlock a video that shows how the motion-capture work was done. Do you have the stamina to become the best of the best in K-1 THE ARENA FIGHTERS?

title: The Incredible Hulk: The Pantheon Saga
description: The Incredible Hulk has been featured in a live-action television series, a couple of cartoon series, and fair number of videogames. Now, the Hulk makes his first appearance on the PlayStation with THE INCREDIBLE HULK: The Pantheon Saga. The story starts out with Hulk being captured by members of Pantheon, who want to use him for experiments. While en route to a secret lab, the ship carrying the Hulk crashes, where you take control of the Hulk as he smashes his way through 14 levels of action. Luckily, the Hulk is a smashing machine and can execute 25 different offensive and defensive combinations including the Thunder Clap, Vortex Spin, and Floor Smash. Get angry and help the Hulk escape from his captors in THE INCREDIBLE HULK: The Pantheon Saga.

title: Duke Nukem: Total Meltdown
description: The popular PC game Duke Nukem comes to the PlayStation in this complete package of Duke Nukem carnage. In addition to the complete re-rendering of the weapons and enemies, the game also features a death-match mode that allows you to link up to a friend and nuke each other. Total Meltdown also comes with six additional levels that weren't included in its PC counterpart.Duke has defeated the Rigelatins and heads back to Los Angeles on a captured spacecraft. Expecting a heros welcome he has save the planet after all his craft is shot down. Duke quickly learns that Los Angeles is under siege from aliens. Now duke must battle LAPD piggies, flying brains, machine gun toting aliens, and other scum to save his beloved city. Use shotguns, chain cannons, freeze throwers, shrinkers, and other weapons as you play all of the levels on the PC version of the game as well as six exclusive PlayStation levels. If you get tired of battling the aliens, use a link cable and challenge a friend to a death match. Help Duke as he tries to save Los Angeles in Duke Nukem: Total Meltdown.
rating_content: Animated Blood and Gore, Animated Violence, Strong Sexual Content

title: Bomberman 64
description: How many jobs are there out there where one gets paid to toss bombs around, blowing up everything in your path? The evil Altair has wrested control of the Omni Cube (which allows its holder to possess the tremendous power of the universe), and it's up to Bomberman to get it back. In BOMBERMAN 64 players hop between four different elemental worlds (each with its own set of baddies) before going after the main nasty who threatens Planet Bomber. As anyone who has hefted a bomb or two can probably tell, there is more emphasis put on gameplay than story. The levels and game fields are wide-open and there's plenty of room to wind up and let loose bombs in every direction. The future of Planet Bomber is in your capable hands   can you get the job done?

title: Vs.
description: If you're a fan of popular fighting series like TEKKEN and VIRTUA FIGHTER but hanker for a more American-flavored brawler, then VS. might be the game for you. Play as one of 20 3D polygonal fighters (designed by former Marvel comics artist Kurtis Fujita) and put the smack down on your opponents in fierce hand -to-hand battle. The plot of VS. is simple: four different street gangs, with four fighters in each group go all out to protect their sacred turf. You can choose from diverse characters like Paco the mechanic, Kenny the bodybuilder, Kara the tattoo artist, Harold the tough street mime, and many more. Fight across 12 street-based, real-world arenas including Venice Beach, Malibu Canyon, Chinatown, Miami Beach, and more. Game modes include One- or Two-Player Rumble, Versus, Survival (where you take on your fellow gang members), Challenge, and Exhibition. You'll be banging your head as you battle to hard-driving rock music from Suicide Machines, Los Infernos, and others. VS. will pit you in a "survival of the fittest" fighting contests in locales across the seedier side of America.

title: AeroFighters Assault
description: Choose from six different pilots from a United Nations peacekeeping force, and get ready to shoot down evil in AEROFIGHTERS ASSAULT for the Nintendo 64. You'll face the Phutta Morgana (a high-tech terrorist group that has melted the Antarctic ice cap in order to flood cities), cause plenty of damage, and achieve world domination. Practice your flying and shooting skills in the Practice mode (seven missions, with the ability to unlock three additional missions) before attempting to restore peace in the main game, where you'll be taking on jets, subs, helicopters, and more. Boss Attack mode allows you to face any of the superiors you've gone up against in the main game at any time, and Death Match mode pits you against a friend in a fierce dogfight. Throw on your aviator shades and bomber jacket, because you've got some flying to do.

title: Ghost in the Shell
description: The Human Liberation Movement is bent on destroying cyborgs. To accomplish this, they destroy the cyborg-body developer, Mega Tech Body Corporation. Unfortunately, they also kill about 100 innocent people. You take the role of Major Motoko Kusanagi, a cyborg assigned to the public safety bureau, Section 9. Travel through 12 top-secret missions as you try to stop the Human Liberation Movement. Thankfully, you have the services of a fuchikoma, a giant spider like tank, available to you. Should you find yourself being blown to bits on a regular basis, use the Training mode to get all of the intricacies of the controls down pat. Over 10 minutes of hand drawn animation adds substantial graphical appeal to the title. Only you can help Major Kusanagi defeat the terrorists and protect the city in GHOST IN THE SHELL.

title: Arcade's Greatest Hits: The Midway Collection 2
description: One of the early challengers to Atari's dominance in arcades was Midway. Now, seven of Midway's greatest arcade hits have come to the PlayStation in ARCADE'S GREATEST HITS: The Midway Collection 2. It will be easy to recreate those lazy afternoons of dropping quarters with titles like these: BLASTER, JOUST 2, SPLAT!, BURGER TIME, SPY HUNTER, ROOTBEER TAPPER, and MOON PATROL. Thanks to the power of the PlayStation, every level and sound of these games has been perfectly recreated for the home. It will be like having an arcade in your living room, without the need for change machines.

title: Namco Museum Vol. 5
description: Five Namco arcade classics make their way to the PlayStation with NAMCO MUSEUM VOL. 5. PAC MANIA has Pac-Man traveling through an isometric, psuedo-3D maze while avoiding ghosts and eating power pellets. DRAGON SPIRIT is a shooter that puts you in control of a fire-breathing dragon, while METRO CROSS puts you in control of a jumpsuit-wearing hero as he jumps over barrels on a skateboard. If you're feeling adventurous, take control of a treasure hunter as he travels through caverns filled with monsters in BARADUKE. The cartoonish graphics of LEGEND OF VALKYRIE round out the compilation.

title: Tomb Raider II Starring Lara Croft
description: If you think you're ready for a world of incredible adventure, then grab a copy of TOMB RAIDER II for the PlayStation. This exciting TOMB RAIDER sequel will have you swimming, jumping, climbing, backflipping, diving, rolling, and shooting your way across the globe. In this journey, you'll explore frozen Tibet, exotic China, the beautiful canals of Venice, and an underwater ship. You once again play the sexy but deadly Lara Croft. Investigate dark passages, cryptic ruins, and immense caverns over a variety of levels and expansive continents. Attempt to uncover the frightening mystery of The Dagger of Xian, an ancient artifact that leads you over the Great Wall of China and into the very heart of power itself. Wade into battle with your lethal arsenal of weapons that includes pistols, hefty magnums, powerful shotguns, harpoons, and M-16s. You'll fight wily henchmen, vicious sharks, Yetis, Warrior Monks, and rabid Dobermans in your dangerous quest of puzzle solving, action, and discovery.
platforms: PS PSP PS3 PC Mac iPhone

title: Diddy Kong Racing
description: DIDDY KONG RACING may have the Technicolor fantasy backgrounds and cute characters (like Timber and Conker) from a child's daydream, but this is no playground. Only consistently good and strategic play will win and advance your chosen cutie. There are 30 courses over five different happy-time worlds, all part of a giant Overworld. Racing is only part of the player's challenges, which include boss characters to defeat, stacks of silver coins to collect, multicolor balloons to snag, and yellow floating bananas to gobble up. After achieving success in a series of straight races, you then have to complete missions handed out by the pesky bosses. Each mission is harder, and after you manage to collect enough trophies for them you still have to race cute opponents in a sequential series of races to complete and win the Trophy Race. But there's help in the form of cool new weapons and vehicles, including a plane and a hovercraft. The game is beautifully rendered in all its bubble gum glory, and play is enhanced by the development of Realtime Dynamic Animation, which enables polygons to be more flexible and cover more area of Overworld.

title: G-Police
description: When your sister becomes a murder victim due to a big corporate cover-up, it's time for you to step in and take your revenge. You're Jeff Slater, the newest member of the volunteer-only G-Police. The investigation into your sister's death has left more questions than answers, and the official conclusion that her demise was a suicide strikes you as highly unlikely. Piloting a helicopter called Havoc, you'll cruise through 35 levels of combat and strategy in hopes of finding the perpetrators of this horrible crime and bringing them to justice vigilante style. Set over 51 unique landscapes and city environments, G-POLICE uses 3D action to fill two CDs with equal parts combat and plot points. You'll be met by futuristic street gangs, covert spies, and gigantic corporations that seem to have the world's powers working to help them widen their rule. This death was no accident, and you're the only person who can prove it.

title: Clock Tower
description: Scissorman is loose. He has a deformed face wrapped in gauze, a nasty limp, and wields a sharp pair of three foot long scissors. Eleven people have come face to face with Scissorman only one has ever escaped. The carnage cannot continue. Who can unmask the crazed killer and bring him to justice? Take control of psychiatrist Helen Maxwell, or the only person to escape from Scissorman, Jennifer Simpson. The character you choose matters, as each one has a unique approach to the mystery, and how well you play the game determines which of each character's five different endings you see. Guide either character with a point and click interface as they gather clues and solve puzzles in effort to discover the identity of Scissorman and put an end to the slaughter. Play CLOCK TOWER, and try to capture Scissorman.
rating_content: Animated Blood and Gore, Animated Violence

title: CART World Series
description: CART WORLD SERIES brings the spills and chills of CART racing to the PlayStation. To get a grip on controlling the ultra-fast cars, work with the Practice mode. After learning how to stay off of the walls and on the track, take on CART professionals Al Unser, Jr., Bobby Rahal, Gil de Faren and others in a single race on one of 10 real world tracks including Cleveland, Michigan, and Long Beach. If beating those guys once is not enough, then try to beat them repeatedly and win the championship in the Season mode. With the championship under your belt, challenge your friends to a race in the Two-Player mode. Getting more racing action than you'll find in CART WORLD SERIES would require a pit pass.

title: Bravo Air Race
description: Sick of the same old car racing games, with lap after lap of left turns? Well, why not race planes? You can choose from an initial stable of 10 planes, as you take to the skies to prove your mettle as a speedy, agile pilot. You'll have the opportunity to slide into the cockpit of the Lightning, Mustang, Thunderbolt, Corsair, Zero Fighter, Messerschmitt, Sinden, Spitfire, Geebee, Pitts, and two hidden planes. Each craft is rated for its speed, acceleration, and mobility. After selecting your transportation, take your pick from four distinctly detailed courses on which to run: Canyon, Snow Land, South City, or Mountain. In each game, you'll race against a computer flyer for three laps, trying to be the first to make it to the finish line in the sky. Keep your eyes peeled for arrows, or listen to the announcer's voice, as you'll need all the clues you can get to know when to turn, dive, or climb. If you win, you can try out a different course, or just play a round of Time Attack which challenges you to race against your own best time. If you're looking for a change of pace from standard racing fare, this one's a breath of fresh air.

title: WCW vs. The World
description: WCW VS. THE WORLD for the PlayStation offers a huge amount of options for a wrestling game to keep even the most skilled gamer busy for a long time. To begin, there are 52 wrestlers to play as, each with unique moves that can only be performed by learning the button combinations. Some of the most popular wrestlers, such as Hollywood Hulk Hogan and Sting are represented, each in fully polygonal form. Everything is in full 3D, giving the game a highly realistic appearance that is apparent as soon as the fighting begins. There are seven modes to choose from, each featuring a different set of options and rules. Some match types allow two humans to fight against each other, which others are strictly a battle between one person and the computer. WCW VS. THE WORLD has many wrestlers and many play modes, making it the obvious choose among wrestling fans.

title: Mace: The Dark Age
description: In MACE: The Dark Age, you battle other warriors in fantastic worlds that transport you back to the mythical times of the Arabian Nights and the legends of the Far East. The Mace of Tanus, a magical weapon created by the wizard Asmodeus in 1300 A.D., gives immortality and unlimited powers to its owner. Although originally created with the good intention of benefiting the world, the powers of the Mace bewitch anyone who wields this mighty weapon into craving more. The most formidable fighters have now come together to vie for the Mace, with the winner facing Asmodeus. But the question remains can a sorcerer armed with such powers be defeated? MACE: The Dark Age offers 12 fighters, fast play control, and fantastic special effects for your total gaming enjoyment. You'll also find counterattacks, which are key to a successful battle. With 3D graphics that push the boundaries of your N64's capabilities, you can hurl various objects at your opponents, all the while saving yourself from lava, quicksand, and other deadly obstacles.

title: Top Gear Rally
description: Shift it into high gear in one of the most realistic games of any kind to hit the N64. Already something of a legend, TOP GEAR RALLY allows you to choose from one of four high-octane modes: Time Attack, Practice, Arcade, and Championship. Time Attack pits you against your own best time, while Practice and Arcade modes allow you to take your choice from nine different vehicles and race in a number of weather conditions. Championship mode the game's crown jewel has you racing through six seasons (of two to four races apiece), and gives you control of everything, right down to your camera angle. You'll start in 20th place in each of these races, playing catch-up as you try to prove your mettle. You can customize your transmission, tires, steering, and even your paint job! The physics of TOP GEAR RALLY are so studied, they often become painful; a crash is really going to feel like a crash. With nine different cars to choose from, five intense tracks, and ultra-detailed 3D action, it's no wonder this game spawned so many sequels and knockoffs.

title: NBA ShootOut '98
description: NBA ShootOut '98 is the second installment in the NBA ShootOut series. The game can be played either as a fast-action arcade game, or as a detailed simulation with realistic features like fatigue and play calling. You can use all sorts of real moves like crossovers and pump fakes to penetrate the defense and finish it off with a variety of rim-rattling dunks. Players can go it alone or take on a friend in the Versus mode. A unique feature of NBA ShootOut '98 is the icon-passing system, which allows you to pass to a specific teammate at any given time. This takes the guesswork out of the passing game and lets you run your offense just like the pros.

title: Yoshi's Story
description: Yoshi's entire world has been transformed into a picture book, and the Super Happy Tree has gone missing on top of it all! Who would so recklessly take the source of the Yoshis' power? Baby Bowser, that's who. Now the Yoshis must look to their six babies to eat lots of fruit, get powerful, and restore equilibrium to the world. You start out as one of six baby Yoshis, exploring the island in either Story mode or Trial mode. The game is divided into six pages, and you must eat 30 pieces of fruit in order to turn each page. To get the fruit, Yoshi may swim, walk, run, push items, jump, stomp on enemies, and pound the ground. If Yoshi swallows an enemy, the enemy then turns into an egg, which can be broken to reveal hidden platforms, items, or other secrets. There are 24 levels in all, but you can't actually see them all in one game, making it a long-lasting adventure. For those interested in a faster adventure, Trial mode simply requires you to rack up points.

title: Klonoa: Door to Phantomile
description: Why is that people cannot remember their dreams? It is because the energy from dreams is collected in the Moon Kingdom where it is given substance. This rule was broken when Klonoa, a cat-like creature with wings on his ears, dreams that an airship crashes violently into a hill and a mysterious shadow hangs over the wreckage. When the dream comes true, Klonoa and his friend Huepow go to investigate. You take control of Klonoa as he travels through a dozen levels of action. As luck would have it, Klonoa will encounter a number of enemies who want to stop him. Fortunately, Klonoa can grab enemies and use them as weapons to destroy other bad guys, or throw them to the ground and propel himself upward. Besides grabbing enemies, Klonoa can also pump up larger enemies and make them explode. Help discover the reason for the dream in Klonoa: Door to Phantomile.

title: Ray Tracers
description: If you live in any metropolitan area, you know what a pain traffic can be. Do you ever wish you could just drive through the other cars without destroying your vehicle, getting a ticket, and having to pay higher insurance premiums? Now you can do just that in RAY TRACERS. Get behind the wheel of an indestructible automobile, race through several exotic locales, and destroy any car that gets in your way. When you get to the end of a particular course, you will get up to one minute to destroy a boss vehicle, which include helicopters and planes. Try to keep the freeways clear of traffic and live out your wildest driving fantasies with RAY TRACERS.

title: Triple Play '99
description: Get ready to round the bases in TRIPLE PLAY '99 from EA Sports. Step up to the plate as one of over 1300 real-life players and hear the crowd roar as you blast a grand slam into the bleachers. Visit all 30 of the major league stadiums, which are stunning recreations. Look up all the pertinent stats you need to succeed as you work your way through the season. A virtual sea of information is on offer to assist aspiring team managers. Round the bases in an assortment of modes like Single Game, Playoffs, and everyone's favorite, Home Run Derby. Listen in Dolby Surround sound to flawless sound effects and analysis from pro commentators Jim Houston and Buck Martinez. View motion-captured player animations, trade unwanted players, and even compete in day and night games. With TRIPLE PLAY '99, America's favorite pastime comes alive in all its glory.

title: Bloody Roar
description: BLOODY ROAR pits eight fighters with unique "Spirit Animals" against each other. Don't just beat your opponents; pummel them into the ground by using combo after combo, or transforming into the character's "Spirit Animal," which might be a killer rabbit, gorilla, fox, or something else, entirely. See the moment of victory with instant replays that show the blow that put the loser down for good. Every fighter is involved in the tournament for his or her own reasons, and you can play as each of the characters to learn those reasons. With all of the action in BLOODY ROAR, the beast in you just might come out.

title: X-Men: Children of the Atom
description: X-MEN: Children of the Atom for the PlayStation is a port of the original arcade hit. The game features 2D animation, much like the art in the comic books that thrust the X-Men into the limelight. Many of the characters from the comics appear, from the popular to the obscure. The team's leader (Cyclops) shows up, as does the teleporter from another dimension named Spiral. Each character contains an extensive list of moves that start out simple but get progressively more difficult to perform. Careful timing and button combinations execute the moves, so plenty of practice is required. There is a Two-Player mode that lets you and a friend go head-to-head in a battle to the death. The backgrounds are all locations inspired from the cartoon and feature many of the well-known headquarters and bases. X-MEN: Children of the Atom fits the classic Capcom mold, yet has an identity all to itself.

title: Extreme-G
description: Lovingly called XG by its developers, the game pits up to four players against each other in insanely fast cyber bike races down tracks that make Six Flags look like a golf course. There are more than a dozen magnetic tracks, bikes, weapons, boosts, loops, drops, corkscrews and jumps -- but if you had to choose only one trait that sets XG apart from the slew of other N64 racers, it's SPEED. The game is very, very, very fast. There are more than 12 weapons types, including all kinds of missiles, flash bombs, mines, laser tripwires and even a flame thrower. If you thought using Mario Kart's "lightning item" was a dirty trick, wait until you see XG's portal holes, sling shots or the "static pulse ray" that reverses your opponents controls.

title: NFL Quarterback Club '98
description: Get pumped up for hard-hitting NFL action with this detailed football simulation from Iguana. The same folks that brought you TUROK have turned their attentions to the gridiron and have brought great graphics, realistic action, and lots of options to the sport. With full licenses from the NFL and its athletes, the game has all of the teams and players, plus perfect replications of logos and stadiums. You can play an individual game or a full season in which your stats will be kept in nine different categories. Whichever mode you're playing in, day-of-game variables include weather, injuries, and penalties, and you can even select from six different camera angles while playing. There's also a Historical mode that lets you tap into classic games of yesteryear. If all that's not enough to keep you going, you can actually design your own players to throw into the fray! Just to assure that the artificial intelligence was high and the gameplay realistic, the developers coaxed Brett Favre into designing some of the plays and advising them on the finer points of the sport. Well, it worked.

title: Final Fantasy Tactics
description: FINAL FANTASY TACTICS' strategic battle system is a twist on the turn-based system of the other FINAL FANTASY titles. You begin as a noble squire named Ramza in a time of confusion and war in the land of Ivalice. Your best friend, a commoner named Delita, is caught in the middle of the struggle between nobles and commoners, and this affects you; so begins your long quest for the truth. Much of the story in TACTICS is told on the battlefield or as a direct result of battles, which take place on a three-dimensional grid that can be rotated 360 degrees. You select your battle party, put them on the field, and determine their every move. Between battles, you can explore towns and forests on the world map, acquire new items, and undertake side quests. TACTICS has plenty of nostalgia for FINAL FANTASY veterans, as well as a new play style to keep newcomers interested.
platforms: PS PSP Android iPhone PSP PS3

title: Monopoly [1998]
description: Monopoly for the PlayStation introduces a whole new generation to the classic board game. The object of the game is simple: bankrupt your opponents. The gameplay calls for you to roll the dice and circle the board, buy or trade properties, build houses and hotels, and charge rent when your opponents happen to land on them. The more expensive properties are more desirable, as the rent is proportionately higher. You must also avoid the long arm of the law and jail time, which causes you to lose a turn and potential profit. From the look of the board itself, to the wheelbarrow, race car, and dog used as pieces, to the color of the deeds, every detail is accounted for in the PlayStation version. You can play with up to eight players with a multi-tap, or go it alone against the computer.

title: Auto Destruct
description: In AUTO DESTRUCT you're behind the wheel of a sports car with destructive capabilities. Your car is equipped with tons of tools to help you wipe out Lazarus' minions and get the revenge you've been waiting for. The cities are huge with room to maneuver; you'll enjoy the free 360-degree movement this game offers. However, it'll require more strategy than just blowing stuff up. You'll have to keep track of your weapons, fuel, and ammo because nothing is unlimited. AUTO DESTRUCT will give you hours of gameplay, due to its wide variety of challenging missions. There are a total of 25 of them, each seemingly different than the next. You'll encounter various search-and-destroy missions, escorting tasks, defending levels, and races to the death. The environments are very detailed and they include moving pedestrians, traffic, and many different camera angles.
rating_content: Animated Blood and Gore, Animated Violence

title: Resident Evil 2 [1998]
description: Raccoon City has somehow fallen victim to a zombie outbreak and it's up to you as either police officer Leon Kennedy, or Claire Redfield (sister to Chris Redfield from RE1), to find out what's going on. The adventure, which takes place in 3D using pre-rendered backgrounds, drags you through spooky crash sites, abandoned buildings, experiments gone wrong and more -- all the while battling undead monstrosities, solving puzzles and, most of all, trying to stay alive. Lots of weapons and other gadgetry allow for some truly disgusting mayhem. It's an incredibly frightening game that delivers a light back-story and lots of slasher movie, jump-out-and-go-boo scares.
platforms: PS N64 PSP DC G.com PS3 GCN

title: Riven: The Sequel to Myst
description: The intrigue of MYST returns as Atrus tries to outwit Gehn for good putting an end to his corruptive ways. Can you help Atrus solve the labyrinth of puzzles awaiting him on the island of Riven? Enter a deceptively delicate world torn apart by age-old family conflicts as you search, explore, and call on every ounce of intuition you can muster. The successful structure of the first installment is once again in place, as you roam the mostly desolate island, scouring its rooms for portals, clues, and secret chambers. Each world you enter is a superb blend of delicate beauty and nail-biting suspense, and each riddle is more difficult than the last. The few beings you do encounter are as reclusive and mysterious as the game itself and there's an array of pathways at your disposal each leading to a unique and stunning fate. With groundbreaking graphics and sound, over three hours of astonishing animation, and a story that would make Dickens weep, RIVEN is a truly engrossing masterwork.
platforms: PS Mac iPhone Saturn PC iPad Android PDA

title: WCW Nitro
description: Another wrestling game is adding to the PlayStation's ranks with WCW NITRO from THQ. The game features over 16 superstars, including Hollywood Hulk Hogan, Lex Luger, Kevin Nash, Macho Man Randy Savage, and Sting. Each grappler is completely unique, with over 30 moves that can be performed, and after certain tasks have been completed, there are even more wrestlers that become playable. WCW NITRO contains three different modes: Exhibition, Tag Team, and Tournament. The Tag Team mode lets one player take two men to the ring against two other athletes in an epic battle, where the winner is the last team standing. THQ has even licensed official music from popular bands such as Korn to help get gamers in the fighting mood. WCW NITRO delivers the true wrestling experience with plenty of wrestlers and just as many gameplay options.

title: Red Asphalt
description: Aliens have taken over the Earth, and for their entertainment they force different species to race to the death in RED ASPHALT. You must choose from six different vehicles and try to blast the opposition off of the road with plasma guns, oil slicks, and even napalm. While you are blasting, don't forget to win the race. After winning a race, you gain experience points (to raise your driver's targeting accuracy and damage stats), cash (to buy armor, more powerful weapons or new cars), and "chaos" points, which are required to advance to new worlds that have unique environments. You can also take on a friend in Versus mode. If you survive all of the races, you just might win your freedom in RED ASPHALT.

title: Micro Machines V3
description: An overhead-viewed racer sounds like something out of the '80s, and indeed in many respects, Micro Machines is a retrogame. Racing is ever so simple. The player chooses a Micro Machine -- which range from racing cars and offroad trucks to big rigs and ice cream trucks -- and races it over a series of weird and wonderful, differently-themed courses. A breakfast table mightn't sound like a thrilling place to race, but when you're a piddly Micro Machine, all of a sudden spilled milk becomes a lake, splotches of syrup become deadly sticky pools and spoons, bowls and bottles become building-sized obstacles. Another course is set on a series of school desks. Pencils, erasers and books form impassable obstacles, and the rulers connecting the desks form thin, perilous roads whose lack of guard rails means a deadly fall is only a spaz twitch away.

title: BallBlazer Champions
description: Ballblazer is a futuristic version of one-on-one indoor soccer, but with the use of a variety of weapons. Much like soccer, your goal is to put the ball in the net more times than your opponent does. Each player rides around in a rotofoil, used to speed around the arena field. However, in order to win the match, you must win three, four-minute rounds. Sounds easy enough, but you have to beat eight challengers in order to be the Ballblazer champion. Ballblazer offers eight characters to choose from and four modes of gameplay, including Practice, Tournament, Single-Player Free Play, and Two-Player Free Play. Each mode offers its own variety of fun!

title: Fantastic Four
description: At the beginning of FANTASTIC FOUR, Subterraneans and creatures from Monster Island have take over the city. Now, it is up to the Fantastic Four to drive the bad guys away and save the city. Choose to play as Mr. Fantastic, Invisible Woman, Thing, Human Torch, or She Hulk. Then punch and kick your way through various levels of enemies. Thankfully, every character has special moves that utilize their unique powers. However, to unleash the most powerful attacks, the characters must use a limited supply of force energy. If you have friends who want to play, get four people playing at the same time. Should you have no friends, computer-controlled drones can fill in and help you out. Take control of the FANTASTIC FOUR as they beat up the bad guys and save the city.

title: FIFA Road to World Cup 98
description: Backed by the complete FIFA World Cup license, FIFA: Road to World Cup allows the best of soccer gamers to compete against over 172 nations for the greatest treasure in the land of soccer, the World Cup.This game features 16 fully rendered stadiums accompanied by some beautiful polygonal soccer players. In fact, the on-field players are detailed right down to their facial features and signature hair styles. Besides the authentic stadium sounds, FIFA: Road to World Cup 98 will not only have play-by-play announcements by John Motson and Andy Grey, but it will also have in-game commentary by French, German, Spanish, Italian, and Japanese announcers.
platforms: PS Gen GBC PC N64 Saturn

title: NCAA GameBreaker '98
description: NCAA GAMEBREAKER '98 has all the features you look for in a college football sim. You have over 100 Division 1-A teams to choose from as you begin your quest for the National Championship. You can also create your own plays, and if you can't find that player that fits your needs, create your own in the Create-A-Player mode. You also get Total Control Passing, which lets you lead or underthrow your receivers, whichever gives them the best chance at making the catch. The game also uses a new graphics engine, meaning that you'll see some of the most realistic football action to date. So get ready to make a run at the National Championship with NCAA GAMEBREAKER '98. Just try to avoid any recruiting violations!

title: MDK
description: Strap on a skintight jumpsuit and a big pterodactyl-looking helmet in MDK, and get ready for some serious gunplay. You play Kurt, who is heavily armed and sent to investigate a spacecraft full of aliens who are intent on destroying the Earth. You race through room after room, taking on the aliens and occasionally engaging in some sniper-view action. MDK sports uniquely designed visuals, impressive level design, and well-designed enemies. The best part of the game has to be the selection of weapons, which range from the world's smallest nuclear bomb to inflatable cows. There is also a very cool Sniper mode, which allows you to get up close and personal with your enemies, all the while keeping a safe distance away. The soundtrack is done by one of the best companies in the business, Tommy Tallarico Studios, who opted for a cinematic score. MDK is considered one of the best action adventure games to ever grace the PlayStation.

title: NBA Fastbreak '98
description: Midway enters the world of PlayStation basketball with NBA FASTBREAK '98, which includes all of the teams and players from the NBA. Once you have picked your favorite team, use the Practice mode to learn the controls, or play a little One-on-One to work with a specific player. When you want some competition you can challenge a friend or a computer to a game in the Exhibition mode, and if you think you have what it takes to become NBA champion, lead a team through the grueling NBA Season. If you don't like dealing with the ups and downs of a season, just skip it and go straight to the Playoffs. In all of the modes, you have the option to play with or without substitutions, injuries, and on-the-fly play calling. See if you can lead your team to victory in NBA FASTBREAK '98.

title: Star Wars: Masters of Teras Kasi
description: Can you imagine what would happen if all of your favorite STAR WARS characters showed up in a 3D fighting game? Well, that's exactly what happens in this brilliant mix of two worlds. The story goes something like this Darth Vader has summoned a warrior named Arden Lyn to destroy Luke and his pals in a fighting tournament. Set over the course of nine locations from the original STAR WARS trilogy, STAR WARS: Master of Teras Kasi lets you fight as familiar characters, such as Luke, Han Solo, Chewbacca, Princess Leia, a Tusken Raider, Boba Fett, and many more. You'll be able to unlock more fighters as the game progresses, including Darth Vader, Slave Leia, a Stormtrooper, and others. Each character has their own punches and kicks, and comes armed with appropriate weaponry and armor. You can even unlock secret Force techniques, allowing the game to play out like some sort of lost episode. Play alone, or take on a buddy.

title: Courier Crisis
description: You would never be caught wearing blue shorts and black socks, and just the thought of going from house to house gives you the hives. Your biggest enemy is the clock, not the dog at 502 Maple Drive. You're the person who gets the call when the post office fails. You are the bicycle courier of the concrete jungle. Pick up your package and make the delivery within the time limit. Getting to the delivery site requires punching and kicking pedestrians out of the way and taking crazy jumps over the traffic. When the package gets there on time, you will earn big money to upgrade your bike. With over 250 deliveries in five different cities, there is plenty of money to be had. Do you have the skills to navigate the asphalt island? Play COURIER CRISIS and find out.

title: Monster Rancher
description: MONSTER RANCHER is the ultimate interactive experience. The game disc actually reads a small portion of any CD you put into your PlayStation, and uses that data to generate a monster. Some CDs will yield giant dragons, while others will give you smaller and less threatening beasts. After you create a monster, you then must train it in the ways of the monster pugilist. You control every aspect of the monster's training, from what it eats to what attributes it will be focus on improving. Monsters can be frozen for later use, or even combined with other monsters to form hybrid creatures that possess different abilities. The point of the game is to become the champion monster breeder, and there are rankings that give you an idea as to where you stand. Most of MONSTER RANCHER consists of point-and-click menus, with the exception of the fights themselves. There are two different options for fighting: you can let the computer control your beast or you can take manual control of it yourself.

title: Castlevania: Symphony of the Night
description: While its retro 2D graphics may have off-put some PlayStation gamers at first, anyone owning a 16-bit system can easily appreciate the greatness of Konami's Castlevania: Symphony of the Night. Konami took the side-scrolling idea to its fullest in this title. The game's enormous maps, huge range of weapons, constant enemies, and excellent balance all still puts this squarely on the all-time list, no questions asked. Add to that a memorable soundtrack and you have a gothic masterpiece that will serve as a benchmark for many future 2D action titles.
platforms: PS LCD Xbox 360 PSP PS3 Saturn
rating_content: Animated Blood and Gore, Animated Violence

title: Mischief Makers
description: Developed by Treasure, Mischief Makers stars a robotic cleaning maid named Marina on a mission to rescue her kidnapped creator from the clutches of an evil emperor. As with most evil folk, the emperor isn't about to just hand over the aging scientist, and has amassed an army to stop Marina at all costs. To reach the emperor and rescue her creator, Marina must make her way through five different worlds with 12 stages each. While some levels focus on straightforward action, others present the player with puzzle elements that must be overcome in order to make it to the goal. Released in Japan under the nameby Enix.

title: Croc: Legend of the Gobbos
description: There once was a village of super-cute animals known as the gobbos. One day, a basket washed onto the shore of the village, and inside it was a baby crocodile. The gobbos, feeling sorry for the abandoned baby, took it in and raised it as a gobbo, naming him Croc. However, the baby began to grow and eventually outgrew the village. Wherever Croc would go, he unintentionally caused destruction. Just as Croc was contemplating whether or not to leave his adopted home, the evil Baron Dante and his followers, the Dantinis, kidnapped the gobbos. Take control of Croc as he travels through 45 levels of running and jumping action trying to rescue the gobbos. Luckily, Croc knows some special moves, like the butt stomp and spin, which will help him dispose of the bad guys. Will Croc be able to save all of friends? Play CROC: Legend of the Gobbos and find out.

title: Formula 1: Championship Edition
description: FORMULA 1: Championship Edition continues the FORMULA 1 series' tradition of realism and excellent gameplay. With a full license from the FIA, all of the teams, drivers, and tracks from the F1 season are included. Thanks to the power of the PlayStation, every driver has unique artificial intelligence that recreates the racing style of every driver. For a quick racing fix, you can play the Arcade mode that allows aggressive driving, including bumping opponents and driving off of the track. For true fanatics, play the Grand Prix mode and tackle the challenges of realistic physics and damage. Unlike the previous game, accidents can result in cars being thrown into the air, which gives the game a more realistic look and feel. With all of the action and improvements in FORMULA 1: Championship Edition, F1 racing has never been so realistic.

title: Beast Wars: Transformers
description: In BEAST WARS you travel along the planet's surface and explore many areas, looking to destroy any enemies that cross your path. The innovative auto-targeting system locks on to any enemies in your area and makes for some straightforward killing. However, don't think it's going to be easy, as you will have to dodge enemy gunfire at the same time. Eventually, your character will use up his Energon supply and you will have to refuel by transforming into Beast mode. While in Beast mode you cannot attack, and your sole purpose is to find power-ups to restore your Energon. BEAST WARS offers 10 different transformers to choose from, each with their own traits. You'll also have the chance to battle in four different environments, each having its own set of enemies. With 24 missions to play and eight bonus missions, you'll have plenty to keep you occupied. Transformers fans will love this game.

title: Mortal Kombat Mythologies: Sub-Zero
description: MK MYTHOLOGIES: Sub-Zero focuses on the popular MK character Sub-Zero, as it delves into his past with Scorpion, and how he got involved in the Mortal Kombat tournament. MKM plays like an MK game except that instead of fighting in the confines of an arena, you are free to run around the environment. The controls are identical to MK3, except that buttons for picking up items and turning around have been added. Sub-Zero's MK3 combos are available as are his special moves, which must be earned through experience points. You'll also get impressive FMV sequences that help tell the story and explain a lot of unanswered questions about Sub Zero's past.
rating_content: Animated Blood and Gore, Animated Violence

title: Mega Man X4
description: MEGA MAN X4 marks a return to action for this popular franchise. The gameplay, as in all previous MEGA MAN titles, is challenging. Each level includes little secrets and unique terrain, and each new weapon or fighting move you learn will take practice before you can utilize them. The various enemies are sneaky and will put up quite a fight, although the real challenge comes at the end of each level with the huge bosses. The game allows you to play as two different characters, each with different sidekicks and weapons. The game plays differently for each character, almost giving you a two-for-one feeling. If you play as X, your experience will be very similar to the other MEGA MAN X games, while if you choose Zero, the story is pretty much the same, but you have to change your approach in battles and traversing the terrain.
platforms: PS PC PSP Saturn PS3 Vita

title: PGA Tour '98
description: Go on the links with EA Sports' PGA TOUR '98. The game features five championship courses: the exclusively licensed Pebble Beach Golf Links, The Bay Hill Club, TPC of Scottsdale, Colonial Country Club, and TPC at Sawgrass. Each course has been designed using actual blueprints of the real courses, resulting in amazingly realistic graphics. Every hole features the real characteristics and surroundings of the real thing, including trees on the fairways, sloping hills, huge bunkers, and tricky greens. Compete as or against 14 PGA Tour pros, including Mark O'Meara, Lee Janzen, Davis Love III, and Brad Faxon. All 14 pros' swings and unique post-shot reactions were digitized into the game to give you the most realistic golf experience imaginable.

title: Resident Evil: Director's Cut
description: Face your fears in the ultimate experience of suspense and terror. Blood-thirsty zombies. Mutant beasts. Monstrous serpents. Untold mysteries lurk around every corner. The nightmare lives on in the award-winning game of survival horror.
rating_content: Animated Blood and Gore, Animated Violence

title: Marvel Super Heroes
description: Get ready to strap on some spandex tights and deal out serious damage in another Capcom fighter, MARVEL SUPER HEROES. This game features characters from the classic Marvel Comics lineup. Four characters Psylocke, Wolverine, Juggernaut, and Magneto return from Capcom's previous comic-based fighter, X-MEN: Children of the Atom. New characters include Captain America, Spider-Man, Iron Man, Hulk, and more. You'll find the type of gameplay that gamers have come to expect from the STREET FIGHTER series, including dragon punches, fireballs, and huge combos. MARVEL SUPER HEROES is based on the hugely popular arcade game of the same name, and Capcom has even thrown in a few new characters to spice things up. If you're feeling sociable, you can also take on a friend in Versus mode and see who is the baddest super hero.

title: NHL Breakaway '98
description: NHL Breakaway ?98 from Iguana West (same company that made WWF Warzone) is not what most people expect from I West. When you think of the previous titles that Iguana West has produced, you think of arcade-like games. Not this one, NHL Breakaway is a realistic, stat driven game. Most hockey lovers look for realism in a game and with Wayne Gretzky?s 3D hockey the only other hockey game for the N64, it is the first of its kind. Full stat tracking in more than 40 categories, team reports from Keith Tkachuk, good graphics and control and five gameplay modes.

title: Wayne Gretzky's 3D Hockey '98
description: Tear up the ice with "The Great One" and experience lightning fast skating, blistering one-timers and hard-hitting body checks.

title: Alundra
description: Between the worlds of light and dark lies the world of dreams. A world where the rule of reason loosens its grip. A place where an insidious evil is stealing minds and blackening the hearts of those from the world of light.Grab a weapon and become the dreamwalker Alundra as he struggles to purge the evil Id of an ancient world before it falls to ash. Explore dungeons, find weapons, solve challenging puzzles, and kick some serious monster butt as you weave between tense reality and nightmarish dreams to save the hapless masses. With a wide cast of characters and scores of challenging puzzles created by the people responsible for Landstalker on the Genesis, Alundra will rob you of precious sleep until you finish!

title: Robotron 64
description: You're humanity's last hope against a race of robots so powerful, their intelligence and strength eclipses that of human beings! This descendant of the arcade original, ROBOTRON 2084, gives you access to classic characters, 26 new enemies, 200 distinct levels (plus bonus stages), and stunning 3D arenas. Choose your specialty weapon carefully, because it's your only ally in this futuristic destruction fest. For fans of the original, this is a faithful update. The colors are breathtaking, and the play is considerably quicker than the coin-op, but with a similar feel. The techno music and detailed environments are welcome twists, but the action will take you right back to the double-joysticked pizza parlor favorite. If bloodless carnage is your bag, you'll be thrilled at the thousands of robots you get to mow down in ROBOTRON 64.

title: FIFA Road to World Cup 98
description: FIFA Road to World Cup 98 is a vastly improved semi-sequel to FIFA 64. The title features hundreds of real-life players, a huge selection of stadiums and different weather conditions, and is the first to use the N64's native medium-resolution in its main game mode. And like all games from EA, FIFA features a Dolby Surround license and some surprisingly cool audio.
platforms: N64 Gen GBC PC PS Saturn

title: Street Fighter Collection
description: STREET FIGHTER is one the most successful videogame franchises in history. Now you can relive some of that history with STREET FIGHTER COLLECTION. The three games included are: SUPER STREET FIGHTER II, SUPER STREET FIGHTER II TURBO, and STREET FIGHTER ALPHA 2 GOLD. All the games are perfect translations of their arcade counterparts; each fighter retains its moves and combinations, including fireballs and quick throws. When you win the martial arts tournament, you will discover that character's motivation for fighting. If you are a STREET FIGHTER fan, you owe it to yourself to get your hands on STREET FIGHTER COLLECTION.

title: Chameleon Twist
description: Who would have thought the life of a garden-variety chameleon could be so exciting? After following a white rabbit into the fantastic fantasy of CHAMELEON TWIST, Davy the chameleon finds himself on a chase through six bombastic worlds of adventure in the Land of Wonder. That elusive rabbit leads him on a merry chase through "Jungle Land," "Ant Land," "Bomb Land," "Desert Castle," "Kids Land," and "Ghost Castle." Thankfully, Davy has an extensive Training mode to hone his skills before he has to face the dangers. If a solo adventure isn't what you had in mind you can invite up to three friends over for some thundering multiplayer action. Two to four players can fight it out in one of two Battle Modes: Battle Royale and Time Trials. The Time Trials take place in the training rooms, where players fight it out for the best times. Whether you prefer to play solo or with a pack of friends, CHAMELEON TWIST is the most fun you'll have until you grow a six-foot-long tongue of your own.

title: One
description: ONE puts you in the shoes of one-armed John Cain, who awakens in a strange apartment building and discovers that his left arm has been replaced by a huge gun. Confused and rightfully upset, Cain leaves the building and is chased by mysterious military personal that are apparently intent on killing him. As Cain, you must work your way through wave after wave of police, helicopters, and huge bosses. To combat them you can either use your newly installed arm cannon, or rely on more traditional fighting weapons like punch and kicking combos. But you will also have to use your head, as most bosses cannot be killed by direct gunfire, and instead require that you use the environment to take them out.

title: Parappa The Rapper
description: PARAPPA THE RAPPER is about a rapping dog named PaRappa and his friends PJ Berri, Sunny Funny, and Katy Kat. Appearing almost more like a cartoon than a game, it follows PaRappa's fascination with Sunny Funny, a sunflower. PaRappa will go through several rites of passage learning courage, getting a driving license, and going on dates. The crux of PaRappa lies in the rapping segments of the game. To get to the next stage, you must reproduce the raps of a number of teachers. Rapping is accomplished by pressing the correct buttons at the correct moments, all in time to the music. This may sound easy, and it is at first, but it gets more and more difficult as the game goes on. With impressive visuals, a memorable soundtrack, and a cast of oddball characters, PARAPPA THE RAPPER is a PlayStation classic.

title: Critical Depth
description: Douglas McKragen, the world famous sea explorer, disappeared after discovering five alien pods. Now 12 different factions, each with their own motivation, have entered the water in an effort to find out what happened and to take control of the pods. Align yourself with one of the 12 factions and take control of their submarine. Embark on 11 missions in the Story mode and find the truth behind McKragen's disappearance. If the action becomes too much for you, have a friend help you out with the cooperative play option. If asking for help is not your style, play against your friends in the Battle mode in which both of you try to capture the pods and escape, or a death match, where blasting subs into tiny bits is the order of the day. Do you have the skills to survive CRITICAL DEPTH?

title: Intelligent Qube
description: You live in a world inhabited by large blocks, and your only purpose in life is to eliminate them. You accomplish this by setting traps to destroy the nefarious cubes. Red traps will destroy one block at a time; destroy a green cube and earn a green trap, which destroy the blocks in a three-by-three area. Beware of the black cubes, though, because destroying one will remove part of the platform you are standing on. If you don't destroy the cubes fast enough, they roll to your location and push you off the edge. Once all of the cubes are gone, you will advance to the next level, where the platform is wider and the cubes move much faster. For the social types out there, there is a two-player mode where challengers take on eight different stages to see who can earn the best score. Puzzle game fanatics will find something to cheer about in INTELLIGENT QUBE.

title: Car and Driver Presents Grand Tour Racing 98
description: Imagine barreling down the streets of Moscow in a sports car at 200 mph. Now you don't have to imagine it, because this kind of Grand Tour racing comes to the PlayStation with GRAND TOUR RACING '98. Choose from a lineup of 40 cars in five different classes: Indy, rally, sports, dune buggy, and off-road. Then get ready to race in one of the six exotic locations: Moscow, Egypt, Scotland, Hong Kong, Switzerland, and Easter Island. Each of the tracks has six variations for a total of 36 different courses. For those who want more of a challenge than a single race, pick one of six real world GT teams and try to win the season championship. Should friends visit you, play the two-player Split-Screen mode or use a link cable and have up to four people playing at once. Take the challenge of GT racing with GRAND TOUR RACING '98 and put your driving skills to the test.

title: Jersey Devil
description: The evil Dr. Knarf is trying to take over Jersey City with an army of mutant vegetables. Who can save the city? Only the JERSEY DEVIL, a hero dressed in a purple double-breasted suit and matching mask. You take control of the dapper hero as he explores six expansive levels looking for letters the spell out KNARF. To get a hold of all of the letters, Jersey Devil will have to battle mutant pumpkins, radioactive carrots, cavemen, and ill-tempered dinosaurs. Further complicating things, each stage is divided into three subsections with bosses to battle. Once you've collected all of the letters, a golden K appears and allows access to the levels secret areas. Play JERSEY DEVIL and try to keep the city from becoming a giant salad bowl.

title: Wetrix
description: Your body might be comprised of 90% water, but you're going to be 100% frustrated when you try to manage the waters of WETRIX. Offering up some of the best graphics home gaming has ever seen, WETRIX is pure puzzle-solving mayhem. The premise seems simple enough: move and stack falling pieces to trap rainwater beneath a 3D surface. Of course, if you don't build your dams just right, you'll mess the whole thing up and cause unbelievable chaos: drop a piece in the wrong spot, and you'll inadvertently poke a hole in the delicate crust of your environment; stack the pieces to high, and prepare for a massive earthquake. You have access to bombs and mines that will help you level the landscape if things get messy, and you can use powerful fireballs to evaporate excess water if need be. Use ice cubes to freeze your reservoirs, and rainbows to melt them down again. The controls are very simple, but don't get too vexed if the game takes a few tries to master. WETRIX offers five unique modes, and supports up to two players.

title: Soviet Strike
description: The Soviet Union has crumbled into tiny pieces. With security measures being taken for granted, terrorists seize upon the opportunity to steal nuclear warheads and it's up to you to stop them. Strap yourself behind the controls of a Super Apache attack helicopter and fly into five different Eastern European regions. Each region has been recreated using photographs and maps, meaning you'll see them in the game as they are in real life. In each area, you are confronted with a number of missions. Before each mission, the objectives are spelled out in full-motion video sequences, with objectives ranging from rescuing hostages to taking out radar stations. As expected, you will encounter heavy resistance, but your Apache is well equipped with plenty of weapons. Defend the world from nuclear terrorism in SOVIET STRIKE.

title: X-Men vs. Street Fighter
description: X-MEN VS. STREET FIGHTER for the PlayStation is a port of the arcade game, with a few new twists thrown in to keep it interesting. Namely the team-up aspect has changed, along with some of the moves. This title combines two hugely popular franchises and pits them in battles that rival those seen in the X-MEN comic books. Each character can execute special moves either with a partner or solo, resulting in some devastating attacks that will leave your opponent reeling. Although the game is in 2D with sprite-based graphics, the animation is smooth and the fighting almost resembles a moving comic. The special attacks all look spectacular, often filling the screen with colors and explosions that must be seen to be believed. The combo system may seem difficult to learn at first, but once it's mastered the possibilities are practically endless. X-MEN VS. STREET FIGHTER is an engrossing fighting game that can be played alone or with a friend, with classic characters ranging from Ryu to Rogue.

title: Quest 64
description: The story of this 3D RPG follows the adventures of Brian, a young adventuring boy who has the unique power to manipulate nature, and has been annointed as a guardian of humankind, a so-called Spirit Tamer. Equipped with a large list of magic spells, Brian can alter and control four nature spirits -- earth, water, fire, air -- to his liking, and to the disappointment of his enemies. Gameplay mixes 3D exploration with RPG-style battles. Run around in the environments, talk to people, open treasure chests, use and mix magic via the C-Buttons, and build your character up by fighting battles (which occur randomly outside the towns).

title: Road Rash 3D
description: The ultimate combat motorcycle event returns this time in full 3D! With realistic road conditions and aggressive competition from other bikers, you're going to have your work cut out for you. Racing through panoramic vistas of intense 3D worlds, you'll feel each bump, dip, and harrowing turn. The game has three in-your-face modes: Time Trial, in which players battle computer racers for the best times; Thrash, an arcade-style trip through some amazing terrain; and the Big Game, which pits you against rival racing gangs for the championship. The brutal list of gangs includes the Desades, Dewleys, Kaffe Boys, and the Techgeists each with different bikes, weapons, and preferred race grounds. The individualized AI applied to each gang means that they'll have unique personalities and tactics, making your job all the more difficult. Each track features a different soundscape and the game even includes surround-sound effects to keep you abreast of where your opponents are via audio. ROAD RASH 3D is as cool as it gets without adding a fourth dimension.
rating_content: Realistic Violence, Strong Language, Suggestive Themes

title: Vigilante 8
description: Race into high-octane, car-based combat action with VIGILANTE 8. In a bizarre, alternate version of the 1970's you play as either one of the good Vigilantes or the evil Renegade Coyotes. Drive across varied destructible environments and blast your enemies into oblivion. You can follow a fast and furious storyline in Quest mode (complete with full-motion video rewards and unlockable characters) or simply go at it in deathmatch-style Arcade mode, blowing up your opponents and surroundings while collecting power-ups and awesome weaponry. The design team has obviously been influenced by the TWISTED METAL series, but has really gone beyond the call of duty improving on every feature one would expect in a fast-paced vehicular blast 'em up. Get to know dangerous and wild '70s-style characters, drive tricked-out cars, trucks, and buses, and do your best to auto-exterminate the competition. VIGILANTE 8 is a smashing good time for deathrace dilettantes.

title: Forsaken 64
description: After a shockwave destroys Earth, the rest of the galaxy condemns the solar system. The only people who dare enter the system are bounty hunters and scavengers. You take the role of a glory-seeking scavenger whose only goal is to collect as much loot as possible and escape in one piece.
