description: When high school students from around the country begin to disappear at a rapid rate, five different schools decide to come together and fight each other to determine which school is at fault. Misguided though their efforts may be, it makes for some pretty awesome arena-style fighting. You pick a high school and two members of its student body to serve as a team as you take on all who challenge you. There are 20 characters to choose from right off the bat, and more become available through victories and solid performance. You can bring in your teammate to perform combos, restore your health, or replenish your Vigor Bar a gauge that provides you the ability to perform special attacks and Team-Up techniques. Made by Capcom, the game's fighting will be familiar to those who've enjoyed the STREET FIGHTER series and comfortable to those new to fighting games. The 3D graphics and awesome gameplay are only rivaled by the ingenious story who doesn't enjoy beating up cross-town high school students? With lots of bonuses, secrets, and other hidden goodies, RIVAL SCHOOLS passes with honors.

title: Space Station Silicon Valley
description: The wacky team from DMA Design has created an equally off-the-wall product in Space Station: Silicon Valley, a 3D platformer of sorts that puts players in control of a variety of different robotic animals. All of the madness takes place in the future as a Space Station housing the creatures glides steadily on a destruction path towards Earth. The unique title encourages players, as a robotic chip, to jump into the bodies of these cyborg-animals in order to accomplish various missions. The game features 30+ levels of remarkably well put together missions that have players doing everything from jumping into the bodies of hovering sheep to taking over farting rats in order to solve puzzle-based challenges and advance.

title: Cardinal Syn
description: A 3D tournament fighting game. Play as representatives of warring clans in a struggle to rule the world. Eight characters are available at the start; ten more can be discovered, making for a total of 18 warriors.
rating_content: Animated Blood and Gore, Animated Violence

title: NHL '99
description: EA signed up MBL Research to bring the classic 16-bit EA Sports hockey franchise to the N64. Yes, it is a port of the previous year's PlayStation NHL game, but when you give a starving man a cracker it's going to be the best cracker he's ever had. With all due respect to both Eddie Murphy and MBL Research, NHL '99 took advantage of the N64's capabilities well enough to provide a robust and full hockey game regardless of the other drivel that had appeared on the N64 to that point. You had the full license, you had all of the arenas, you had all of the rules and regulations of hockey, of course. More than all of that however, you had the nonstop hockey action that had been missing from the N64 library.

title: Need for Speed III: Hot Pursuit
description: NEED FOR SPEED 3 throws five game modes your way: Single Race, Tournament, Knockout, Practice, and Hot Pursuit. Tournament is the deepest mode, as it lets you enter a series of racing tours in order to prove your dominance. There are eight cars and eight tracks in the game, although not all of them are available from the get-go. But you can unlock the new cars and tracks by performing well with the initial cars and tracks. Some of the well-known cars you can expect to drive are Ferrari, Lamborghini, and Chevrolet.
rating_content: Suitable for Persons Ages Six and Older

title: Brunswick Circuit Pro Bowling
description: The drama and grace of professional bowling comes to the PC in BRUNSWICK CIRCUIT PRO BOWLING. Choose to play as one of 13 pro bowlers or create a bowler suited to your individual style. Then hit the lanes in any of these modes: Exhibition, Skins, Tournament, Career, and Cosmic Bowling. Once out on the lanes, don't be intimidated by the trash-talk from the other players. Are you ready for the action of BRUNSWICK CIRCUIT PRO BOWLING?
rating_content: Suitable for Persons Ages Six and Older

title: Ninja: Shadow of Darkness
description: Stealth   cunning   throwing stars. These are all qualities you need if you want to be a successful NINJA. When an evil warlord sells his soul in exchange for unopposed control of feudal Japan, a young ninja emerges to battle the army of trolls, goblins, and evil spirits he unleashes. To defeat the warlord, you must use your ninja skills with your fists, feet, and magical powers to make your way through 10 dangerous levels, filled with ruthless enemies and perilous physical hazards. You'll also get some impressive-looking ninja spells and simple puzzle elements that will challenge your intellect. NINJA: Shadow of Darkness will remind many gamers of other throw-down-beat-¿em-ups like DOUBLE DRAGON and FIGHTING FORCE.

title: Caesar III
description: For those of you who never played the original Caesar, or the even better Caesar II, you should know that this is a game of construction. If you need a comparison, it most closely resembles SimCity--some fans even call it SimRome. In Caesar III, you take on the job of a provincial governor in the Roman Empire, trying to extend the borders of Roman civilization and raising a great city out of the pagan dust. You build roads, clear forests, and plunk down virtually every kind of building and structure that was common in cities 2,000 years ago, all while fighting off the occasional barbarian horde and trying to make a profit on the venture.

title: Cruis'n World
description: The fastest, craziest and most furious of all races has begun! Race and win in three different modes and three degrees of difficulty! So fasten your seatbelt, put your foot down hard and cruise the highways of the world. Crash into the wall of China, fight a speed duel on German highways, attempt risky manoeuvres on the fast lanes of the African prairie, win a runaway victory on New York's city courses or a wild two-wheel ride through Hawaii's unique underwater tunnels - in this game anything goes. Contains 14 different courses for up to 4 players to race across simultaneously! Choose between 12 different cars that can be upgraded to four wheeled power houses.

title: Running Wild
description: So you think you've seen all that racing games have to offer? Think again. This original take on racing sets you up as a bipedal animal, jumping over all sorts of obstacles in an attempt to speed past your wild competition. Each of the game's six tracks is set in a vastly different locale, presenting unique challenges for every animal on the roster. Choose from six beastly characters, each with a different skill set: The elephant is the strongest, the bull is the most agile, and the zebra is the fastest. Hidden boss characters can be unlocked in the game's Challenge mode, while Time Trial allows you to race against your own best time. There's a wide variety of speed-ups and power-ups out there, and you'll need them to get faster, bigger, or more powerful. The graphics and gameplay are smooth and advanced, while the soundtrack and audio effects are accurate and intense. Who needs combat cars when you can race jungle animals?

title: Test Drive 5
description: Drive through twisting turns at top speed as you race your performance sports car in TEST DRIVE 5. There are more than 40 cars to choose from, including licensed vehicles from Dodge, Chevrolet, Aston Martin, and Jaguar, as well as a number of muscle cars from the ?60s and ?70s. After selecting the perfect vehicle, you can race in exotic locations like Hawaii, Jamaica, Moscow, North Carolina, Japan, Scotland, Australia, Italy, and England. There are 18 tracks in all, divided between point-to-point courses and circuits. When you are ready for some competition, there are several modes to choose from. Single Race is one race on any of the unlocked tracks, Cup Race lets you take on the challenges of multiple races for the opportunity to win a championship, and Time Trial mode lets you race against your best time on any track. All of the racing action you could ever want is included in TEST DRIVE 5.

title: Bottom of the 9th '99
description: BOTTOM OF THE 9TH ‘99 brings all of the action and excitement of professional baseball to the PlayStation. With an MLBPA license, over 700 major league players are included with updated stats, and motion capture technology recreates the nuances of every single player. Get a quick baseball fix by putting your team on the field of 30 stadiums in the Exhibition or Training modes; or discover the pressure being on the mound, up by one run with one out and a man on third, in the Scenario mode. For the most realistic experience, tackle the ups and downs of a season, the playoffs, or a championship series. With the innovative cursor system for batting and pitching, the challenges of hitting a 100 mph fastball are faithfully recreated. The action of BOTTOM OF THE 9TH '99 brings professional baseball to you without having to pay for admission.

title: Warlords III: Darklords Rising
description: An enhanced re-release of Warlords III: Reign of Heroes, the third in this successful series of turn-based strategy games set in a fantasy universe. Darklords Rising is premised on a conflict between the Selentine Empire and a mysterious alliance. Many new spells, units and hero-types have been added since the last game in the series. The game offers a choice of four campaigns and selection of scenarios. Up to eight players can participate in multi-player games on-line. A great feature of the game is the inclusion of comprehensive campaign and scenario editors. The gameplay involves epic battles with large numbers of troops led by heroes and warlords and side quests which develop characters' experience levels. A wide variety of unit types feature in the game. The game's graphics and controls are effective.

title: Commandos: Behind Enemy Lines
description: There are six highly trained commandos under your charge, and you've got to get these brave soldiers behind enemy lines in order to collect important information for the Allied invasion. Of course, that will mean using each warrior's powers to your advantage. At your disposal, you have a Green Beret, a sniper, a Marine, a demolition expert, a Spy, and a veteran Driver to help you in your quest. Stealth is of the essence in this mission-based experience that will take you through more than 20 adventures spanning the expanses of North Africa and Europe.

title: Leisure Suit Larry's Casino
description: Losing money has never been so funny. Join the time-honored Larry for gambling action and bawdy humor in his very first casino game. Choose a character to represent you, and then head out to the online tables to saddle up next to other players. You can play slots, blackjack, roulette, and six different variations of poker, including: Seven-Card Stud, Five-Card Draw, Texas Hold 'Em, and Omaha. Hilarious animations and realistic gaming make the title a soaring success, and there's never a shortage of folks to play with on the Internet.

title: Castrol Honda Superbike World Champions
description: If the prospect of being a real motocross racer has always been overshadowed by the unfortunate reality of the broken bones and poor financial compensation, you'll love the realistic action of CASTROL HONDA SUPERBIKE WORLD CHAMPIONS. Hop on the Honda RVF-RC45 and set out to win the championship. Three modes of play Championship, Practice, and Trainer allow you to delve into all aspects of this underrated sport, and variable difficulty levels let motocross maniacs of all skill levels get into the action. Play alone or take on up to five friends via the Internet.

title: WWF Warzone
description: Acclaim looks to create the ultimate in wrestling titles to rival the first wrestling title for the N64 by THQ in 1997. Features include nearly 20 official WWF wrestlers playable plus bonus hidden characters, more than 300 moves plus signature moves, finishing moves and taunts for each wrestler, and nine gameplay modes, including WWF Challenge, Tag Team, Versus, Cage, Weapons, Royal Rumble, and Gauntlet.
rating_content: Animated Violence, Mild Language, Suggestive Themes

title: Body Harvest
description: The year is 2016 and mankind has been annihilated, hunted to extinction by a century of alien attacks. One small chance for survival remains if someone travels back in time to thwart the alien attacks and stop the invasions. You are Adam Drake, a genetically enhanced marine chosen to go back through time to stop the alien attacks and prevent the invasion. The game covers five gigantic levels spanning more than a century including Greece 1916, Java 1941, America 1966, Siberia 1991, and the Alien Comet 2016. Each time period is defined by a unique set of weapons and vehicles, including planes, tanks, cars, trucks, and bikes. Along the way you'll have to question the locals and search hundreds of buildings. With over 70 different types of aliens to overcome and more than 60 vehicles to take pilot, you'll be on edge until the final showdown.

title: Madden NFL '99
description: Madden's 1999 installment adds a One-button interface, which enables gamers to simply skip though each menu and quickly get on with the game. Madden NFL '99 also features a new Play Editor, that lets the player customize his plays if he doesn't want to choose from the existing pre-made ones. Jukes, head fakes, and QB pumps maintain a level of realism and the receiver's head turns as he looks back to make the catch. The Arcade mode and Create a Player add additional depth to the package, which also includes a franchise mode, 110 current and classic NFL teams, full season stats, schedule and standings, and the ability to save custom teams.

title: MediEvil
description: You are Sir Dan, a recently reincarnated knight who has lost all that unsightly flesh i.e., you're a skeleton and you must battle the evil sorcerer Zarok and his battalions of undead monsters. To combat these baddies, you have your trusty sword, an axe, and a bow that shoots flaming arrows at the ready. But this game is more than just hack-and-slash action; each level has unique puzzles that differ from stage to stage, giving a nice degree of variety to the title. Also, once a certain number of enemies are dispatched, you can gather up a chalice that gives you access to the Hall of Heroes, a place where heroic ghosts distribute special weapons or items with each visit. Of course, these visits are usually accompanied by a verbal chastising at your unworthy status as the champion of  Gallowmere. And while this game has plenty of action, it is also filled with bright and colorful graphics, and has a light feel that will appeal to younger gamers.

title: Lemmings and Oh No! More Lemmings
description: The Lemmings are small, green-haired creatures that do exactly as they are told. Ultimately, they will die if you tell them to, which is the crux of your dilemma. You must guide the Lemmings to their base, but as you would expect, this is a not a simple straight-line path. Players must determine what skills and directions are needed to get the required number of Lemmings home. Complicating matters, there is a limited supply of resources and a finite number of Lemmings per stage. So if you use the resources incorrectly or kill too many of the green-haired creatures, you will have to start all over. LEMMINGS AND OH NO! MORE LEMMINGS has the original LEMMINGS game and the sequel OH NO! MORE LEMMINGS in one package.
platforms: PS SMS Gen GBC SNES PC Cell CD32 3DO GG TG16 GB Mac CD-i Lynx NES Amiga

title: Axis & Allies [1998]
description: Based on the board game, Axis & Allies is a war strategy game set in 1941. Only the major powers of that time are represented: the United States, the Soviet Union, Great Britain, the Third Reich, and the Japanese Empire. The PC game brings the exact rules and gameplay of the board game to the computer, with some extra options. A dozen or so rule variants can be toggled on or off prior to a game -- things like paratroops in bombers; scorched earth; deploying new naval units in an occupied sea zone. There is also a unit editor, allowing you to adjust the cost, attack, and defense values for any unit, either globally or per side.

title: The Game of Life [1998]
description: The classic board game has come to life! Choose which college, career, get married, start a family, buy a house and eventually retire. Take a spin and try The Game of Life on cd-rom!
rating_content: Suitable for Persons Ages Six and Older

title: Rogue Trip: Vacation 2012
description: Journey to a slightly futuristic world, where pollution and nuclear war have driven the privileged to become compulsive vacationers. Of course, these elite few will need someone to transport them to the remote locations of their getaway spots, and if you want to make a buck off of it you're going to face some pretty stiff competition. Choose from 16 cold-blooded crazies each vying for the almighty dollar as you pick up tourists and deliver them to their destinations. Every traveler you pick up will help get you the money you need to buy weapons upgrades and health. The awesome list of weaponry includes a meteor shower, stinger missiles, flame-throwers, and unique special weapons for each vehicle. There are 12 high profile vacation spots in all (they're not all tropical islands) and a soundtrack featuring the Mighty Mighty Bosstones. The incredible depth of the game's graphics and sounds only serve to augment the clever premise and amazingly vast gameplay. Plus, it's made by the same folks who originated the TWISTED METAL series, so you know it's got to be pretty cool.

title: S.C.A.R.S.
description: If you've always wanted to race as a wild animal in a combat car circa the year 3000   strangely enough, your dream has come true. Choose from five animal cars Mammoth, Rhino, Lion, Mantis, or Shark each made unique by its speed, handling, armor, and weapons. Grand Prix Mode gives you three main cups composed of a few races each and there's a customizable cup that can last for up to eight races. In Challenge Mode, you race against one of four additional characters Cheetah, Panther, Cobra, or Scorpion  earning the right to play as that character if you defeat him, which just isn't going to be easy. All of the standard weapons are here (missiles, shields, and turbos), plus some more inventive weapons, such as freeze magnets and energy fields. The best weapon, however, may well be a ticking time bomb that gets passed back and forth between racers until it decides to go off. With inventive combat and characters, exciting graphics, and solid gameplay in the tradition of SUPER MARIO KART, S.C.A.R.S. is a real original!

title: Bomberman World
description: Bomberman enters the third dimension and comes to the PlayStation in BOMBERMAN WORLD. In the single-player game, travel to four elemental-based regions and place bombs on the playing field to blast enemies and obstacles and collect the crystals to advance to the next stage. For a special challenge, invite three friends over; hook up the multi-tap, and race around the field strategically placing bombs to blow your buddies and some computer-controlled drones to bits. To help you accomplish this task, power-ups that allow you to walk through walls or pick up and throw enemies are scattered throughout the levels. However, if you think these give unfair advantages, then you can turn all of them off in the options screen. BOMBERMAN WORLD brings the classic gameplay of BOMBERMAN to the PlayStation.

title: NFL Blitz [1998]
description: The excitement of Midway's NFL BLITZ comes to the PC with a faithful arcade translation. This PC game is similar to the arcade edition, though it contains many slight upgrades. There is a two-player mode implemented, as well as improved graphics that feature more detailed character models and several new moves. This game is great for anybody that loves football but doesn't want to get bogged down with all of the rules.
platforms: PC NGPC N64 PS GBC Arcade

title: Dragon Seeds
description: DRAGON SEEDS brings the challenges of raising a young dragon to the PlayStation. Choose from six different creatures to raise: Winged, Saurian, Crustacean, Wasp, Beetle, and Natura. For an extra choice, creatures can be created from other save file on your memory card. After deciding, train the creature to build its strength and power. When it has the power, enter tournaments, which use the turn-based battle system, and win prize money, which can be used to buy more rigorous training and new weapons for the combatant. However, should your dragon die at any time, the game is over and you will have to start from scratch. For those who don't want to expend the energy to raise a beast, use the instant action mode to challenge friends to a battle. Patience and love will breed success in DRAGON SEEDS.

title: Jane's IAF -- Israeli Air Force
description: One of the world's top air forces finally gets its due in JANE'S ISRAELI AIR FORCE. You'll have more than Palestine to worry about, as you engage enemies of all varieties in deadly dogfights. Pilot any of the Force's top aircraft through dozens of environments, taking on a whopping 42 combative missions in all. A groundbreaking terrain engine delivers optimal graphics, and the computer's stunning AI will put your skills to the test. Six players can battle it out for bragging rights via a LAN or Internet connection.

title: Brunswick Circuit Pro Bowling
description: BRUNSWICK CIRCUIT PRO BOWLING brings all of the action and excitement of professional bowling to the PlayStation. The physics of bowling are perfectly modeled: pins bounce off the ball, walls, and each other with the kind of action that is only seen on the lanes. Keep an eye on the conditions of the lanes, as the quality tends to degrade as the round goes on. Choose one of the 13 professional bowlers, each with his own unique brand of trash talk, or create a bowler that is more suited to your style of play. Once you're ready, hit the lanes in any of these modes: Exhibition, Skins, Tournament, Career, and Cosmic Bowling. When the computer-controlled competition gets too easy, challenge five of your friends to a friendly game. BRUNSWICK CIRCUIT PRO BOWLING has all the action of the lanes without the need to rent shoes.

title: iF/A-18 Carrier Strike Fighter
description: F/A-18 Precision Strike Fighter is a combat flight simulation, challenging the player to destroy enemy air defenses, maintain air superiority, support ground units and destroy hostile aircraft. Fly head to head or in teams over the internet.

title: The Fifth Element
description: A gate between two dimensions opens every 5,000 years. One dimension is the current world while the other is known as Pure Evil. Those who live in Pure Evil spend entire lifetimes waiting for the door to open. Fortunately, the basic elements; earth, wind, fire, and water, gather around a perfect being, known as THE FIFTH ELEMENT, who can close the door and thwart the takeover of the universe. You assume the roles of Leeloo, the Fifth Element, and cab driver Korben Dallas as they travel through 20 levels of action to try and save the universe. Each character has unique weapons and abilities that affect how you progresses through the levels. Use all of the powers and abilities available to you to save the universe in THE FIFTH ELEMENT.

title: Get Medieval
description: Get Medieval is a medieval-themed overhead shooter with a sense of humor. Four adventurers, a thief, a wizard, a warrior and an elf are available to command through over 40 single-player levels in a quest to rid their home, Dirindale, of the Great Dragon.

title: Wild 9
description: From the same company that developed the popular EARTHWORM JIM series comes WILD 9 for the PlayStation. The game takes place in a 3D world, with huge polygonal environments, though much of the action occurs on a 2D path. The actual gameplay follows the normal formula of a platformer, except with some exciting new twists. The main character, Wex, has a hook that allows him to attack enemies in various ways. You must learn how to dispose of each enemy in a highly imaginative way. You must also use your hook to solve the various puzzles that are littered throughout each level by utilizing items you find or other objects that are strewn about the environment.  Featuring a loud and invigorating rock soundtrack, WILD 9 for the PlayStation takes platforming games to a new level, with brand-new concepts and enough gameplay to keep the most hardcore gamer busy for a while

title: TOCA Championship Racing
description: Drive all the season's official high-performance cars: Peugeot 406 Renault Laguna Audi A4 Volvo S40 Vauxhall Vectra Ford Mondeo Honda Accord and Nissan Primera. Each car is authentically modeled and features full simulated handling of the real vehicles. Race through the full season Championship Single Races and Time Trial options. Race wheel-to-wheel in a pack of sixteen cars on the world-famous race circuits. Every track is accurately modeled using actual 3D landscape data. Features up to eight players over a LAN or four players in split-screen mode, four different viewpoints, and pack racing with 15 other AI-controlled cars.

title: NHL FaceOff '99
description: 989 Studios makes the race for the best hockey title a bit more interesting. Like EA Sports, 989 Studios is building on a previous title to make it better. The game features New Jersey Devil announcer, Mike Emrick and ESPN's Darren Pang providing play-by-play; graphic and control upgrade; TV-style gameplay; in-depth stat tracking, season play, exhibition games, and more.

title: NASCAR 99
description: NASCAR ¿99 features 31 NASCAR drivers and their cars, as well as six legendary drivers. There is a total of 17 real-life tracks representing locales like Atlanta, Charlotte, and California. Of course, no NASCAR game would be complete without tweaking options, and NASCAR '99 is no exception. You can fine-tune your car in a variety of categories from gear ratios to weight distribution to get your ride running perfectly for each track. Your car can also take realistic damage, so you will have to be careful when you barrel into those corners. Benny Parsons and ESPN's Bob Jenkins handle the announcing duties, and your pit crew will occasionally chime in with instructions, adding even more realism to the game. So slip into your fire retardant suit and strap yourself into one of the best NASCAR games around.

title: Pool Hustler
description: POOL HUSTLER is a straight-ahead billiards simulation. If you consider yourself a rookie when it comes to pool, there's a great Lesson mode that teaches all aspects of pool, from aiming shots to jumping balls. The Two-Player mode offers 9-Ball, Rotation, 8-Ball, and 14-1 Continuous games, while the Trick Shot mode lets you execute 30 multiball trick shots you can use to impress your friends. And there's also a Practice mode, where you can perfect your skills. You can also bet against the computer or a friend in nearly all the modes. You can also take on a friend in the Versus mode, or play the Story mode that takes you into the life of a pool hustler, as you try to make a name for yourself and earn some cash. You travel from one pool hall to the next, playing for money and improving your game. POOL HUSTLER is a must for anyone who considers himself a student of the game of pool.

title: Activision Classics
description: Compilation that includes 30 Atari 2600 classics from Activision: Atlantis, Barnstorming, Boxing, Chopper Command, Crackpot, Cosmic Commuter, Dolphin, Dragster, Enduro, Fishing Derby, Freeway, Frostbite, Grand Prix, HERO, Ice Hockey, Kaboom!, Keystone Kapers, Laser Blast, Megamania, Pitfall, Plaque Attack, River Raid, River Raid II, Seaquest, Skiing, Sky Jinx, Spider Fighter, Stampede, Starmaster, and Tennis.

title: Heart of Darkness
description: In HEART OF DARKNESS, a solar eclipse causes some strange things to happen. Namely, an alien force kidnaps Andy's dog, Whisky. Take control of Andy as he travels through eight unique worlds and solves puzzles. Some puzzles require lots of shooting, while others require lots of thinking. Full-motion video clips reward the player for solving puzzles and advance the plot. Play HEART OF DARKNESS, and help Andy save Whisky.
rating_content: Animated Violence, Use of Alcohol and Tobacco

title: NHL '99
description: The next game always trying to improve on the previous. EA Sports' annual NHL titles always seem to do just that, add more key features to keep the people buying. 1999 is no exception.

title: X-COM: Interceptor
description: Earth's major corporations have turned to the stars to find the resources necessary to keep the planet alive, but it seems that someone else got there first. Take command of an elite troop of space warriors as you try to stop an alien armada from obliterating the human race. From the pilot's seat of a top-notch fighter craft, you'll have to protect Earth's interstellar structures, maintain your financial security, and help research alien technologies. The real mystery is why these aliens have it in for you, but it's probably best to shoot first and ask questions later.

title: Pokemon Stadium [Japanese Version]
description: Nintendo released this original Pokemon Stadium game back in 1998 in Japan. The package contained the game as well as the 64GB Pak (called Transfer Pak in the US). The original Pokemon Stadium is a much more limited game than the later US release with the same name. Not only does it lack more than half of the Pokemon featured in the US version, it also misses many of the added features.

title: Waialae Country Club: True Golf Classics
description: One of the most beautiful golf courses in the world is now one of the most beautiful N64 games. The true physics of golf take the starring role in this ultra-realistic venture into the popular sport. You can customize the characteristics of up to 10 different golfers, including power, putting, recovery, and ability against the wind. Plan your approach, pick a club, get your stance just right, read the wind, decide whether you're going for spin, draw or fade, read the meter to get your power where you want it   then swing! The six modes of play at your disposal are Waialae Open, Tournament, Stroke, Skins, Match, and Practice. A truly comprehensive game, WAIALAE COUNTRY CLUB will even calculate your handicap for you for use in later play. Up to four players can have a go in each game, with all stats and results saved to the game's memory. The graphics and player animations are outstanding, the play is seamless and intuitive, and the location just can't be beat. Spend your next vacation in Waialae, golf fans. Just don't expect it to be easy.

title: NCAA Football '99
description: NCAA FOOTBALL '99 gives those of us who never attended Nebraska or Notre Dame the complete college football experience.  Play modes include Exhibition, Tournament, Great Games, Season, Practice, and Dynasty. You get 112 Division I-A teams and their stadiums, so you'll likely find your favorite major college team on the roster. One of the coolest features is the Dynasty mode, in which you try to build a winning program from scratch. While it may be tough to recruit blue-chip prospects in the beginning, as you start winning big games and making a name for your team, getting good players gets easier. But if you can't recruit them, create them with the Create-A-Player mode. This year's version also has improved AI, so you can expect some serious competition from some of the better schools. If you've always wanted to be the Big Man On Campus, now's your chance with NCAA FOOTBALL '99.

title: NFL GameDay 99
description: NFL GAMEDAY '99 features Total Control Passing, a welcome addition that widens the game's control and deepens it feel. And this year's title also includes a bigger list of plays, enabling a broader offensive strategy. It also has all the usual football modes like Season, Practice, Tournament, and the General Manager mode. There is Pro Bowl Voting, Playoff and Injury Reports, MVP Awards, and a deep drafting engine to spice up the off-season downtime.

title: WWF Warzone
description: Are you ready to enter a war zone? Fans of wrestling will surely want to enter the one that WWF WARZONE for the PlayStation offers. The game presents a full multimedia blitz, with official music and video straight from the stars. Before picking characters, players can watch FMV movies of each wrestler, streamed right off of the CD. There are many single-player modes that range from Tag Team to Weapons Matches. In addition to the single-player action there are multiplayer modes for up to four people at once, allowing full-blown battles using the most famous wrestling superstars in the world. If you can't find a wrestler that you like, just fire up the Create-a-Player mode and tweak everything from hair to tattoos to eye patches. You can also customize the moves for each of your creations, adopting the techniques of your favorite real-life grappler. WWF WARZONE brings the whole wrestling attack to the PlayStation, with all of the fun and excitement of the real thing.
rating_content: Animated Violence, Mild Language, Suggestive Themes

title: Devil Dice
description: Your world is a table filled with dice. Your only goal is to clear the table by matching adjacent dice that have the same number showing on the common side. Your character is a little devil that runs on top of the dice, flipping the dice and moving them as you go. In the Trial Mode, try to make an unlimited number of dice disappear. To add some extra challenge, have the CPU control a devil that blocks your path in the Battle mode. If your friends want in on the action, challenge them to a war where up to five devils compete at the same time. For the most challenge, tackle the puzzle mode, where you must clear all of the dice with a limited number of moves. DEVIL DICE exercises the fingers and the brain.

title: Trap Gunner
description: Blast your way to glory in TRAP GUNNER. You are a dangerous assassin and a member of a nefarious organization known as Gain. Five of your fellow Gain agents have defected, and it's your duty to track them down and exterminate them. In the hallowed tradition of classic games like SPY VS. SPY and BOMBERMAN, you run through complex levels laying bomb-traps, shooting, kicking, and collecting power-ups in an attempt to take out your opponents. TRAP GUNNER's addictive gameplay is easy to pick up and enjoy but difficult to master. You'll need to develop clever strategies and utilize quick reflexes to disarm traps and emerge victorious. Six different bombs are selectable: Switch Detonators (activated via the X button), Regular (which explode when triggered by other bombs), Gas (timed, poisonous gas emitters), Pitfall, Force Panel, and Mine. Watch in safe satisfaction as your enemies trip a series of exploding combos and are blasted into oblivion. More than 30 maps are available, and stages include Story mode and two-player Versus. TRAP GUNNER's danger filled, strategic action is primed to blow you away.

title: Deep Sea Trophy Fishing
description: Head out to the high seas for a fishing challenge you'll never forget. Your PC is instantly transformed into the ocean blue, challenging you to catch as many fish as you possibly can. Choose your boat, decide which fish you're in the mood to catch, select your bait (based on what you're trying to catch), and cast your line. Reeling in the big one will take plenty of effort on your part, and patience is the best element you can bring to the table. Awesome graphics and tons of gameplay options make DEEP SEA TROPHY FISHING a real catch.

title: Unholy War
description: Combining elements of strategy with the all-out assault of a real-time battle game, THE UNHOLY WAR has begun. You are on Xsarra, a planet on the brink of war. A peace treaty has been broken between the native Arcanes and the advanced Teknos. You must choose your allegiance (Arcane, Tekno, or a combination of both), your team of seven (there are 14 warriors available) and begin your assault. Select from two modes of play: Combat Mayhem mode, a 3D weapon-based fighting game, or Combat Tactics mode, a chess-like strategy contest where your characters move on a hexagonal board for points. Once you meet an opponent on the board, a battle in real-time ensues. There are 14 different battlefields, each with its own unique terrain, obstacles, and weather conditions. Play a single-player game against the computer or challenge your friend in two-player combat. THE UNHOLY WAR will place you in the heat of an intergalactic battle.

title: Madden NFL '99
description: Madden's 1999 installment adds a One-button interface, which enables gamers to simply skip though each menu and quickly get on with the game. Madden NFL '99 also features a new Play Editor, that lets the player customize his plays if he doesn't want to choose from the existing pre-made ones. Jukes, head fakes, and QB pumps maintain a level of realism and the receiver's head turns as he looks back to make the catch. The Arcade mode and Create a Player add additional depth to the package, which also includes a franchise mode, 110 current and classic NFL teams, full season stats, schedule and standings, and the ability to save custom teams. The N64 version also features graphical enhancements over its PlayStation cousin.

title: Industry Giant [1998]
description: When it comes to getting ahead in this market, it's best to be all business. Straighten that tie and get ready for white-collar ruthlessness in Industry Giant. The idea is to launch a corporation and pilot it to superstardom, but that will mean outsmarting dozens of rival franchises. Choose your industry and time period (there are dozens of businesses to choose from and action that spans from 1960 to 2060), then try to take down a range of computer components in glorious 3D. Multiple difficulty settings help you ease into the action.

title: Madden NFL '99
description: Madden's 1999 installment adds a One-button interface, which enables gamers to simply skip though each menu and quickly get on with the game. Madden NFL '99 also features a new Play Editor, that lets the player customize his plays if he doesn't want to choose from the existing pre-made ones. Jukes, head fakes, and QB pumps maintain a level of realism and the receiver's head turns as he looks back to make the catch. The Arcade mode and Create a Player add additional depth to the package, which also includes a franchise mode, 110 current and classic NFL teams, full season stats, schedule and standings, and the ability to save custom teams.

title: Turbo Prop Racing
description: Prepare for unparalleled watercraft racing excitement. Choose one of nine different turbo-fueled watercraft and race in six different exotic locations including icy Alaskan glaciers and Florida's famous sandy beaches. Truly realistic properties such as water spray and wake effects are on display here, but you must first master the art of turbo-prop boat driving over different sea conditions before you are able to relax and enjoy the scenery. The vehicles here are considerably more difficult than road racers and precision control is the key. But once the door is unlocked you are able to race at breakneck speeds in a totally customizable boat. You can choose from six preset tracks in various different modes from night, to mirrored, and more. The game also has a unique edge: through fractal equations, based on a random number, an entirely new course can be created giving you the ability to race on a virtually unlimited number of courses!

title: Tomba!
description: Jump into a bizarre, action-packed world like no other in TOMBA! In this fast and frantic side-scrolling adventure you play as the pink-haired, high-jumping jungle boy Tomba. In order to retrieve your lucky golden bracelet from the evil clutches of demonic pigs you'll need to fight hard, duck, climb, explore, and race through a wide variety of unique and challenging quests. Use your mace or your wood and stone boomerangs to do battle with dastardly pigs and creeping spiders. Keep a clear head though, as you'll need to solve a number of intriguing puzzles. Rescue trapped villagers, uncover lost items hidden in deep forests, or rescue a poor, stranded puppy the long list of fun tasks is awe-inspiring. Make sure to take the time to search out all the hidden secrets in order to collect all the adventure points you can, because you'll need those points to access bigger and even more fantastic events. From the mind of Ghosts 'n Goblins creator Tokuro Fujiwara, Tomba is a game for fan of the classic 8- and 16-bit 2D games of yesteryear as well as any adventure and action fans looking for a creative new challenge!

title: Elemental Gearbolt
description: In a fantastic world divided by class and race, technology from a mysterious source has imbued a young prince with the key to unimaginable power. By means of a Neural Network Computer fueled by the grey matter of unfortunate 'volunteers', he plans to conquer the known world, replacing it with a new order of his design. The only fly in the ointment is disturbing reports of two powerful Elementals storming across the land on a direct course toward the palace. One or two players can assume the identities of these Elementals as they crusade for an unknown master toward a climactic battle. The gripping story unfolds by means of heart-stopping fully-3D action levels interspersed with gorgeous hand-drawn animation scenes.

title: Azure Dreams
description: Azure Dreams had players assume the role of a boy searching for his father, who disappeared into a tower while on a quest to learn the true nature behind an evil that has come upon the land. The game features monster breeding components, randomly generated dungeons, and real-time battle elements.

title: Spice World
description: Tell us what you want, what you really, really want. A Spice Girls game? You got it. Spice up your gaming with the British Pop Femme quintet of Geri, Emma. Mels B. & C., and Victoria AKA Ginger, Baby, Scary, Sporty, and Posh. They've hit the PlayStation with all of their melodic fury in SPICEWORLD. The game is loaded with pop-sational fun; there's over 30 minutes worth of interviews and performances, and that doesn't even include the interactive Spice World game. You have the power to organize your own Spice Girls concert you pick the moves, the music (from song like "Wannabe," "Spice up Your Life," and more) the clothes, and the costumes. Coordinate your Spice Girls Spice World concert and groove to your own mega-mix. With a little bit of practice, maybe you can climb to the top of the pop charts and be a Spice Girl yourself.

title: Gex: Enter the Gecko
description: Rez is out to destroy the Television Realm, and only Gex the Gecko can save it. Unfortunately, Gex has retired, but a huge pile of cash from the government quickly changes his mind. You take control of Gex as he travels through 24 levels with themes that are parodies of television and movies. In each level, Gex must collect remote controls to open new areas and eventually fight the level boss. Throughout all of the levels, Gex (voiced by HBO comedian Dana Gould) rattles off a variety of wise cracks to lighten the mood of the game. Many of the comments are keyed to the theme of the area Gex is exploring. Will Gex be able to defeat Rez? Will he be able to get over his television addiction? Find the answers to these questions by playing GEX: Enter the Gecko.
platforms: PS Vita N64 GBC PSP PC PS3
rating_content: Animated Violence, Comic Mischief, Mild Language

title: Need for Speed III: Hot Pursuit
description: NEED FOR SPEED 3 offers five different modes including Single Race, Tournament, Knockout, Practice, and Hot Pursuit. Hot Pursuit is one of the more fun modes you're likely to see in a racing game, as it gives you the chance to go on the lam and lead the cops on a wild goose chase. Pay attention, though, because the police have some tricks up their sleeves, namely tire spikes and roadblocks. Tournament is the deepest mode, as it lets you enter a series of racing tours in order to prove your dominance. There are eight cars and eight tracks in the game, although not all of them are available from the get-go. But you can unlock the new cars and tracks by performing well with the initial cars and tracks. Some of the well-known cars you can expect to drive are Ferrari, Lamborghini, and Chevrolet.

title: Moto Racer 2
description: EA Sports is back with more high performance motorcycle racing in MOTO RACER 2. MOTO RACER 2 is essentially two motorcycle-racing games in one: you can race dirt or street bikes. The game has 32 tracks, some of which put you in the dirt with huge jumps that are good for trick jumping, while others are street courses that allow you to go full throttle and approach insanely high speeds. Also included is a 3D track editor, which allows you to increase or decrease elevation and make jumps and dangerous curves. If you're looking for multiplayer action, you can tear it up on the track against a friend in the Versus mode. Whether you like the challenge of dirt tracks or the wide-open expanses of street racing, MOTO RACER 2 has something for every motorcycle-racing fan.

title: Circuit Breakers [1998]
description: CIRCUIT BREAKERS is new kind of racing game. Rather than racing on road courses, the tracks are more like roller coaster rides, with hairpin turns and drastic drops. And, like a roller coaster, there are no walls to keep you on the track. So, missing a turn will throw you into the abyss and cost you valuable time. Your ability to stay on course is tested in three play modes: World Series, Battle, and Time Trial. In World Series, try to beat seven opponents in 16 different races. Battle mode allows you to challenge three friends to a race. If you find the track too crowded, tackle the Time Trial mode and create new world records for each track. In all modes, the courses are littered with power ups including rocket boosters, shrinkers, and oil slicks that give the player a competitive edge. If you're tired of the same old racing games, give CIRCUIT BREAKERS a try.

title: Tenchu: Stealth Assassins
description: Stealth is the way of the ninja, and now you have chance to become one in TENCHU: Stealth Assassins. You take role of the powerful Rikimaru or the speedy Ayame, and your goal is to protect you master and defeat his enemies in 10 missions. All of the missions require you to sneak around an environment and kill specific targets. Since attacking head-on will result in an untimely demise, you need to avoid the guards if at all possible. If there is a guard that refuses to get out of the way, there are several options: use the grappling hook and sneak around on the rooftops, leave a poisoned rice treat for him, or just get behind him and slit his throat. If you can get through a mission unseen, you will earn a bonus item for the next one. Master the ways of the ninja with TENCHU: Stealth Assassins.

title: G Darius
description: The Japanese arcade hit, G DARIUS, has arrived on the PlayStation. Mechanical fish are out to destroy your home, and your only option is to jump into a ship and blast these menaces back into the water. You'll have to shoot your way through 15 branching levels as you try to stop the fish. For extra level of strategy, every enemy (except for the big bosses) can be captured. After being captured, some will fire along with you for extra power, while others will just defend your ship. No matter what each captured craft does, it adds some much-needed help, especially when you confront the boss at the end of each level. Should your friends want to join, they can with the cooperative Two-Player option. Play G DARIUS and try to save the world.

title: Bomberman Hero
description: BOMBERMAN HERO strays off the beaten path of other Bomberman games and scores loads of thrilling excitement in the process. Innovative gameplay and creative one-player missions have taken the place of the multiplayer functionality many have come to expect and take for granted in Bomberman titles. Sure, they may have changed a classic a little, but the one thing that the designers didn't go cheap on is the bombs. The intuitive controls allow the player to increase the number of bombs thrown at one time (from one to four) as well as alter the diameter of the blast radius. Power-ups also make available such fun accessories as the Freeze Bomb, Salt Bomb, and Remote Control Bombs, as well as the ever-popular Power Glove. The action takes place over five distinctive worlds and the designers have given BOMBERMAN HERO some new toys, like the BomberCopter, BomberMarine, BomberJet, and BomberSlider to help him combat the dangers waiting ahead.

title: Einhander
description: In this stunning shooter (created fully in 3D,) you pilot the most technologically advanced fighter machine ever created. You're on a suicide mission against Earth's final assault. Cut through hordes of enemy fighters and battle the most monstrous bosses ever designed

title: Gran Turismo [1998]
description: Groundbreaking racing simulation that features 140 different cars including: the Acura NSX, Toyota Supra, Chevy Camaro, Honda Prelude, Nissan 300Z, and my personal favorite, the Dodge Viper. From mufflers to clutches to paint jobs, you can customize your car to fit your driving taste and style. The game offers two distinct modes: Arcade mode and Gran Turismo (Simulation) Mode. The arcade mode enables you to race exhibitions in which you can choose a fixed number of cars and tracks. In Gran Turismo mode, you start out with a set amount of cash, pass license tests to qualify for different events, and head to the races. The higher the events, the more cash you can get to upgrade your car. In addition to a mad amount of cash, if you take first place in an event, you also win a special car. And that's basically the whole idea: to race, to win cars, and to get rich.

title: Tekken 3
description: The saga of the Iron Fist Tournament continues with Tekken 3. Fight with or against more than 20 characters, each with unique moves and special full-motion video endings. In addition to the standard Arcade and Versus modes, Namco has added a large number of extra modes like Survival, Ball, Force, Team Battle, Time Attack, Practice, and Theater. Ball mode is similar to game of volleyball, in which the characters must try to keep the ball in the air. Letting the ball hit the ground results in damage to the player when it lands on their side. Force mode has the character fight a series of enemies in a side-scrolling environment rather than the one-on-one fights of the other modes. And Theater mode lets you watch any of the FMV from all three Tekken games. Can you defeat the opposition and become King of the Iron Fist Tournament for a third time?

title: Mortal Kombat 4
description: Enter the realm of Mortal Kombat! You are a combatant in Mortal Kombat, a fight for the survival of Earth! Choose from 15 characters, including the legendary Liu Kang and the mighty Scorpion, each with their own special moves and fatalities. Choose to fight in the single player campaign, complete with several difficulties and unique endings for each character. Take on a friend in the Multiplayer mode or see how long you can last in the Endurance mode.
rating_content: Animated Blood and Gore, Animated Violence

title: Twisted Edge Extreme Snowboading
description: Originally thought to be the first snowboarding game to grace Nintendo 64, Twisted Edge Snowboarding  in the end appeared after Nintendo's own 1080 Snowboarding. The game is a fully 3D snowboarder with dangerous courses, far-out characters, and more neck-breaking stunts than a Jackie Chan movie. The team at Boss Game Studios (responsible for Top Gear Rally), has taken a long look at other snowboarding games and worked hard on making Twisted Edge stand out. The game offers at least six tracks, each with multiple paths and varying terrain, including Easy Slider, Twisty Canyon, Polar Paradise, Splash Down, Funky Town.

title: Fallout 2
description: Fallout 2 is set in a post-apocalyptic world. You play the Chosen One, the direct descendant of the Vault Dweller from the original Fallout. The village elders have selected you to wear the sacred Vault-suit and, in time, to ascend to the leadership of your people. First you must prove your devotion to your people and journey out into the wastelands. Your tribe needs help...Fallout lets you travel the world, participating in numerous quests and developing your character's stats and inventory as you go. The scope of the game is amazing, containing many more areas and quests than the original. Fallout 2 also uses skill development instead of a traditional class system, and you are free to play through the game in a number of ways.
rating_content: Animated Blood and Gore, Strong Language

title: Asteroids
description: They said it couldn't be done, but they were wrong: a new and improved Asteroids that is just as addictive as the original. The classic shooter has been converted into a 3D space shooter with tons of features, like mind-blowing 3D graphics, innovative cutscenes, and intense special effects. Another improvement over the original is the dynamic weapon arsenal: laser nets, repulser shields, and shockwaves to name a few. The new Asteroids, however, uses the same style of gameplay as the original, along with similar sound effects. This is nostalgia at its best. But with all the new weapons, gameplay styles, and enemies, this game has replay value that makes it stand out from the original. Asteroids is made for the nostalgia gamer that misses the '70s, as well as new gamers who want a taste of the old days.

title: Twisted Metal 3
description: Pile into vehicular combat pandemonium with TWISTED METAL III from Sony. In this fresh take on the TWISTED METAL series, contamination and craziness have scattered across the land like a curse. You are the sleekest and smartest automobile assassin around. Your assignment is to choose from diverse, specially equipped, battle-scarred street machines like taxicabs, police cars, motorcycles, and ice cream trucks, and compete in contests of vehicular brutality and SPARTACUS-style survival. Bask in the glow of striking, 3D, destructible terrain as you veer from structure to dwelling and street to sewer in an effort to sidestep your crazed pursuers and emerge triumphant. In Single-Player mode or Head-to-Head PlayStation-networked conflict, you'll dash through diverse, vast worlds, firing and scheming against fiendish foes and grotesque criminals. Engage in deadly armed conflict with weapons like machine guns, flamethrowers, napalm and heat-seeking missiles and bang your head to a pounding rock soundtrack from Rob Zombie and Pitch Shifter. In the demented, non-stop gameplay of TWISTED METAL III you'll have to think fast, fight hard, out-gun, and out-drive your competition if you want to survive.

title: Rush 2: Extreme Racing USA
description: The sequel to San Francisco Rush, Rush 2: Extreme Racing USA puts more emphasis on racing than the series previous incarnation, but at the same time manages to retain the same, excellent feeling of floaty-air jumps and hidden routes at every turn. Players can race through 11 immediately selectable tracks including Uptown New York, Downtown New York, Alcatraz (arcade-perfect), Los Angeles, Seattle, Hawaii, Half-pipe, Pipe, Crash and Stunt. There's also one hidden course. Each track can be customized before racing. There are 16 selectable vehicles including the Mobster, Sedan, Bandit, Cruiser, Stallion, 4x4, Pickup, Compact and Muscle Car. Players can set their car's transmission, main color (32 different colors to choose from), accent color, stripe, stripe color, tires, tire rims, torque, suspension, tires and durability. Each car handles differently than the other.

title: Small Soldiers
description: Taking place in a zany world not presented in the feature film of the same name, SMALL SOLDIERS casts you in the role of Archer, the leader of the Gorgonites. When Chip Hazard and the Commando elite come in and take your homeland, it's up to you to command the troops against the ill-willed forces and reclaim your territory. There will be many enemies lining up to take their shots, but you'll have a huge arsenal of high-powered weaponry to advance your cause. As the troll-like Archer, you'll explore mazes of dingy caves and dark nooks in your attempt to stop the opposing troops from infiltrating. Whether you're a fan of the film or you're just looking for a good action game, SMALL SOLDIERS is big fun.

title: Knife Edge: Nose Gunner
description: Kemco offers up a title that introduces brand new gameplay concepts to the Nintendo 64 with KNIFE EDGE: Nose Gunner. The storyline takes the player to Mars and beyond, battling against enemies of an alien variety. The gameplay takes classic shooting action and sticks it in a first-person perspective, resulting in an intense and action-packed affair.  However, the levels are not free roaming, as the action travels along predetermined rails that offer multiple paths to be determined by the player. In addition to the one-player Story mode, there is a Practice mode that allows the player to sharpen their shooting skills. To appease fans of multiplayer, there is the option to play with up to four people in the Story mode, as well as fight against each other in the Team Battle mode. KNIFE EDGE: Nose Gunner for the Nintendo 64 offers a large amount of options and modes, as well as an exciting shooting adventure that is truly unique among N64 titles.

title: Brave Fencer Musashi
description: The Kingdom of Allucaneet comes upon hard times when the banished Wizard of Darkness returns to wreak havoc on the land. Wisely, Princes Fillet decides to summon the warrior who first put the Wizard in his place 150 years ago: Musashi. You take on the role of the spiky-haired Musashi, whose goal is to save the citizens of Allucaneet and thwart the evil plight of the Wizard. As you travel the world in search of items and objectives, you'll encounter a number of friendly and not-so-friendly characters that can lend advice, wisdom, assignments, or clues. Often times, however, the characters are monsters, and you must decide whether you want to kill them or assimilate their powers.

title: Guilty Gear
description: GUILTY GEAR has everything that fighting game fans have come to expect. You can choose from 10 different characters, each with unique special moves and combinations. Some characters fight with weapons while others use only their bare hands and feet, which keeps the combat new and interesting with each character. Use the Training mode to learn how to use each character, or play the Arcade mode to learn every character's motivation for fighting. If your friends want in on the action, feel free to challenge them to a match in the Versus mode. No matter what mode you choose, you must watch out for the death move that automatically ends the match if it lands. All of the action is captured with magnificent hand-drawn animation. Are you tough enough to handle the challenges of GUILTY GEAR?

title: NFL Quarterback Club '99
description: Hard-hitting NFL simulation returns with this detailed football extravaganza from Iguana. The same folks that brought you TUROK and NFL QUARTERBACK CLUB '98 have returned to the gridiron, and have brought with them improved graphics, artificial intelligence, and play options. With full licenses from the NFL and its athletes, the game has all 31 NFL teams and 1500 players, plus perfect replication of logos and stadiums. As was the case with the '98 installment, you can play an individual game or a full season, but this version actually lets your players develop their skills over the course of the whole year. There's even a historical mode that allows you to tap into classic games of yesteryear, featuring teams that date back to 1967. The addition of six NFL Europe teams mixes things up as well. Iguana has tossed in some surprise stadiums (the Rose Bowl and Aloha Stadium among them), and included 250 new player animations. ESPN's Mike Patrick and Randy Cross are in the booth, and Brett Favre has returned to add his insight into the development of the gameplay. If you like the NFL and you like videogames, you just can't go wrong with NFL QUARTERBACK CLUB '99.

title: NBA Live '99
description: NBA LIVE '99 gives you control of every aspect of the game, right down to which fouls get called and how often they're called. In other words, you can make the game as complicated as the real thing or make it a bare bones version and of pick-up basketball. Along with the standard Exhibition, Season, and Playoff modes, you also get a 3-point Shooting Contest that will test your long-range skills. As your team's GM, you can trade and release players as you see fit in order to construct your own dream team. You can also create players and add them to your team to fill holes on the roster.
rating_content: Suitable for Persons Ages Six and Older

title: Dual Heroes
description: DUAL HEROES takes place on a future Earth, long after a violent upheaval of tectonic plates that destroyed many continents and created new ones. The survivors develop powerful armor to help defend the planet from outside threats. One such group of antagonists arrives 120 years after the "new Earth" is created: the mysterious Zodgierra, a warrior race with a love of tournament combat. Players choose from several different fighters and five modes of play: Story, Versus VR, Versus Two-Player, Robot Training, and Practice. In Story mode, you are one of eight characters pitted against the enemy fighters in an effort to win the champion title. DUAL HEROES also features the unique Robot Training and Versus VR. In Versus VR, the opposition is "virtual gamers," each with their own fighting style. And in the Robot Training mode, the CPU actually learns the moves performed (saving them to the Nintendo Controller Pak). In the Tournament warriors earn medals, which the player can then use to bet on or against your friends.

title: Glover
description: The Nintendo 64 gains another 3D platformer with GLOVER. As the story goes, Glover was once the glove of a wizard who was performing a very powerful spell. After an accident, the wizard's gloves fly away and each one is able to move by itself. One glove turns to evil, while the other glove vows to stop it. You take control of Glover, the good one, and guide him throughout numerous themed levels to solve puzzles. You must find various balls through each stage and utilize them in different ways to progress. You can transform each ball into various forms so that they can help you accomplish your goal, but you must think it through. As with most platformers, the game features graphics and music that perfectly complement the action. GLOVER is yet another fine example of why the N64 is the leading console for 3D platforming games.

title: NBA Live '99
description: NBA LIVE '99 gives you control of every aspect of the game, right down to which fouls get called and how often they're called. In other words, you can make the game as complicated as the real thing or make it a bare bones version and of pick-up basketball. Along with the standard Exhibition, Season, and Playoff modes, you also get a 3-point Shooting Contest that will test your long-range skills. As your team's GM, you can trade and release players as you see fit in order to construct your own dream team. You can also create players and add them to your team to fill holes on the roster. When you're on the court, you can call plays on the fly or just let you teammates handle it, leaving you free to concentrate on getting open. You can also take on a friend in the Multiplayer mode and see who is the real king of the hardwood. With NBA LIVE '99, if you've seen it in the real NBA, chances are you'll see it here too.

title: Delta Force
description: Delta Force is the name of a highly classified military special operations group. Do you have what it takes? In this first-person shooter, players will use real-life rocket launchers, machine guns, pistols, and sniper rifles to accomplish their goals. They will also have to pick and choose their squad to form the best team for the job possible. Comprising more than 40 missions, Delta Force is in full 3D but does not require a 3D accelerator - rather, it uses voxels rendered in software to achieve a 3D look. Multiplayer games include Capture the Flag, King of the Hill, and Deathmatch.

title: Shogo: Mobile Armor Division
description: Shogo: Mobile Armor Division is an action shooter title from Monolith. The viewpoint can be switched between first and third-person perspectives. Shogo places the player either on foot or in giant mech but unlike other mech titles this mech can really move and the action is fast-paced. Taking the role of Sanjuro the player must defeat the mighty Gabriel and in turn bring on the demise of The Fallen, who have claimed home to the planet known as Cronus. Fight the enemy on foot with knives, machine guns, assault rifles, and more. Take on the enemy in your mech with a whole new host of weapons such as the laser rifle, pulse rifle, and sniper rifle. Shogo is powered by the LithTech 3D engine by Monolith.
rating_content: Animated Blood and Gore, Animated Violence

title: NBA Live '99
description: Hoop it up with this instantly playable take on NBA action. EA Sports presents this complete roundball romp that features all of the NBA's teams and players with their real physical attributes and abilities. The game offers nine offensive strategies including two versions of Phil Jackson's fabled triangle offense and five defensive strategies. You choose your level of defensive pressure, and where you want to assign double teams.   The gameplay is as good as anything the N64 has ever seen, as you make your way through exhibition games, customizable seasons, the NBA Playoffs, or a goofy game in the hilarious Arcade mode. You can even build your own NBA superstar and endow him with 12 different abilities. If you'd like, play General Manager and trade for anyone you want. The graphics and animations are so realistic, the players actually cast shadows wherever they move. You want details? The teams' Sunday uniforms are even included! With support for up to four players and Rumble Pak compatibility, this is basketball the way it's supposed to be played.

title: Colony Wars: Vengeance
description: One hundred years have passed since the League of Free Worlds defeated the Earth Empire. As a result of that loss, the Empire was restricted to its home system, Sol, and was forced to endure decades of civil war. Now the reformed Earth Empire has a new leader named Kron, who wants the Empire to escape from the boundaries of Sol and return to its former glory. You assume the role of Mertens, a pilot in the Colonial Navy and follower of Kron, as he flies five ships in 40 missions against the League. Missions range from the simple bombing runs and escort duty to the complex following a ship through a minefield to gather intelligence. After each mission, tech credits are awarded so Mertens can customize his ship. Adding some depth and replay value, Mertens's performance determines how the plot develops, which missions become available, and which of the six endings is the result of the conflict. Will the Earth Empire regain its glory? Play COLONY WARS: Vengeance and find out.

title: Rage of Mages
description: Rage of Mages combines role-playing elements with real-time strategy to produce what is sometimes referred to as a genre in and of itself. You control the actions of a hero from an overhead view, and can hire or find additional troops in the game's towns. Heroes can carry customizable items and equipment, and can also advance in level and strength as well as learning new spells. Rage of Mages also features online play against or alongside other players around the globe.

title: International Superstar Soccer '98
description: It's the non-licensed game with Carlos Valderrama on the cover and it's the very best soccer game to ever hit the N64. ISS98 surpassed EA's FIFA titles thanks to excellent and silky smooth gameplay and control. You had to suffer through fake superstars like "Romano" in place of Ronaldo, but this sequel to ISS64 had the same charm of the original, plus a whole lot more. More teams, more pitches, more options plus an improved create a player feature as well as little additions like head tracking and a more sophisticated AI brought soccer home in the best way. If you want the best soccer experience on the N64 top to bottom, International Superstar Soccer '98 is your cartridge.

title: Crash Bandicoot: Warped
description: After defeating Dr. Neo Cortex, Crash and his sister, Coco, take a well-deserved vacation. However, their friend, Aku Aku, has a bad feeling, and as usual, he is right. Aku's evil twin, Uka Uka, was the person behind all of Dr. Cortex's schemes. Now Uka and Cortex have hatched a plot to gain control of the powerful crystals they desire. The have hired Dr. N. Tropy to create a time machine, which will allow Uka and Cortex to go back and take the crystals without interference. Take control of Crash and Coco as they travel through 30 levels across five time periods in an effort to stop Uka and Cortex. Use a motorcycle, plane, bazooka, and a baby T-rex to help Crash survive, or destroy the bad guys by using new moves like the super belly flop or the double jump. Will Crash and Coco be able to save the world? Play CRASH BANDICOOT: Warped and find out.

title: WipEout 64
description: Your mission: to stay in the lead and defend your craft against all other pilots. This futuristic racing masterpiece is an update on the popular games WIPEOUT and WIPEOUT XL. You'll negotiate hairpin turns, take stomach-churning drops, and brave gargantuan jumps as you try to blast your opponents into dust with your arsenal of weapons. Featuring an impressive soundtrack by Fluke and the Propellerheads, WIPEOUT 64 brings fast gameplay, slick graphics, and fierce racing to a whole new level. Using an antigravity, hover-racing vehicle, you'll have to do more than move fast to keep your opponents down. There are all sorts of weapons and power-ups from missiles and mines to turbos that will come back to haunt you if you miss them. This installment of the classic racing game features all-new weapons (each ship has a minigun), and a new Challenge mode, which sets up time and placement conditions for you to overcome in order to stave off elimination. With so many impressive tracks, and such original play, WIPEOUT 64 has a place in any N64 library. Multiplayer modes support up to four players.

title: Lucky Luke
description: The Dalton boys, the baddest, meanest bank robbers in all of Arizona, have escaped from prison. Now it is up to lawman Lucky Luke to stop them. You take control of Luke as he travels through 17 levels of deserts, ghost towns, and runaway wagons on his way to capturing the Dalton boys. As luck would have it, Luke can pick up several useful items along the way: sheriff stars boost Luke's maximum hit points, dynamite charges can blow obstacles and bad guys into small pieces, and the golden Luke Head gives the greatest boost with an extra life. Luke can also pick up money that can be use to buy extra supplies, as well as passwords that allow Luke to continue his quest. With the Dalton boys on the loose, no one is safe. Help Lucky Luke capture them and put them back where they belong prison.
platforms: PS C64 SNES GB LCD GBC CD-i PC

title: Glover
description: While performing an experiment, a wizard accidentally loses his gloves in a magic cauldron. The resulting explosion scatters the magic crystals across the kingdom. Fortunately, one of the gloves comes to life and wants to collect the crystals and return them to the wizard. Unfortunately, the other glove is evil, and will stop at nothing to see that the wizard doesn't get his hands back on the crystals. Play GLOVER, and help the good glove return the crystals to their rightful owner.

title: Thief: The Dark Project
description: Thief: The Dark Project is a first-person action/adventure game. Your character will stalk through the silent corridors of a sleeping city and ambush its unsuspecting guards. Eavesdrop on your foes as they coordinate their man-hunt in real-time digital audio. Infiltrate and explore mission areas, from sewers to an abandoned cathedral ... even plunder the Lost City of the Ancients! Prowl in the shadows, scale sheer walls, leap over chasms, and dive beneath the rushing waters of the city's aqueducts. Unlike other First Person Shooters this game is all about stealth.

title: FIFA '99
description: Instead of trying to recreate the World Cup tournament, FIFA 99 squarely focuses on the the European league, with more than 250 soccer teams battling for the cup. Don't worry, EA didn't forget about the rest of the World. You can select plenty of international teams, from Argentina to Yugoslavia, as well as US and Brazilian league teams. FIFA 99 also dishes up a much more varied lineup of game modes, including a European Dream league and Cup Creation modes. In addition to its wider variety of modes, EA wisely included a Player Edit and a Team Edit function, so you can keep your teams up to date (you need a memory pak to save, of course). Like in FIFA 98, you can change face maps, give your players names, adjust attributes, and so forth. However, there are still no separate height and weight attributes for players.

title: Turok 2: Seeds of Evil
description: The story so far: The Campaigner is dead. A long, long time ago, a spaceship crashed on Earth. Its cargo, an army of alien warriors headed by the nastiest villain yet, Primagen. Although he is trapped inside his ship, Primagen manages to send out his army of creatures and and turns dinosaurs into deadly killing machines. In order to keep the Primagen from escaping, Turok must keep the wall between Earth and the netherworld secure -- and that's just not going to be easy. Trek through seven huge Quest Mode levels, including the "Port of Adia" and the "Underground Abyss." There are over 30 enemies to battle, each with unique AI, and there are an additional five bosses, each of which is unbelievably vicious (especially the Queen Mantis!)Like its predecessor, Turok 2 is a first-person shooter based on Acclaim's comic-book series -- but with less emphasis on jumping and more on action and exploration than Turok 1. This time around, it also will be necessary to go back into certain levels look for more items (Talismans) and open up new passages, making for a more complex, less linear adventure.
rating_content: Animated Blood and Gore, Animated Violence

title: Tomb Raider III: Adventures of Lara Croft
description: Tomb Raider III has a serious jump level design and variety compared to Tomb Raider II. Locations include the rainforests of India, London, Nevada, South Pacific Islands and Antarctica, making up a total of 19 massive levels set in varied terrains and conditions. The levels are less linear than in the previous games thanks to multiple paths in exploration and puzzles. New weapons include MP5, Rocket Launcher, Grenade Launcher and Desert Eagle and there is a larger range of enemies, including more exotic animals. Lara is also capable of a few new moves including sprinting, crawling and "monkey swinging". Tomb Raider III stays in the action/adventure genre as well as the third person perspective. These have become one of the things that the series of games is known for.

title: Kensei: Sacred Fist
description: Enter a martial arts tournament in KENSEI: Sacred Fist. Choose from 22 different characters and use the training mode to learn each character's unique moves and combinations. When you are ready to fight, play the Normal mode and unlock new characters. For some different challenges, try to see how quickly you can move through all of the stages in the Time Attack mode, or see how many challengers you can beat before losing all of your health in the Survival mode. If your friends think they can beat you, challenge them to a bout with the Versus mode. No matter what mode you play, you will be able to feel every punch and kick thanks to the Dual Shock support. Do you have the strength and courage to win the tournament in KENSEI: Sacred Fist?

title: The Elder Scrolls Adventures: Redguard
description: You are Cyrus, a Redguard mercenary who has returned to his homeland on an urgent mission. His sister has been kidnapped and a great conspiracy has consumed the land. Your quest leads from the Iron Governor of the Island Stros M'kai, to a restless band of pirates, and even into another dimension. Along the way you'll interact with dozens of characters and face creatures of all sorts. You'll explore beaches, mountains, caverns, ruins, and much more as the storyline unfolds.
rating_content: Animated Violence, Use of Tobacco and Alcohol

title: Star Wars: Rogue Squadron
description: Planetary battles is whatis all about. Based on the novel and comic book series by the same name,follows the adventures of a daring group of pilots led by Luke Skywalker and (later on) Wedge Antilles. In Rogue, players take on the role of Luke Skywalker (and Wedge in the last mission) and set out to fight the evil Empire in more than 15 missions in familiar and new Star Wars locations. The battles all take place in extensive 3D worlds on planetary surfaces (there are no space battles) ranging from the hot sands of Tatooine to the spice mines of Kessel and even the oceans of the Mon Calamari. In addition to the 15 regular missions, there are also a few hidden ones that have to be unlocked.

title: Roll Away
description: The name says it all in this challenging puzzle game that has you navigating through vast environments as a beach ball. Make your way through the dozens of dizzying 3D mazes as you try to find the keys that will let you escape from each level. Traveling high above the ground you'll face obstacles such as fire patches, dangerous captivators, ice patches, spikes (not a great thing when you're a beach ball), and lethargy pills that distort the screen. Time, however, is your real enemy; an hourglass sits in the corner of each screen and if it runs out you do, too. There are bonus items to help you get through each round such as fruit, coins, and gems. An unusually versatile beach ball, you actually have the ability to jump (which comes in handy if you're trying to avoid the aforementioned spikes). You can play in either Arcade mode, or Time Trial, an option that has you racing against a one-minute time limit.

title: Jeopardy! [1998]
description: The classic game of answers and questions, JEOPARDY! has arrived for the PlayStation. Every aspect of the show has been recreated, and you'll see it as the camera pans and zooms across a perfect rendering of the television studio. Just like on TV, Alex Trebek provides encouragement and support for all of the players in full-motion video sequences. With over 3,500 different answers all of them are read by JEOPARDY! announcer Johnny Gilbert there are plenty of challenges to keep the player engaged. But don't think the categories are dumbed down because this is a videogame every single answer could be on the show.
