description: Snow Town is under attack by a 10-year old terror named Damien, and it's up to the Snowboard Kids to defeat him. Pick your character from a pack of nine rabid pre-teens, each with different attributes that gives him or her advantages on specific slopes. In this sequel to the popular SNOWBOARD KIDS, you can play in either Story mode or Action mode, depending on how involved you want to get. The 3D courses at your disposal include "Sunny Mountain," "Turtle Island," "Jingle Town," "Wendy's House," "Linda's Castle," and "Crazy Jungle." The obstacles are varied and extremely difficult, ranging from potholes to waterfalls. While having a number of similarities to its predecessor, this installment has more weaponry and games than you can possibly imagine. Of course, the tricks are awesome, the handling is top-notch, and the animation is fantastic. Good for up to four players, and Rumble Pak compatible.

title: Turok 2: Seeds of Evil
description: The story so far: The Campaigner is dead. A long, long time ago, a spaceship crashed on Earth. Its cargo, an army of alien warriors headed by the nastiest villain yet, Primagen. Although he is trapped inside his ship, Primagen manages to send out his army of creatures and and turns dinosaurs into deadly killing machines. In order to keep the Primagen from escaping, Turok must keep the wall between Earth and the netherworld secure -- and that's just not going to be easy. Trek through seven huge Quest Mode levels, including the "Port of Adia" and the "Underground Abyss." There are over 30 enemies to battle, each with unique AI, and there are an additional five bosses, each of which is unbelievably vicious (especially the Queen Mantis!)Like its predecessor, Turok 2 is a first-person shooter based on Acclaim's comic-book series -- but with less emphasis on jumping and more on action and exploration than Turok 1. This time around, it also will be necessary to go back into certain levels look for more items (Talismans) and open up new passages, making for a more complex, less linear adventure.

title: Eliminator
description: The Eliminator event was the most popular televised sport in history. Prisoners would engage in combat until only one man was left standing. He would subsequently be released from prison with fame and fortune. Now, new weapons are tested in hovercraft called Eliminators, and you are the next contestant. Choose from four ships and challenge eight different arenas: Penitentiary, Maze, Asylum, Cage, Chasm, Monastery, Tomb, and Fortress. In each arena there is an array of defenses and robots that must be destroyed; however, if you do not clear the arena within the time limit, the bomb strapped to your car will explode. Thankfully, a unique targeting system allows you to target enemies on the ground or in the air. Should friends want to try the events, challenge them to a death match in the Two-Player mode. Surviving in ELIMINATOR takes guts and skill.

title: R-Types
description: Uniting two of the most difficult challenges of all time, R-TYPES presents the games R-TYPE and R-TYPE II in one complete package. In R-TYPE, The Bydo Empire controls the rule of the land and their evil ideas promote slaughter and hatred. Grotesque creatures roam the world striking fear into the hearts of the few decent people left to care. Your job is to destroy the monsters swiftly and thoroughly; if you don't, the world is doomed forever. The game's eight awesome stages range from a cave to a gigantic warship to a desolate city on the brink of destruction. In R-TYPE II, The Bydo Empire has been revived and is back to its evil ways. With its new power, it has rapidly achieved evolution in a different dimension, and it's up to you to save a galaxy riddled by fear and cowardice. If your counterattack is going to succeed you'll need to journey to ancient ruins, dark caverns, into the crimson sky, and onto a Bydo star. Do you think you have the courage to defeat the Empire twice? Now you can find out.

title: Marvel Super Heroes vs. Street Fighter
description: This is the game that will finally settle those arguments about who is tougher, Ryu or Wolverine. There are five modes of play: Battle, Versus, Training, Hero Battle, and Crossover. Battle and Versus are your typical one and two-player fighting game modes, while Hero Battle is an endurance mode that separates the groups to see which has the stronger stable of fighters. There are 17 combatants available, nine from STREET FIGHTER and eight from the Marvel camp. This game is a port of the arcade hit of the same name and features the type of gameplay that has made Capcom one of the most respected developers of fighting games on the planet. Expect plenty of dragon punches, fireballs, and huge chain combinations as you pit your favorite characters from these two franchises against each other.

title: Myth II: Soulblighter
description: Real-time strategy game. This game is set 60 years after the end of the original title. The premise is that the land is being overrun by members of the undead that are controlled by the Soulblighter.

title: Street Sk8er
description: Perform over 200 skateboarding tricks and see how agro you can get in Street Skater. Choose from four different boarders TJ, Jerry, Ginger, and Frankie each rated in jump power, cornering, maximum speed, and acceleration. When you are ready to play, practice your moves in the Freestyle mode or try to win a contest in the Street Tour mode. If your friends want to play, you can challenge them to a contest with the Versus mode. With Street Skater, you can go skateboarding without a helmet.

title: Silent Hill
description: Harry Mason and his daughter Cheryl are heading to a small midwestern resort town. Suddenly, Harry sees a dark figure in the street and swerves to avoid it, causing a serious accident. After coming to, Harry realizes that he has smashed the car and Cheryl is missing. Further, it has started to snow in the middle of summer, and the town appears to be deserted. You must guide Harry through the town while he searches for his daughter and tries to discover what happened in this strange community. Along the way, you will explore a hospital, elementary school, and the streets of the town. Since Harry is an ordinary guy, he will have to catch his breath after running and will often miss his target when shooting. The entire game is given a frightening feeling with eerie lighting effects   especially since the town is dark and the vast majority of lighting comes from a flashlight. Will Harry be able to save his daughter and escape the town in SILENT HILL?
rating_content: Animated Blood and Gore, Animated Violence

title: Blast Radius
description: In BLAST RADIUS, you are the last member of an elite fighter squadron, and you have landed in the middle of the conflict between the evil Kotan-Kai and the docile Vorn. The Vorn want you to defend them; in return, you'll get to fly nine of their most advanced spacecraft. Take out the Kotan-Kai with 13 different weapons including torpedoes, rockets, seeker missiles, and fusion nukes in 40 levels of intense dogfighting action. After successfully defending the Vorn, use a link-cable to destroy your friends in the Two-Player mode.

title: Tetris 64
description: If it wasn't for the simple presentation and sound, Tetris 64 (aka Bio Tetris) would have been the clear winner of the Nintendo 64 puzzle wars. But even if it can't compete with the slick presentation and score of The New Tetris, Tetris 64 eclipses them all with a better four-player mode and much more gameplay variety. To round off the whole package, this oddball title is compatible with a Bio Sensor that uses your heart rate to either slow down or speed up the gameplay (depending on whether you want to relax or get excited). The game also includes some alternate Tetris variations featuring oversized and odd-shaped pieces. It's a bit hard to find nowadays, but if you see this game for a reasonable price in an import store, grab it before it's gone forever.

title: SimCity 3000
description: SimCity 3000 is a stable, attractive, finely balanced game with just enough new features to satisfy veterans of the series. This is the latest version of this famous god-sim game, where you take the role of mayor of your city.

title: Fisherman's Bait
description: Fast and furious arcade fishing action comes to the PlayStation with FISHERMAN'S BAIT. First timers can use the Beginner mode to learn how to use the controls. For a casual experience, you can use the Training mode to fish on one the games three lakes. When you are ready for competition, challenge a friend in the Versus mode or try to become the ultimate bass master with the Tournament mode. Once the fish start nibbling, hook them and try to reel them in. Be careful though, because if the tension becomes too great, the line will snap and you will be telling stories of the one that got away. Since this is arcade fishing, you have to compete against the clock. Luckily, every fish you catch adds time and allows the quest for the big one to continue. Aspiring anglers will be richly rewarded for patience and skill in FISHERMAN'S BAIT.

title: Syphon Filter
description: A terrorist organization steals a top-secret virus known as Syphon Filter, and they plan to use it to extort money from the world's governments. Only special agent Gabe Logan can stop them and keep the world safe. Take control of Logan has works his way through parks, subway lines, a museum, and a military compound. Along the way, Logan will be able to utilize a large number of weapons including a taser, machine guns, shotguns, and grenades. If he runs across an enemy wearing armor, he will have to take them out with a quick shot to the head. While blasting the bad guys is great fun, there are times when stealth will make a task much easier. Stop the terrorists and return the virus to the proper authorities in SYPHON FILTER.

title: Top Gun: Hornet's Nest
description: You're Maverick, the Navy's top gun, in the cockpit of a screaming F/A-18 with the attitude and guts to take out any enemy foolish enough to take you on.Your missions are not easy as they appear as you must protect your naval fleet and succeed at all costs.

title: Tales of Destiny
description: Stahn Aileron wants to leave the dull day-to-day workings of his village and seek fame and fortune in the world. The first chance he gets, Stahn stows away on a dragonship. Unfortunately, he is caught and must swab the decks. When the ship is attacked, Stahn escapes with a piece of valuable cargo a talking sword. But this is only the beginning of a much larger adventure, as Stahn will travel the world searching for other heroes that are tied to him by fate. He will also have to battle a relentless flow of enemies in a real-time battle system. Graphically, dungeons and battle are rendered with hand-drawn 2D animation, while the world is rendered in 3D. You must help Stahn discover his true nature in TALES OF DESTINY.
rating_content: Mild Animated Violence, Use of Tobacco and Alcohol

title: Sid Meier's Alpha Centauri
description: Legendary designer Sid Meier presents the next evolution in strategy games, with the most addictive, compelling gameplay yet. Explore the alien planet that is your new home and uncover its myriad mysteries. Discover over 75 extraordinary technologies. Build over 60 base upgrades and large scales secret projects for your empire. Conquer your enemies with a war machine that you design from over 32,000 possible unit types.

title: Luftwaffe Commander
description: The sky is clear, you're cruising along back to the base, and all of the sudden  Enemy at three o'clock! Test your flying ability and trigger finger in this World War II-era aerial combat simulation. Fly over the famous European landmarks trying to defeat those pesky Axis forces once and for all. You'll have access to plenty of detail-perfect aircraft to pilot, and there'll be loads of realistic firepower at your disposal. Accurate cockpit displays keep you abreast of the action as you're in the midst of a dogfight, and the 3D graphics deliver major excitement points.

title: Lode Runner 3D
description: Nearly 20 years ago, a game was released that changed the face of puzzle games forever. Now, it has come back in the form of LODE RUNNER 3D for the Nintendo 64. The story is about a group of people called Lode Runners who must infiltrate the lair of the evil Emperor Monk and relieve him of his massive amounts of gold. While the game is in 3D, the actual puzzles are solved on a 2D plain, making the graphics a mix of two worlds. The actual polygons are bright and vibrant to mimic the strange locations that the Lode Runners must visit. There are plenty of levels available to keep even the most quick-witted gamer busy for a long time, including hidden levels that can only be unlocked after accomplishing certain deeds. LODE RUNNER 3D takes the concept that made the original game great and puts it into a new setting that helps to enhance the experience.

title: Star Wars: X-Wing Alliance
description: In this alternate view of The Return of the Jedi's events, you are 'Ace' Azzameen, a rookie pilot. As your sister and brother introduce you to actual combat and missions for the family business Twin Star Transports, the menace of the Viraxo family abates. Soon, their plotting with the Empire forces your disbanded family to join the rebellion. Can your skills match the legendary Luke Skywalker's and Han Solo's, and participate into the Battle of Endor inside the Millennium Falcon - all while preventing the different views in the rest of your family from fully destroying itself? There's 50 missions to prove your worth into flying the rebel X-,Y-,A and B-wing fighters, plus the family Corellian Transports; and if your skills need honing, fly training and instant action missions or into the highly unofficial (and highly dangerous) pilot's proving grounds or participate in multiplayer cooperative and deathmatch missions.

title: Big Air
description: The excitement and thrills of snowboarding come to the PlayStation in Big Air. Any snowboarding fan will be kept busy for hours with 30 courses in six different countries including France, Japan, Scotland, Switzerland, the United States, and Germany. If you're having problems hitting the perfect 1080 method, use the Training mode and hone those skills. Afterwards, thrash the competition in free ride races, free ride trick competitions, halfpipes, big air contests, and boardercross races; or you can take on all of these events in the World Circuit mode. While claiming the world championship, enjoy tunes from Blink 182, Snuff, Diesel Boy, and Leatherface. With equipment and apparel from Palmer, Ride, Morrow, Joyride, and many more, you'll swear that you are on the slopes.

title: Interplay Sports Baseball 2000
description: Bottom of the 9th, two outs, and the game is tied. Bagwell steps up to the plate. He takes the first two pitches for strikes. The pitcher delivers the ball, and Bagwell knocks it out of the park. Astros win! Astros win! Live moments like these with INTERPLAY SPORTS BASEBALL 2000. Thanks to a Major League Baseball license, all of the teams, players, and stadiums are here. You can play an Exhibition game or a Home Run Derby to get some quick action, while those who have a little more time should experience the ups and downs of the Season, Tournament, or Playoff modes. For those who want to control everything, use the General Manager mode to trade players or create the perfect first baseman with the Create-a-Player option. The players look realistic thanks to motion capture technology. INTERPLAY SPORTS BASEBALL 2000 will challenge even the most die-hard baseball fans.

title: Heroes of Might and Magic III: The Restoration of Erathia
description: In this turn-based strategy game you combine the use of strategy, magic and brute force. Venture your way to other towns, interact/fight with other heroes and even cross into the subterranean world to deal with the dregs of humanity (or in this case, the undead). Ship-to-ship combat is another element of the fighting skills you will have to master in order to succeed. You are depended upon to restore honor to a fallen kingdom and re-establish its dominance.

title: Gex 3: Deep Cover Gecko
description: The evil Rez has returned. This time he has kidnapped Agent Xtra (portrayed by Baywatch star Marliece Andrado), and only Gex, the gecko with attitude, can save her. Travel through levels based on television themes as Gex collects remote controls to open new areas and eventually face the big boss at the end of each stage. Luckily, Gex has several moves that expedite his exploration: jump, double jump, tail-whip, wall-climb, and karate kick, just to name a few. There are also moves that are specific to certain areas and costumes. For example, Gex can perform a floating jump when he wears a cape. As with the other Gex games, comedian Dana Gould provides the voice behind the lizard, and with a new and improved camera, you won't miss a second of the action. Will this be the Rez's last stand? Can Gex save Agent Xtra? Discover the answers in Gex 3: Deep Cover Gecko.

title: Redline
description: Redline is the Mad Max of action games. Accolade and Action Games have taken the first-person shooter to the next level of interactivity by successfully combining vehicular combat with on-foot warfare. Think of it as a combination of Interstate `76, Carmageddon, and Quake.

title: EverQuest
description: EverQuest is one of the most popular online role-playing games: play the black knight, the reclusive wizard, or the crafty rogue in this immersive and mythic world of stellar fantasy. And with never before seen, state-of-the-art 3D graphics, you'll never want to leave the world of EverQuest.
rating_content: Blood and Gore, Suggestive Themes, Use of Alcohol, Violence

title: Micro Machines 64 Turbo
description: With a quirky mix of toy car racers and sophisticated gameplay, Micro Machines 64 Turbo guarantees to be a refreshing addition to the stable of standard racing games. The wide variety of vehicles featured includes Formula 1 racers, speed boats, monster trucks, tanks, and ice cream trucks. Choose from 25 whimsical tracks, which run the gamut from a kitchen table to a chemistry lab, each including the appropriate props to match the d¿cor. Such detail rich touches keep this game interesting, even to the most jaded gamer. Belying the kiddie car appearance, the game requires you to plan strategically if you want to emerge the winner, making good use of the weapons at your disposal. You must also negotiate sharp turns and avoid hazards if you want to emerge victorious. Multiplayer races comprise of several quick heats, and if you win enough of them you win the race. There is even a Controller share option so that eight players can race their own vehicles simultaneously.

title: Rollcage
description: Do you have the grit to take a corner at 300 miles per hour while grinding your opponent into a wall as you turn? If not, don't bother checking out ROLLCAGE, the most intense, high-octane racing game imaginable. The game features 20 unique tracks through four different environments including canyons, cities, and roadways. The six included vehicles can actually race on any surface you see in the game meaning you can race on tunnel ceilings, over gigantic boulders, up walls, and more. Each vehicle is absolutely indestructible and is rated for speed, acceleration, strength, and grip. You'll find eight powerful offensive weapons and boosts to give you an edge on the competition including homing missiles, a drill, a leader missile that seeks out the first-place combatant, ice sheets, and a leapfrog-style wormhole. You can play in League, Time Attack, Two-Player, and Practice modes. The League starts you out in the Gemini division, challenging you to obtain enough points to rise to the Scorpio and Taurus divisions, while Time Attack lets you battle the clock or a ghost racer, making for some exciting finishes. With awesome gameplay and graphics and lots of hidden bonuses, ROLLCAGE is pure racing excitement.

title: Beetle Adventure Racing
description: Looking for a racing game that will appeal to every gaming fan? You've found it in BEETLE ADVENTURE RACING from Electronic Arts! This isn't Herbie the Love Bug these Beetles are an updated version of the classic. Take your Beetle for a spin out on the track or take it off-road! Choose from several cool, hip Beetles, each with its own distinct style. Kick your Beetles speed up a notch with a wild nitro boost, and race up ramps for death-defying jumps. This game is loaded with so many goodies and secrets to uncover, you'll never get tired of just cruising in your Beetle looking for them. Race your car through the Championship Season and discover secret tracks, or challenge a chum in the Duel mode. You can also leave the pavement for the rugged terrain in the Time Trial mode or go on the attack in a Beetle Battle with up to four players.

title: Need for Speed: High Stakes
description: Push your car to the limits in High Stakes racing for prize money to customize and buy your dream cars. Gamble your car on single races or develop your career. Cars can be damaged and a new Hot Pursuit mode has been added requiring you to avoid being caught by the police. Features eighteen models of cars on nineteen courses.

title: Triple Play 2000
description: EA Sports brings power baseball back for another  season with Triple Play 2001. Major League Baseball (MLB) and MLBPA licenses give game players all the teams and players in the major leagues. For the first time in the Triple Play Series, Triple Play 2001 brings the legends of the game to the plate with the exclusive MLBPA Big League Challenge Mode. Baseball's storied history comes alive with legendary players such as Babe Ruth, Willie Mays, Ted Williams, Lou Gehrig, Cy Young, Jackie Robinson, and many more historical baseball legends. Step up to the plate and see if you can compete as or against the greatest home run batters of all time.

title: Triple Play 2000
description: EA Sports brings power baseball back for another  season with Triple Play 2001. Major League Baseball (MLB) and MLBPA licenses give game players all the teams and players in the major leagues. For the first time in the Triple Play Series, Triple Play 2001 brings the legends of the game to the plate with the exclusive MLBPA Big League Challenge Mode. Baseball's storied history comes alive with legendary players such as Babe Ruth, Willie Mays, Ted Williams, Lou Gehrig, Cy Young, Jackie Robinson, and many more historical baseball legends. Step up to the plate and see if you can compete as or against the greatest home run batters of all time.

title: Freestyle Boardin' '99
description: Snowboarding has become one of the most popular videogame activities. Entering the boarding fray is FREESTYLE BOARDIN' '99. You get to choose from six different boarders with varied skills, and then you can hit the slopes in the Championship mode. After each event in the Championship mode, you are given a small number of points to distribute to your rider's attributes. You'll notice the difference as your rider's skills improve as you progress through the game. Should you and your friends want to decide who has the most radical moves, plug in the extra controller and go at it in the two-player split-screen mode. All of the action is captured with beautiful animation and rock solid framerates (even in the two-player modes). FREESTYLE BOARDIN' '99 provides all of the actions that snowboarding fans have come to expect in a videogame.

title: Army Men 3D
description: Perhaps one of the most innovative games to hit the market in a long time, ARMY MEN 3D provides fun gameplay for people of all ages. You can travel by foot or use one of the four available vehicles: a half track, a jeep, a cargo truck, or a tank. If that's not enough, ARMY MEN 3D offers a wide variety of weapons, from machine guns and mortars to bazookas and flame throwers. Don't think you'll be taking on the enemy alone, though you're in control of an entire unit of troops with one thing on their collective mind: destroy the Tan army. What bring this game to life are the animations flame throwers melt units, bazookas blow vehicles into bits, and tanks flatten plastic units. If you get a hankering to toast your friend, battle him in the Two-Player Split-Screen mode in a game of Capture the Flag. ARMY MEN 3D sets a new trend in gaming that will hopefully will be followed in the near future.

title: Resident Evil 2
description: Raccoon City has somehow fallen victim to a zombie outbreak and it's up to you as either police officer Leon Kennedy, or Claire Redfield (sister to Chris Redfield from RE1), to find out what's going on. The adventure, which takes place in 3D using pre-rendered backgrounds, drags you through spooky crash sites, abandoned buildings, experiments gone wrong and more -- all the while battling undead monstrosities, solving puzzles and, most of all, trying to stay alive. Lots of weapons and other gadgetry allow for some truly disgusting mayhem. It's an incredibly frightening game that delivers a light back-story and lots of slasher movie, jump-out-and-go-boo scares.
rating_content: Animated Blood and Gore, Animated Violence

title: California Speed
description: Strap yourself in for all kinds of fun as you get ready to sink the accelerator pedal and race through some of the most scenic parts of the wildcard state in California Speed. The 11 featured courses will take you through Santa Cruz, Yosemite, Central Valley, Highway 1, Los Angeles, Mojave, Monterey, Mount Shasta, San Diego, San Francisco, and the Silicon Valley. After a few Practice Races that let you get the feel of the road for 999 seconds, you're going to want to dive into the heart of the game, which is Series Mode. Driving in this mode makes you race each track three times in four assorted competitions: Light, Heavy, Sport, and the California Cup. You get to race in a fifth competition, State, but that only requires you to race each course once. The courses run from the mundane to the psychedelic: one minute you're cruising past the famous Hollywood sign and the next you're navigating through a UFO mothership. Welcome to California.

title: Vigilante 8
description: Race into high-octane, car-based combat action with VIGILANTE 8. In a bizarre, alternate version of the 1970's you play as either one of the good Vigilantes or the evil Renegade Coyotes. Drive across varied destructible environments and blast your enemies into oblivion. You can follow a fast and furious storyline in Quest mode (complete with full-motion video rewards and unlockable characters) or simply go at it in deathmatch-style Arcade mode, blowing up your opponents and surroundings while collecting power-ups and awesome weaponry. The design team has obviously been influenced by the TWISTED METAL series, but has really gone beyond the call of duty improving on every feature one would expect in a fast-paced vehicular blast 'em up. Get to know dangerous and wild '70s-style characters, drive tricked-out cars, trucks, and buses, and do your best to auto-exterminate the competition. VIGILANTE 8 is a smashing good time for deathrace dilettantes.

title: North vs. South: The Great American Civil War
description: Turn-based strategy/war game based on the American Civil War. A good selection of historically-based maps are included. You can play either side in the conflict. You organize your commanders and can move forces at the level of divisions or higher. A notable feature of the gameplay is that morale plays an important part in how forces perform.

title: NASCAR Revolution
description: What do you think your chances are of being in front when that checkered flag waves? That will all depend on your car, driver, pit crew, and reflexes. See how you stack up against the pros racing around 17 licensed NASCAR tracks. Pit crew mistakes, variable weather conditions, dwindling fuel, and other details make this about the most realistic racing experience outside of the real thing. Tweak your vehicle for each track, fix damage to your car, and much more. Awesome multiplayer options let you compete online against countless other gamers.

title: Legend of Legaia
description: The mist is forever present. Whenever it touches a living being, the being is mutated into something sinister. The only hope is to revive the dying genesis trees. You take the roles of Vahn, Noa, and Gala as they travel the world in search of the legendary trees. Along the way, the characters will encounter a large number of enemies. Luckily, they have a large number of attack moves including high and low punch and kick attacks. When the time comes, all of the characters can unleash super-attacks that can cause large amounts of damage. Every character must also find a Ra-Seru, a symbiotic creature that will boost their statistics. Will the trio of heroes be able to stop the mist? Is there something more sinister going on? Help the heroes find the truth in LEGEND OF LEGAIA.

title: Fighter Pilot: Ready - Aim - Fire
description: If you've ever wanted to fly such aerial beasts as the F or A-18, the F-117 stealth, and the F-22, you're in luck. Settle into the cockpit and start flying immediately with this easy-to-learn, all-inclusive flight simulator. Each mission in FIGHTER PILOT you'll take on is just a small step in the game's massive campaign, which will take you around the world and back in pursuit of victory. Play as a novice, veteran, expert, or ace each skill level boasting tactical differences. The awesome artillery will help you, but you'll need more than firepower to tangle with up to seven other online pilots.

title: Beavis and Butt-Head DO U
description: For having such a severe lack of motivation these two slackers sure do see their share of adventure, eh? The less-than-dynamic duo has graduated from Highland High, and now it's off to drink beer and meet chicks at the State University. Based on the acclaimed cartoon series from MTV, the game uses the same sense of humor from the show and presents you with eight series-themed challenges to keep things interesting (if not entirely innocent). You'll encounter classic characters like Kimberly and the ever-annoying Mr. Van Driesen in this hilarious escapade.

title: NBA In the Zone '99
description: Who's the king of the court? That's all up to you, as you create your players, teams, rules, and all the rest in this ultra-realistic basketball game. Officially licensed by the NBA In the Zone features all of the real players and teams in the league right down to their signature moves and abilities. You can play in several modes: Exhibition (a single game), Season (you set the number of games), Playoffs, All-Star (make your own all-star team and see how it fares against the rest of the league), and 3-Point Shootout. The game tracks all the stats you could ever need, and even keeps track when a player is signed or traded. If you'd rather, you can always create your own players right down to facial features and playing abilities. Aspiring coaches will appreciate the fact that you can call up to eight plays on the fly, allowing you to really hone in on your opponent's defensive weaknesses. So put your game face on and hit the hardwood.

title: Warzone 2100
description: Set amidst the shattered wastes of a society that has destroyed itself by the year 2085, players must construct a base, weapons, tanks and more. Once they've built up a vast army, the objective becomes simple: Destroy all of your enemies and take control of the planet. A real-time strategy game with a vast selection of technology and units and a real time 3D Camera. Unit types include tanks, hovercraft, VTOLs (aircraft), cyborg infantry, and weapons such as rockets, mortars, machine guns, cannons, and cluster bombs that can be fitted to the designs you create.

title: Triple Play 2000
description: EA Sports brings power baseball back for another  season with Triple Play 2001. Major League Baseball (MLB) and MLBPA licenses give game players all the teams and players in the major leagues. For the first time in the Triple Play Series, Triple Play 2001 brings the legends of the game to the plate with the exclusive MLBPA Big League Challenge Mode. Baseball's storied history comes alive with legendary players such as Babe Ruth, Willie Mays, Ted Williams, Lou Gehrig, Cy Young, Jackie Robinson, and many more historical baseball legends. Step up to the plate and see if you can compete as or against the greatest home run batters of all time.

title: Machines
description: Machines is a real-time strategy game where you control a race of silicon-based life forms on a mission to seed and dominate new worlds. The game lets you command your forces from both an isometric third-person perspective and a free-roaming, ground-level view, but it will also let you jump into any of your units to steer it, aim it and fire it. This feature will let you guide vital units deep into enemy bases - dodging defensive fire - and actually enter enemy facilities to steal or sabotage technology.

title: Falcon 4.0
description: Falcon 4.0, the long awaited sequel to the popular Falcon 3.0, places players into the U.S. Air Force's F-16C Block 50 "Falcon" fighter aircraft. Paying a great deal of attention to details, Falcon 4.0 is one of the most sophisticated, realistic combat flgiht simulators available.

title: Rollcage
description: Race across ceilings, walls, boulders and more   at speeds of up to 300 miles per hour! ROLLCAGE features 20 unique tracks through four different environments including canyons, cities, and roadways. You'll find eight powerful offensive weapons and boosts to give you an edge on the competition including homing missiles, a drill, a leader missile that seeks out the first-place combatant, ice sheets, and a leapfrog-style wormhole. Think you've seen combat racing before? Think again.

title: NHL Blades of Steel '99
description: Just the name ?Blades of Steel? brings many good thoughts to your head. For most, the first hockey game they have ever played, and loved. Well, its back. The main difference from back in the 8-bit days, there is more competition. With EA Sports, NHL `99 and Acclaim?s NHL Breakaway ?99 already released, Blades of Steel looks to re-enter the elite in hockey. Carried by Konami, Blades looks to be a couple of steps behind the others, as expected. Despite that fact, Konami put out a very good product in Blades of Steel ?99. With all 27 NHL Teams, full stat tracking, create-a-player and extremely entertaining multi-player, Blades competes very well.

title: All-Star Baseball 2000
description: The sequel to last year's original features a series of refinements and enhancements in the vein of a revamped AI system, a finely tuned batting/pitching mechanic (that's simply unrivaled) and a handful of new options like the ability to create custom teams. Developer Iguana Entertainment has also improved upon last year's high resolution visuals, presenting more animation routines, polished textures and redesigned 3D stadiums. Even the game's sense of speed has undergone a boost, eliminating long, sometimes tedious delays between pitches. There are also loads of new animations including head tracking, fielding errors, more realistic catches and bat swinging, as well as strikeout reactions for batters and pitchers.

title: High Heat Baseball 2000
description: This highly immersive and realistic game recreates the true look and feel of real baseball, putting you in uniform next to over 750 MLBPA players in one of 38 stadiums, including the San Francisco's Pacific Bell Ballpark, two classics - Ebbets Field and the Polo grounds - and four never before played in stadiums. Get ready to hit, run, pitch, and field. During gameplay, the user takes control of the perfect game through fast and immediate access to every aspect of situation management and arcade action.
rating_content: Suitable for Persons Ages Six and Older

title: Charlie Blast's Territory
description: CHARLIE'S BLAST TERRITORY combines solving intricate puzzles and blowing things up using tons of TNT! Meet Charlie Blast   he blows things up. It's the only thing he knows how to do but he does it well which is good for you because you're going to need his skills to make it through CHARLIE BLAST'S TERRITORY. On the surface, this game is about an evil corporate moneygrubber who's built dams on the six beautiful lakes feeding Rainbow Valley Lake. It is up to you to use Charlie and his demolition skills to destroy the dams with bombs and TNT to free the life-giving water from other lakes in order to refill Rainbow Valley Lake. But lurking beneath the surface is a cleverly designed puzzle game that will keep you glued to your Nintendo 64 for hours. If you're looking for a human challenge, CHARLIE BLAST'S TERRITORY offers a multiplayer function that lets you go head-to-head against a bomb-blasting friend.

title: Imperialism II: The Age of Exploration
description: In 1492, an Italian sailed west under the flag of Spain in an attempt to find a new sea route to Asia. After undergoing numerous hardships and near tragedies, he returned to Europe with gold, spices and tales of a new world. In Imperialism II, that's the easy part. Imp II is a 4X game (eXplore, eXpand, eXploit and eXterminate) that covers the Age of Exploration (1492-1600). Your job is to lead a great power of Europe through this difficult period and hopefully to dominance in the old world.Imperialism II is a well-designed, solid performer that makes a fun play and an interesting challenge, and the creators deserve kudos for a job well done.

title: Bust-A-Move 99
description: In BUST-A-MOVE ‘99 the cute green dinosaur with the bubble problem has returned. Armed only with a bubble-shooting machine, the dinosaur must eliminate all of the bubbles before they come crashing down around him. Anytime three bubbles of the same color come into contact with each other, they pop. In addition, all of the bubbles they were touching seek out more bubbles to create chain reactions. Pulleys and the steady sinking of the bubble menace add to the challenge. Jumping into the game is fairly easy; putting it down is much harder. All of the classic gameplay of the BUST-A-MOVE series has returned, along with thousands of new puzzles. BUST-A-MOVE ‘99 will keep bubble-popping fans up all night.

title: Carmageddon 2: Carpocalypse Now
description: It has only gotten better!!! CARMAGEDDON 2: CARPOCALYPSE NOW has the same formula of fun, freedom, and pedestrian-splattering action that caused so much attention in 1997's smash release. Fantastic graphic details--such as particles shattering from cars, windows, buildings, and objects upon impact--add to the realism of this action or racing game.
rating_content: Blood, Gore, Animated Violence, Mild Language

title: Pro 18: World Tour Golf
description: PRO 18: World Golf Tour is the most realistic golf game available for the PlayStation. It has three 18-hole courses: Royal County Down in Ireland, The Lost City Course in Sun City, South Africa, and Coeur d'Alene in Idaho. All of them have been recreated from digital information used to map the terrain. Digital video of a handful of well-known pros from around the world including Mark O'Meara, Colin Montgomerie, Tom Lehman, and Vijay Singh helps add to the realism. You can play in any weather condition like fog, rain, or sunshine. Challenge your friend in Skins, Match or simple Tournament mode, and you can also play with up to eight human players via the multitap. Try to beat the pros and your friends in PRO 18: World Golf Tour.

title: Sports Car GT
description: Now you have the opportunity to slip behind the wheel of high-performance sports cars and race with SPORTS CAR GT. Players can choose from a wide variety to cars like the BMW M3, Callaway C12, Lister Storm, Mosler Raptor, Panoz Esperante, Panoz GTR-1, Panoz Q9, Porsche 993, Porsche 911, Porsche 911-GT1, Saleen S-281, Saleen SR, and the Vector M-12. In addition to the real-world cars, there are number of real-world tracks including Mosport Park, Road Atlanta, Sebring International Raceway, Desert Speedway, and Laguna Seca Raceway. Challenge these tracks in the Season, Arcade, and Time Trial modes and if your friends want in on the action, you can challenge them to a race in the Head-to-Head, Pace Car, and Pink Slip modes. All of the thrills of Grand Tour Racing come to the PlayStation with SPORTS CAR GT.

title: Fighter Squadron: Screamin' Demons Over Europe
description: Just who are the Screamin' Demons? You'll find out soon enough, as you join the infamous 10-man squadron of airborne warriors. Fly for Germany, the United States, or Britain, piloting such notorious aircraft as the DeHavilland Mosquito, Avro Lancaster Mk II, Hawker Typhoon Mk 1B, Lockheeds, Boeings, Messerschmitts, and more. Run through as many training missions as you need to in order to get up to speed, then choose to fight over North Africa, Dover, or Rhineland. With more than 90 missions and 30 scenarios, this one's a keeper.

title: Starsiege
description: The year is 2829. A time of great danger and destiny. For years, the Emperor Petresun has prepared Earth for the next Cybrid invasion. But militant rebels on the colonies of Mars and Venus disrupt that purpose. When the Emperor's armada moves to crush the rebels, Prometheus seizes his chance.

title: MLB 2000
description: Last year?s best playing baseball game on the PlayStation has moved into the 21st century. If you love baseball, come join Vin Scully along with Dave Campbell from the booth as well as Mo Vaughn and the rest of your favorite players from the field in MLB 2000 from 989 Sports.

title: Bust-A-Move '99
description: The learning curve on this addictive game isn't very steep, and most players will be having fun before they realize what's happening. The very basis of the game is that players must aim their bubble launcher (located at the bottom of the screen) up to the top of the screen toward other colored bubbles. If you match three or more of the same color, they'll vanish with a "pop" from playing field. Of course, the playing field marches down at a steady pace, so players will have to keep popping bubbles at a steady pace. When you play alone the bubbles you pop with your random bubble-emitting launcher vanish forever. If you're playing against an opponent, the popped bubbles will suddenly appear on their screen. Playing puzzles where you're the only player on the screen is enjoyable and a good way to practice, but the real fun begins when you play against a computer opponent or even better, a human opponent. This is one of those games that you sit down to play for a few hours and before you know it the sun's coming up.
platforms: N64 PS Arcade SNES NDS NG 3DO GG

title: Rampage 2: Universal Tour
description: Apparently Scumlabs International just doesn't learn. With its original three nemeses in custody, the evil corporation has accidentally created three monsters in their places, each with its own special move. Choose between Boris (a mighty rhino with a sharp horn), Curtis (a speedy mouse), and Ruby (a strong and agile lobster), as you roam the planet in search of the original three monsters. Kicking and stomping your way across the globe, you'll come across civilians, police, armies, and more in each of the 125 distinct environments. Once you clear about 75 levels, you'll unlock your old friends, George, Lizzy, and Ralph only to meet yet another obstacle: alien invasion! Actually the third installment in this popular series, RAMPAGE 2: Universal Tour offers the same style of gameplay as its predecessors. New characters, a new story, and improved graphics, however, set it apart. The N64 version supports up to three players.

title: Rampage 2: Universal Tour
description: Three more monsters have been created by a radioactive goop. Now, they want to free their friends who have been captured. You take the role of either Boris, a strong Rhino; Ruby, a quick lobster; or Curtis, a well-balanced rat. In order to free George, Lizzy, and Ralf (the characters from the original game) you will have to travel to New York, Tokyo, and London. Along the way, you will have to destroy building and avoid the human defenses in 25 levels of smashing action. As the game progresses, full-motion video segments explain the storyline. You can have two of your friends join the action via a multitap. Will the new monsters be able to rescue their friends? You can help them by playing RAMPAGE 2: Universal Tour.

title: Army Men II
description: In Army Men II, you command Sarge, a hard-nosed soldier who can not only handle every weapon known to man but also drive any manner of military vehicle (including PT Boats). You view the action from a top-down perspective and guide Sarge using the keyboard and/or the mouse. You can also order specific units or groups of units to attack, defend, hold position, or rally around you. Improved features to Army Men II include new weapons, including the super-cool magnifying glass, an M80, and an aerosol can that can be used with lighters to do lots of wonderful damage. Sarge also gets to tote around a sniper rifle, which is perhaps the best weapon in the game.

title: T'ai Fu: Wrath of the Tiger
description: After having been oppressed by dragons for his entire life, T'ai Fu, a young tiger with martial arts skills, seeks revenge on the dragons. You must guide the young warrior through 24 levels, all rendered in 3D, ranging from jungles and swamps to temples. While on his adventure, T'ai Fu will be able to learn new moves like roll attacks, super jumps, and fireballs from the various masters he encounters. He will need these attacks to defeat the various enemies that he will face in some cases, three at a time. As the game progresses further, every move will be used to solve puzzles and navigate the increasingly treacherous terrain. Help get justice for the Tiger clan in T'AI FU: Wrath of the Tiger.

title: RollerCoaster Tycoon
description: Roller Coaster Tycoon is all about getting people into your amusement park and emptying their pockets as you show them a good time. Park-goers come in with about $70 apiece, and you can set prices for general admission, for each different ride, and concessions like soda pop, hamburgers, park maps, and umbrellas. You can even charge people for using the rest rooms, but if you charge too much people will simply refuse to pay and make a mess outside. The rides themselves come in several flavors -- simple attractions like Ferris Wheels and Haunted Houses, and the more elaborate tracked rides, like log runs, miniature trains, monorails and of course roller coasters, that can be hand-designed to fit the local terrain or built from a default plan.

title: Motorhead [1998]
description: Get ready for some insanely fast racing with MOTORHEAD. Hop into one of 10 streamlined racers and test your skills on eight obstacle-filled courses that wind through urban, desert, and seaside terrain. Play modes include the standard Time Attack, Single Race, League, and Head-to-Head competition found in any racing game. This futuristic racer has lavish visuals and cleverly designed vehicles that help put you in a futuristic state of mind.
rating_content: Suitable for Persons Ages Six and Older

title: Grand Theft Auto: London 1969
description: While expansion packs have been common on the PC, there has never been adequate technology for expansion disks on a console. GRAND THEFT AUTO: London 1969 changes that, as it's the first expansion pack to hit a console (you must own the original GRAND THEFT AUTO to play London 1969). As an expansion for the popular GRAND THEFT AUTO, London 1969 places you as a small time hood in swinging London. You must complete simple tasks as you move through the various levels of the British underworld. However, most of the tasks require pilfering automobiles. Keep in mind that you are in London, so the driver enters and exits on the right, and you'll want to stay on the left side of the road to avoid the coppers. All of the music and voices of the original game have been replaced with British rock and slang from the era to further thrust the player into 1969 London. Anyone who enjoyed the original GRAND THEFT AUTO should rush out and buy London 1969.

title: Interplay Sports Baseball 2000
description: Many gamers and publications called the original INTERPLAY SPORTS BASEBALL the best hardball venture ever to hot the PC, and the follow-up is even better. You'll have access to all the MLB teams and players, and all rosters are up-to-date. Loaded up with more than 10,000 statistics and 700 new character animations, the game plays just like the real thing. A new pitcher status screen allows you to evaluate your hurler's state of being, and awesome 3D graphics deliver an extra punch. Up to eight players can get in on the big-league fun.

title: Street Fighter Alpha 3
description: Capcom brings its arcade hit STREET FIGHTER ALPHA 3 to the PlayStation. All of the characters from the previous games in the ALPHA series have returned, while many old favorites like Guile, E. Honda, Blanka, Balrog, Dee Jay, and Fei Long make their fist appearance in the ALPHA series. There are also four new characters: Karin Kanzuki, Rainbow Mika, Juli, and Juni, making 34 characters in all. Further, each character has three different fighting styles, meaning you'll have your hands full if you want to master this game. If you're looking for a perfect translation of the arcade version of the game, look no further than the Arcade mode. In order to earn new skills for each character's fighting style, play the World Tour mode. If you play the game well, you can unlock other modes including Team Battle, Survival, Dramatic Battle Plus, and Final Battle. Try to become the ultimate fighter with STREET FIGHTER ALPHA 3.
platforms: PS DC DC GBA PSP Arcade PSP PS3 Saturn

title: Ken Griffey Jr.'s Slugfest
description: Angel Studios has developed another baseball game for the Nintendo 64, called KEN GRIFFEY JR.'S SLUGFEST. The game plays with a simulation feel, though there is still a fast, arcade feel to the batting interface and fielding. There is an official Major League Baseball license, meaning that every team and stadium is represented. The graphics are all in full 3D, with a high-resolution graphics mode possible with the use of the Expansion Pak. The visuals are very impressive, featuring realistic player animations and fluid movement. The game includes numerous modes such as Exhibition, Season, World Series, and Home Run Derby. In addition, the game supports up to four players at once for big multiplayer games. You'll also find plenty of other options in the game, such as the Create-A-Player mode. KEN GRIFFEY JR.'S SLUGFEST on the Nintendo 64 offers arcade-style action with a simulation feel that results in a simple yet deep baseball experience.

title: Point Blank 2
description: Considered by many to the best light-gun game on the PlayStation, POINT BLANK 2 will impress gamers with a variety of play modes and high replay value. Some of the modes include Point Blank Castle (competition mode), Theme Park Mode (a quest mode), and Party Mode (multiplayer). You'll also come across clever puzzles such as one in which you shoot the cork off a champagne bottle and defuse a time bomb. The Vandal levels have expanded as well; now you shoot out neon signs in Tokyo and destroy a house and tractor with rapid fire. You'll even have the opportunity to shear sheep with a gun! Up to four players can compete at once via the multitap.

title: Ehrgeiz: God Bless the Ring
description: The worlds's most brutal tournament has as its trophy the legendary weapon 'EHRGEIZ'. Now, fighters from around the world assemble to claim this prize and its mysterious power. Compete in three intense playing modes with over 10 playable charaters (plus a cast of hidden characters, and even favorites from Final Fantasy VII) in multi-level battle arenas featuring a complete 360-degree range of motion. Ehrgeiz also features four mini-game tests as well as a full-featured RPG Adventure where you decend into ever-challenging random dungeon layouts in search of treasure, ever-stronger weapons, and answers.

title: R4: Ridge Racer Type 4
description: The Ridge Racer series has always been about arcade style racing excitement. R4: Ridge Racer Type 4 keeps the arcade style intact with all of the powerslides and spinouts fans of the series have come to expect. You take the role of a professional driver in the Grand Prix mode. Pick one of four teams and one of four car manufacturers, and then race on eight tracks. Each team has its own storyline that plays out between races in conversations with your team liaison, and how well you finish changes what the liaison says to you. To advance through the races, you must finish in third or higher on the first two tracks, while the second two require at least second place, and you must win the last four races outright. Try to keep your car under control and win the championship for your team in R4: Ridge Racer Type 4.

title: Extreme Rodeo
description: Saddle up and prepare yourself for the wildest video game this side of the Mississippi. Try your hand at six real rodeo events, including calf-roping, bull-riding, barrel racing, and others. There are 35 different animals to wrangle in this smorgasbord of activity, and you can even choose to play as the bull. A half-dozen venues will take you to places like Butte, Mesquite, Castle Rock, and Boomerang each of which has its own obstacles and features. You'll have your choice of riders from an esteemed group of 20 pros, and up to eight players can compete.This budget-priced rodeo game was released in two packages -- one featured the license of the magazine Horse Illustrated, and the second featured the license of the feed supplier Farnam. Aside from minor license changes, the titles are the same game.

title: Extreme Bullrider
description: Join eight-time World Champion Bullrider, Don Gay, for this all-inclusive riding experience. Choose your rider from a selection of 20 of the top pros, and then decide which of the 10 bulls in the pen you'd like to take for a spin. Each bull has an overall challenge rating allowing you to gauge what you're getting into before you get into it and the overall skill level of the game can be changed at any time. The game's six arenas will take you to New Mexico, California, Texas, Wyoming, Oklahoma, and Montana. Up to eight players can enjoy the action.

title: Pokemon Stadium 2 [Japanese Version]
description: Second Pokemon Stadium game released in the Japanese market -- localized as Pokemon Stadium in the US. The original Pokemon Stadium (not available in the US) was released in August 1998 in Japan. It was a limited game that featured less than half of the 151 Game Boy creatures. It shipped with the 64GB Pak (Transfer Pak) packed in. Then Nintendo released this, better version of the game in April 1999, called Pokemon Stadium 2. The "2" in the title is a bit misleading, as it's actually just an expanded version of the original. PokeSta 2 features ALL 151 Pokemon, mini-games and more. In March 2000, Nintendo finally released Pokemon Stadium in the US. Although the game is just called Pokemon Stadium, it is actually an enhanced version of the Japanese Pokemon Stadium 2. Nintendo added a Gallery mode, Pikachu voices and changed around the tournaments in the Stadium Mode.

title: Apache Havoc: Enemy Engaged
description: When two awesome helicopters battle it out for supremacy, you'll bet sparks are going to fly. Take off in your AH-64D toward enemy skies to help the Chinese win the great Opium War over the Thai, journey to the Caspian Sea to stop Georgian forces from wrangling control of the world's oil, and more. Packed with various missions and tons of gameplay options, APACHE HAVOC is the most fun you'll ever have with a flight simulator: The game takes realistic physics and combines them with intense showdowns and objectives to deliver a hard-hitting package like no other!

title: Microsoft Baseball 2000
description: One of the world's largest software manufacturers delivers a curveball with this one-of-a-kind Major League title. Choose your team and set out through the entirety of the regular season trying to earn a shot at a World Series ring. All of the big league clubs and players are here, as are the real stadiums, uniforms, and logos of each professional franchise. Create custom players, play GM and execute a few trades, or let the computer handle the strategy so you can concentrate on your home run swing. Now, this is baseball for the new millennium.

title: NBA In the Zone '99
description: Konami returns to the world of basketball videogames with NBA IN THE ZONE '99, which includes all of the teams and players from the league. While all of the standard gameplay modes like Exhibition, Season, and Playoffs are included, two modes have been added:  Slam Dunk Challenge and Three-Point Shootout. In the Slam Dunk Challenge, you choose the difficulty of your dunk and must memorize a series of button presses. The score for the dunk is determined by how well you recreate the button sequence. The Three-Point Shootout calls for you to stop a power bar in one of three locations to get the ball to go through the hoop. You have 60 seconds to shoot 25 balls, so you've got to be efficient if you want to win. No matter how you like your hoops action, you're sure to find what you want with NBA IN THE ZONE '99.

title: Hello Kitty's Cube Frenzy
description: Hello Kitty makes her first appearance on the PlayStation with HELLO KITTY'S CUBE FRENZY. The objective of each stage is simple: Kitty must collect all of the items scattered throughout each level. However, you can only tell Kitty to move left or right, and if you aren't careful, Kitty will fall off the edge and say hello to the Grim Reaper. Luckily, blocks fall from the sky and can be rotated and placed to create staircases and bridges to the objects. However, placing three blocks with identical colors next to each other will make the blocks disappear, which can both help and hurt. In addition to the block problems, Badz Maru, Hanamaru, and Pandaba will wander around the level and cause problems for Hello Kitty. Can you handle the pressure and collect all of the items in HELLO KITTY'S CUBE FRENZY?

title: Chameleon Twist 2
description: Davy is back in the Land of Wonder and he's ready for some action. Although always happy to visit, Davy is anxious to get back home. In CHAMELEON TWIST 2 his trip isn't any easier this time than it was in the first game. Luckily he's still got his multipurpose tongue, which serves as both a weapon and a mode of travel. When his enemies get a little too close he can roll out his tongue and let loose with Single Spit, Shishkabob, or Machine Gun attacks. If the action gets too hot, Davy can always wrap his tongue around him like armor, or he can beat a hasty retreat by simply reaching out with his oversized tongue and swinging out of the scene. New options available in CHAMELEON TWIST 2 include parasol gliding, which can keep you out of harm's way or put you smack dab in the middle of the action. If you pick up the needed tokens along your journey you can also take a break from the action with some fun mini-games like Bowling and Gymnastics. They can provide a welcome break after long stretches of swinging around by your tongue.

title: Super Smash Bros.
description: Four-player action fighter, starring 12 Nintendo mascots, including Mario, Luigi, Fox, Link, Samus, Pikachu, Jigglypuff and Captain Falcon. All the action takes place on one screen, from a zoomed out third-person perspective more reminiscent of old-school platformers than traditional fighting games. The premise is as simple as the controls. Beat up you opponents and knock them off the fighting platform to score a point. The more damage your opponents sustain, the farther you can throw them. Apart from the quick, but explosive mayhem that ensues when more than one player has at it, the game manages to bring back many fond gaming memories by bombarding players with familiar items, power-ups and many classic tunes.

title: Requiem: Avenging Angel
description: Requiem: Avenging Angel is a 3D first-person action experience of biblical proportions. Requiem takes the holy battle between Heaven's chosen soldiers and Hell's fallen demons to new extremes. You play the role of Malachi, a loyal angel, blasting through futuristic settings; meeting other characters; and developing angelic powers like: possession, flight, Bloodboil, and the ability to turn enemies to salt.
rating_content: Blood, Gore, Animated Violence, Strong Language

title: Commandos: Beyond the Call of Duty
description: The Nazis are invading Europe, and you've got to help the Allied forces stop the terrifying bunch before it's too late. The game's original six heroes are back for more action, aided by two new characters a Yugoslav military officer and a member of the Dutch Resistance. You'll begin each game ranked as a sergeant, trying to elevate your status to that of Field Marshal by game's end. Each stunningly detailed mission can only be accomplished by using each of the eight commandos' skills properly, requiring as much patience as combat skills.Commandos: Beyond the Call of Duty is essentially a mission add-on pack for Commandos: Behind Enemy Lines, adding eight more missions, some new weapons and a higher graphics resolution. This game is sold as a stand-alone product, so you won't need the original Commandos to play.

title: 3 Xtreme
description: Find out if you have what it takes to win! Race through one of 3 Xtreme's 32 tracks at breakneck speed. You'll have tons of jumps, gates, and other objects to work with as you make an effort to finish first. Choose from one of 12 hardcore skaters and over 70 skateboards to lead you to the ultimate victory. 3 Xtreme also gives you the chance to impress your friends by performing various tricks such as can-cans, tabletops, tail whips, peg slides, kick flips, methods, tail grabs, rail slides, and countless others. But why settle for a single trick when you can perform thousands of combos and rack up maximum points (you need points to upgrade equipment)? Also available are gameplay options such as season, freestyle, time trial, and exhibition. Each of these offers loads of fun for even the tamest gamer. If you're lucky enough to own a Dual Shock controller, then this game will truly take you to the extreme.

title: Bottom of the 9th
description: Bottom of the 9th , the first attempt from Konami, is missing one major element that fans look for in a baseball game: The MLB license. Bottom of the 9th does not have real teams, however, you cannot ride this entertaining game off, quite yet. The MLBPA license is present and with a good cross between realism and arcade style, Bottom of the 9th can capture any baseball fan. A few features this game presents that others don?t include: scenarios from past baseball seasons and a training mode to help the beginners learn the ropes. Bottom of the 9th may not be the leader in baseball for the N64, but it should compete very well.

title: Civilization: Call to Power
description: You'd seen eras of empires rise and fall in Civilization and Civilization II, but time will never forget the tremendous scale of 7,000 years of history contained in Civilization: Call to Power. Covering approximately 4,000 BC to 3,000 AD, this turn-based strategy world-builder lets you command your civilization to power using nearly all aspects of global history from mankind's earliest technology to futuristic advances.Civilization: Call to Power incorporates numerous modifications over the earlier game, with improved graphics and interface. The game covers the whole period of human civilization from 4000 BC to beyond the present and it is possible to take your civilization into space. There is a large choice of historically-based races to choose from or you can create your own. The multi-player mode enables games via LAN to Net connection.

title: Reah
description: Reah: Face the Unknown is a first person perspective puzzle oriented adventure game for Windows 95/98. The player takes on the role of a reporter who is a little too curious for his own good, now trapped in another world -- a place called Reah, formerly an inhospitable planet that was colonized with great difficulty in order to secretly investigate an alien artifact, a teleportation gateway. The gateway originally linked the planet Reah with its sister planet, which was radically different, inhabited by some very strange beings. A group of scientists had set up a small research colony on the other side, and you were offered the chance to visit it and break the great discovery to the world. But the gateway had become unstable, and as soon as you had crossed over, the gateway disappeared, leaving you in a desert, standing in front of the walls of a strange city. Now you must face the unknown if you hope to ever get back home...

title: Dead in the Water
description: Dead in the Water is all about the thrills, chills, and spills of powerboat racing. Choose from 14 different boats, and then hit one of the nine courses, each with unique obstacles, conditions, and jumps. After winning a race, upgrade your weapons to keep a tactical advantage over the competition. If racing for speed is not your style, play the battle mode and try to destroy all of your opponents. Thanks to the realistic water physics, swells will throw your boat into the air, currents will affect your speed based on their direction, and landing hard after a jump will put the boat under water and cause a major slowdown. Can you handle all of the action of Dead in the Water?

title: Pac-Land
description: In Pac-Land, our friend Pac-Man is facing more daring adventures than ever before! In his new contest, Pac-Man comes face-to-face with ghosts on their own turf. In this 2D platforming adventure, his quiet day at home is disturbed by those nasty specters. A fairy princess has been kidnapped, and Pac-Man must leap over rivers, avoid dangerous water spouts, fly in magic shoes, dodge the Hoppers from the bushes, skip past the skulls aiming to drag you to Sand Prison -- all in the aims of reaching Monster Mansion and rescuing the princess to restore peace in Pac-Land!
platforms: Lynx NES TG16 Wii U CPC Arcade PC

title: MechWarrior 3
description: The third game in the popular MechWarrior series. Massive Mechs, awesome firepower, and 3D action combine in MechWarrior 3. MechWarrior 3 is a quantum upgrade on all fronts from the excellent MechWarrior 2, which is saying quite a bit. The tremendous attention to detail in the graphics, gameplay and virtually every other aspect makes this one of the best games of the 1990s, let alone 1999. It is the graphics that will initially grab you and pull you in. Flowing landscapes and wonderful animation are all well and good but MechWarrior 3 goes one better. Shoot off an enemy Mech?s leg and you?ll see the pieces go flying as the enemy crashes to the ground. Drop a Smoke Jaguar tank and you?ll marvel at the intricate explosion. This is good stuff.

title: Star Trek: The Next Generation: Birth of the Federation
description: In this turn-based strategy game, players must satisfy two essential criteria: one, be familiar with and enthusiastic about the Star Trek: The Next Generation series, and, two, enjoy micro-management carried out on a very large scale. From morale impacts, trade routes and new systems to explore and exploit to energy management, construction and ship building (more than 50 models), this game is filled with literally dozens of multi-faceted aspects to control that require seamless integration and interaction in order to achieve success. Challenging gameplay, attention to detail, intelligent decision-making and a sense of adventure are needed for Star Trek: The Next Generation - Birth of the Federation.

title: Bloody Roar II: The New Breed
description: BLOODY ROAR II continues the fight started in BLOODY ROAR. This time, seven more characters have joined in the fight. By transforming into the Spirit Animal of each character, you'll be able to pummel your opponents into the ground. If the regular combos aren't good enough for you, play the Custom mode to unlock the hidden powers of each character, or create custom combos for your personal use. If laying the smack down doesn't satisfy your animal instincts, play the Story mode and learn each character's unique background. With all of the options and action, BLOODY ROAR II will bring out the beast in you.
rating_content: Animated Blood, Animated Violence, Suggestive Themes

title: Grand Theft Auto: London 1969
description: The first expansion pack for the PC has arrived with GRAND THEFT AUTO: London 1969 (you must own the original GRAND THEFT AUTO to play). You are a small-time hood looking to get ahead in London by tackling a wide range of missions, including bombings and contract killings. Every aspect of London in the late ‘60s has been recreated, giving you a sense of what it was like back then. If you enjoyed the action of GRAND THEFT AUTO, then pick up the London 1969 expansion. It will be worth the trip.

title: Quake II
description: After years of waging war against the alien aggressors, Earth is on the verge of being completely annihilated. One last effort to bring the mass destruction to an end is underway. You are part of a secret assault force sent to fight your way through heavily fortified military installations in order to lower the aliens defenses and shut down their war machine. Only then can Earth hope to launch an air assault. Only then will the fate of all humanity be known. Welcome to Quake II.
platforms: N64 PC GP32 PC PC PS Mac PC Web

title: Bugs Bunny: Lost in Time
description: Bugs Bunny makes his first appearance on the PlayStation with BUGS BUNNY LOST IN TIME. In this adventure, Bugs has accidentally sent himself back in time while preparing for a relaxing vacation in Pismo Beach. To get back to the present, the brave bunny must collect clocks that have been scattered throughout 21 levels of platform jumping action. The levels take place in five different time periods that include the Stone Age, Medieval Times, the Pirate Years, the 1930s, and Dimension X. Each time period has a nasty enemy Elmer Fudd, Witch Hazel, Yosemite Sam, and Marvin the Martian who is trying to keep Bugs from going home. Will the comedic genius of Bugs Bunny be lost in time forever? Play BUGS BUNNY LOST IN TIME and find out.

title: Fighting Force 64
description: Dr. Dex Zeng decides to destroy the world himself after his predictions of the world's doom fail to materialize. You take control of Hawk Manson, Ben "Smasher" Jackson, Mace Daniels, or Alana McKendrick as you battle through 25 stages in seven expansive levels (some with branching paths), using each character's unique moves and combinations. You will need every one of those unique moves, since up to five enemies may attack at once. To keep the action moving at a furious pace, you can pick up pipes, guns, knives, soda machines (and anything that might be lying around) and use them as weapons. For maximum carnage, tell a friend to use an extra controller and double-team Zeng's minions. Zeng is out to destroy the world; will you be able to stop him in time in FIGHTING FORCE 64?
platforms: N64 PC PSP PS3 Saturn PS

title: Austin Powers Operation: Trivia
description: Shagadelic! See how smart you really are in this white-knuckle trivia test, featuring everyone's favorite psychedelic superhero. Put your knowledge of pop culture from the last 40 years through the wringer attempting to best your friends or the computer. You can team up with either Austin Powers or the infamous Dr. Evil, answering hundreds of groovy questions. Real video gives the game the look and feel of the feature film series, and creative questions will have you laughing up a storm. Are you smart enough to save the world? Yeah, baby!

title: Superman [1999]
description: When Lex Luthor decides to envelop Metropolis in a Kryptonite cloud, Lois tries to step in and stop him. Of course, Luthor kidnaps Superman's love and hides her away. Can you get her back to safety? Set over multiple 3D environments, the game requires the use of all of Superman's special powers. There are a host of enemies standing in your way, and each level and scenario is based on the hit Warner Bros. cartoon series that chronicles the adventures of the Man of Steel.

title: A Bug's Life
description: Based on the hit Disney or Pixar (creators of the TOY STORY films) movie, A Bug's Life for the Nintendo 64 brings all of the magic of the film home to your favorite console system. Join Flik and friends in a grueling battle to save the anthill from the evil and overpowering grasshoppers, which are hell-bent on taking over not only the ant colony, but also all of your food. A Bug's Life features real voice samples from the movie, so it's like actually playing the animated flick. With over 15 levels, three hidden stages, and 60 exclusive Nintendo 64 challenges, A Bug's Life is the ultimate family adventure for kids ages 2-to-72.
platforms: N64 PS GBC PC PS3 PSP PC

title: Castrol Honda Superbike Racing
description: CASTROL HONDA SUPERBIKE RACING brings the thrills and challenges of driving a Honda RC45 to the PlayStation. Before taking on live competition, pick a bike and customize it. Since taking a corner too quickly will cause the bike to slide out from underneath you, use the Practice mode to learn how to stay on the bike--and on the track. When you are ready, tackle a single race on one of the 14 real-world tracks for a quick racing fix, or experience the ups and downs of a full season. After winning the championship, challenge your friends to a race to determine who is the master of the track. All your driving skills will be tested in CASTROL HONDA SUPERBIKE RACING.
rating_content: Suitable for Persons Ages Six and Older

title: Centipede [1999]
description: Enter the world of the Wee People and do your best to save them from the QueenPede, who will stop at nothing to destroy this peaceful race of humanoids. In this remake of the classic Atari game, players take the role of Wally, the village's humble bean counter, as he is quickly recruited to man the village bug shooter and sent off to save the colony from the ruthless QueenPede and her destructive subjects -- the spiders, scorpions, and fleas -- as she sets out to conquer the peaceful wee people. Work your way through all-new 3D worlds with new weapons and skills. And if you're really good, you might just discover the original Centipede.
platforms: PS DC PSP Mac PC PS3

title: Star Wars: Episode I: The Phantom Menace
description: Following the plot of the movie, Star Wars: Episode I: The Phantom Menace lets you fight through 11 levels of action. At various points in the game you will get to take control of Obi-Wan Kenobi, Qui-Gon Jinn, Queen Amidala, and Captain Panaka. Each character has a special ability or weapon to use: Obi-Wan and Qui-Gon use lightsabers and force powers, Queen Amidala's blaster can stun druids, and Captain Panaka uses a Naboo blaster. While working through each level, you can pick up new weapons like light-repeating blasters, blaster rifles, proton missile launchers, heavy blasters, thermal detonators, Gungan energy balls, flash grenades, and heavy repeating cannons. If you've seen the movie, you'll have a pretty good idea of what to expect. See if you can free Naboo from the treacherous trade federation in Star Wars: Episode I: The Phantom Menace.

title: Star Wars: Episode I: Racer
description: Imagine Ben Hur in a galaxy far, far away. Replace the two-wheeled carriage with a futuristic, hovering pod -- now take away the horses and strap two giant afterburner-powered engines to the vehicle. The boost of the two fuselages pulls the carriage forward at speeds in excess of 600mph and a stream of pure energy, called a mag beam or coupler, makes sure that the engines don't fly off in opposite directions. Like its "real," up to 40-foot-long counterparts in the movie, Racer's pods use a three-point dynamics system that will cause the carriage to realistically drift in the air behind its two engines. Unlike the movie, which features 18 opposing racers, Episode I Racer stars more than 21 characters complete with their rides, including three pods based on original design concepts that weren't used in the final film.
platforms: PC GBC Mac DC PS N64

title: Alexi Lalas International Soccer
description: ALEXI LALAS INTERNATIONAL SOCCER focuses on gameplay. Players can manage the tactics and strategies of their team with ease--you make all the important decisions. If the need arises, players can also create their own formations to exploit the weaknesses of the other team. All of the subtleties of soccer are here including 250 motion-captured animations. Along with excellent gameplay, there are tons of game options available: pick one of 70 real-world teams and play in a tournament to claim domination, or play a friendly match to get a quick soccer fix; play in a day game or night game; play with Alexi or against him. ALEXI LALAS INTERNATIONAL SOCCER will help you see why soccer is the most popular sport in the world.

title: Awesome Golf
description: You are on the 18th tee, one stroke begind the defending champion. Do you take your caddy's advice and play it safe or do you risk the water? Awesome Golf provides great realism and a challenge for one to four players.

title: Basketbrawl
description: Vinne and Slash are bleeding from knife wounds and the ref is out cold! No wonder the gang members nicknamed this game "Basketbrawl." To them, it's not a game -- it's a street fight. This premise kicks off Atari's action sports game for up to two players. The objective in Basketbrawl is to become the baddest gang in the town by winning the Basketbrawl tournament. To win, you must play three games against each of the five gangs in your city.  Each time you move up to the next gang, you will play a team with more players and more dangerous weapons. Each game lasts six minutes -- out score you opponent  by shooting more baskets. Each basket is worth two points. If the game is tied after six minutes, the first team to score wins.

title: Warzone 2100
description: Set amidst the shattered wastes of a society that has destroyed itself by the year 2085, players must construct a base, weapons, tanks and more. Once they've built up a vast army, the objective becomes simple: Destroy all of your enemies and take control of the planet. A real-time strategy game with a vast selection of technology and units and a real time 3D Camera. Unit types include tanks, hovercraft, VTOLs (aircraft), cyborg infantry, and weapons such as rockets, mortars, machine guns, cannons, and cluster bombs that can be fitted to the designs you create.

title: Batman Returns
description: Oswald Cobblepot, better known as The Penguin, has just ruined Gotham City's gala Christmas party. Now The Penguin and Catwoman are terrorizing the city. In a flash Bruce Wayne changes into the world's most famous super-hero, Batman! He revs up his Batmobile and races out in hot pursuit of his mortal enemies. But is it too late? Batman Returns is an action adventure in which you must guide the famed Caped Crusader through Gotham City as he tries to defeat The Penguin and Catwoman.
